				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics" >ACADEMICS</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral" >DOCTORAL</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/phd-program" >PHD PROGRAM &amp; TIMELINE</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Admissions                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-63151" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Admission to the Ph.D. program in the Study of Religion at Harvard is very competitive: typically only 5-6% of all applicants are admitted. Basic requirements, as a minimum, include a bachelor's degree, or its equivalent, with an undergraduate record of outstanding quality - a previous master's degree is not required, but it is the rare, exceptional student who is admitted without one. Similarly, while a previous major in the field of religion is not required, the applicant's background in this and related subjects is a critical consideration.</p><h4><strong>Application may only be made through the Graduate School of Arts and Sciences.</strong> For detailed requirements and to apply online, please go to: <a href="http://www.gsas.harvard.edu/prospective_students/application_instructions_and_information.php">The Graduate School of Arts and Sciences, Harvard University, Religion</a>.</h4><p>Applicants must submit: current GRE scores; TOEFL scores if a non-native English speaker unless the applicant holds a B.A. degree (or equivalent degree) from an English-speaking university; note that for the Ph.D. in Religion, the minimum TOEFL scores are 620 for the paper-based test, or 105 for the Internet-based test. In addition, applicants must submit an abstract of courses, three letters of recommendation, a Statement of Purpose outlining their proposed project, and a writing sample of no more than 10 pages (2500 words).</p><p>The annual application deadline to the Study of Religion is in mid-December. Please see the Graduate School of Arts and Sciences for the exact deadline for your year of application. If you anticipate needing assistance with any portion of the application, please contact the Admissions Office well in advance of the deadline. We do not offer rolling admissions and we do not offer on-line study programs, also known as "distance learning" programs.</p><p>Please note the research fields listed on our site are the current fields of study. The Committee on the Study of Religion admits students to the doctoral program who have clearly defined intellectual interests. <strong>Applicants should choose only <em>one</em> area of specialization from the list.</strong> There may be cases where students' interests span two fields: in such a case a student - for example, interested in Buddhism in America - may be referred to readers in two fields, in this case Buddhist Studies and Religions of the Americas. Applicants must clearly explain their interdisciplinary interests in their statement of purpose and also state which field would be their primary field.  If you find your particular field of interest is not on the GSAS site please contact us.</p><p>All doctoral applicants are expected to have foundational language skills needed for primary research (textual or ethnographic) in the area of specialization (Greek, Hebrew, Latin, Sanskrit, Arabic, Chinese, etc.) at the time of application. In addition, admitted students must demonstrate reading competence in two modern languages of secondary scholarship relevant to their course of study. These languages are determined in consultation with an adviser after admission to the program.</p><p> </p><h2>FUNDING</h2><p> </p><p>All admitted students receive the same financial aid: five years of tuition and fee assistance plus stipend, including summer stipends after years one through four. The stipend in years three and four is primarily underwritten by Teaching Fellowships. The fifth year of funding is intended for a student's final year in order to complete the dissertation.</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-31161"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics"  class="active-trail active">Academics</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31166"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/undergraduate" >Undergraduate</a></li><li class="last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-31171"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral"  class="active-trail active">Doctoral</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-3 menu-item-31306"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/phd-program"  class="active-trail active">PhD Program &amp; Timeline</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32681"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral-advising" >Advising</a></li><li class="menu-depth-4 menu-item-32586"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/years-1-%26-2" >Years 1 &amp; 2</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32631"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-3-general-exams" >Year 3: General Exams</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32656"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-3-%26-4-teaching" >Year 3 &amp; 4: Teaching</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32661"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-4-dissertation-prospectus" >Year 4: Dissertation Prospectus</a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32666"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-5-the-dissertation" >Year 5 &amp; up: The Dissertation</a></li></ul></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-33061"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/links-doctoral-students" >Links for Doctoral Students</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-32971"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/faqs-doctoral" >FAQ&#039;s: Doctoral</a></li><li class="last collapsed menu-depth-3 menu-item-31311"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/thd-program" >ThD Program</a></li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1472248730" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_media"  module="boxes" delta="1472248730"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Doctoral Program Calendar</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1472248730' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id="file-697671" class="file file-html file-html-embed">

          <h2 class="element-invisible"><a href="">fd67661077608f54d6ac9d4470ac003a</a></h2>
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="file-info"></div><div class="field field-name-field-html-code field-type-text-long field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><iframe src="https://calendar.google.com/calendar/embed?showTitle=0&amp;showNav=0&amp;showPrint=0&amp;showCalendars=0&amp;showTz=0&amp;mode=AGENDA&amp;height=600&amp;wkst=1&amp;bgcolor=%23cccccc&amp;src=harvard.edu_tdumcqt6psi863e4fqd2re2tek%40group.calendar.google.com&amp;color=%23cccccc&amp;src=9qpvg4b8brruceh6v118kbht2k%40group.calendar.google.com&amp;color=%23cccccc&amp;ctz=America%2FNew_York" style="border-width:0" width="260" height="600" frameborder="0" scrolling="no"></iframe></div></div></div>  </div>

		<footer id="footer" class="clearfix" role="contentinfo">

				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/undergraduate" >UNDERGRADUATE</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/about" >ABOUT</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Courses                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1408379148" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1408379148"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Courses Designed for Undergraduates</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1408379148' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	A full list of Undergraduate Courses for 2017-18 with descriptions can be found <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/2017-2018_relcoruses_long.pdf">here</a>. This list is updated as new courses are added.
</p>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-146421"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/undergraduate"  class="active-trail active">Undergraduate</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32966"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/faqs-undergraduate-program" >FAQ&#039;s: Undergraduate Program</a></li><li class="leaf active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-35426"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/courses"  class="active-trail active active">Courses</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32561"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/admission" >Concentrating</a></li><li class="collapsed menu-depth-2 menu-item-32581"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/advising" >Advising</a></li><li class="collapsed menu-depth-2 menu-item-32596"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/coursework" >Coursework</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-33086"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/links-undergraduates" >Resources for Undergraduates</a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-39351"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/beyond-harvard-0" >Beyond Harvard</a></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1373989095" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1373989095"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Concentration Questions?</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1373989095' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/courtney-bickel-lamberth">Director of Undergraduate Studies, Courtney Lamberth</a></p>
<p><a href="mailto:kstreet@fas.harvard.edu">Assistant Director of Undergraduate Studies, Kera Street</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1374077585" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374077585"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Courses</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374077585' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p></p>
<ul><li><strong><a href="https://my.harvard.edu/">my.harvard.edu</a> - for current students and faculty</strong><a href="http://coursecatalog.harvard.edu/icb/icb.do" target="_blank"></a></li>
<li><a href="http://coursecatalog.harvard.edu/icb/icb.do" target="_blank">Harvard University Course Catalog</a> - searchable database across schools</li>
<li><a href="http://www.registrar.fas.harvard.edu/faculty-staff/classrooms">FAS Course Meetings Location Report</a></li>
<li><strong>Historical: </strong><a href="http://www.registrar.fas.harvard.edu/courses-exams/courses-instruction/study-religion">FAS Registrar Courses of Instruction, The Study of Religion section</a></li>
</ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1364321266" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1364321266"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Words from our Students</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1364321266' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><address>"The structure of the concentration gives students a lot of flexibility and freedom to explore the religions and themes they're interested in. In my experience, the professors are also very involved and want to get to know you on a personal level, which is something you don't get in the larger concentrations." – Hebert, '13</address></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1374163646" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374163646"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Guides &amp; Handbooks</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374163646' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/religious_studies_guide_print_10-1-13.pdf">Guide to Writing in the Study of Religion</a></li>
<li><a href="http://writing.fas.harvard.edu/" target="_blank">Writing Resources at Harvard</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_handbook_2016-7_final_0.pdf">Undergraduate Handbook</a> (2016-17)</li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/senior_thesis_handbook_2015-16_student.pdf">Senior Thesis Handbook</a> (2015-16)</li>
</ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>

			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-info" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_info no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_info"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_info' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h1><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >Committee on the Study of Religion</a></h1>
    
    <p>
    </p></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>					  					  <div class="region region-header-third"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-secondary-menu" class="block block-os no-title"  module="os" delta="secondary-menu"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

</div>

menu-path-node-61716   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/religions-americas"  title="">Religions of the Americas</a></li><li class="menu-3293 menu-path-node-61726   odd 		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics" >ACADEMICS</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral" >DOCTORAL</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      FAQ's: Doctoral                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1374174018" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_sv_list_box no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1374174018"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374174018' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id='box-1374174018-page' data-page='0' data-delta='1374174018' class='os-sv-list os_sv_list_box sv-list-faq sv-list-view-teaser sv-list-layout-list sv-grid-3'><article id="node-64156" class="node node-faq node-teaser article clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  
      <header class="toggle node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/what-required-application-doctoral-program" rel="bookmark" target="_top">What is required for application to the Ph.D. program?</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="os-slider node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><strong>T</strong>he program is highly competitive – we can accept only 5-7% of applicants to the PhD. For that reason, we look for the most capable applicants, with excellent credentials in all areas.</p>&#13;
<ul><li>A <strong>writing sample</strong> of no more than 10 pages in length.</li>&#13;
<li><strong>Transcripts</strong> from all undergraduate and graduate programs attended.</li>&#13;
<li><strong>Recommendations</strong> from three faculty members who can speak to your academic capabilities.</li>&#13;
<li><strong>GRE's</strong>. The basic exams (verbal, analytical, and math), but not any</li></ul><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/what-required-application-doctoral-program" class="node-readmore" target="_top">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about What is required for application to the Ph.D. program?</span></a></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-64161" class="node node-faq node-teaser article clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  
      <header class="toggle node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/masters-degree-required-application-doctoral-programs" rel="bookmark" target="_top">Is a Master's degree required for application?</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="os-slider node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>While a master's degree is not a requirement, it is a distinct advantage in the application process, and in fact, most students admitted to the Ph.D. program have already earned master's degrees. The background gained from one or two years of study beyond the undergraduate level allows a student to enter a doctoral program prepared to do the advanced work required for a Ph.D. Students with an undergraduate record of <em>high quality</em> and <em>extensive academic preparation relevant to their statement of purpose</em> may be admitted with only a B.A.</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-64171" class="node node-faq node-teaser article clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  
      <header class="toggle node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/what-most-important-application-process" rel="bookmark" target="_top">What is most important in the Ph.D. application process?</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="os-slider node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>It is very important that you write a clear and informative <strong>statement of purpose</strong>. You should be able to talk in some detail about your academic interests, what led you to them, and what you envision the focus of your program at Harvard would be. As much as possible, you should familiarize yourself with the faculty and resources at Harvard in your proposed area of study. Reviewers of your application will look for a good "fit" between what you want to do and what Harvard has to offer.<br /><br /><strong>Academic preparation</strong> is also extremely important, and reviewers</p> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/what-most-important-application-process" class="node-readmore" target="_top">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about What is most important in the Ph.D. application process?</span></a></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-64176" class="node node-faq node-teaser article clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  
      <header class="toggle node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/what-about-financial-aid" rel="bookmark" target="_top">What financial aid is available for doctoral students?</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="os-slider node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>All admissions decisions are made without knowing the financial need of the applicants, so that financial status plays no role in the assessment of one's suitability for admission. <a data-url="https://gsas.harvard.edu/financial-support/funding-aid" href="https://gsas.harvard.edu/financial-support/funding-aid" target="_blank" title="" target="_top">Please see the current standard funding package on the Graduate School of Arts and Sciences website.</a></p> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/what-about-financial-aid" class="node-readmore" target="_top">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about What financial aid is available for doctoral students?</span></a></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-64181" class="node node-faq node-teaser article clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  
      <header class="toggle node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/addition-harvards-financial-aid-are-there-other-fellowships-available" rel="bookmark" target="_top">In addition to Harvard's financial aid, are there other fellowships available?</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="os-slider node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Yes. Once you are a student, you are eligible to apply for a range of fellowships at various stages in your program, for example, summer language study grants, traveling fellowships for research abroad, other research grants, and dissertation completion fellowships.</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-64186" class="node node-faq node-teaser article clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  
      <header class="toggle node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/what-are-opportunities-teaching" rel="bookmark" target="_top">What are the opportunities for teaching?</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="os-slider node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>As part of the funding offered to admitted students, teaching fellowships are made available beginning in year three. Teaching experience is integral to the doctoral program. Teaching Fellowship positions are most often found through the Divinity School and in the Faculty of Arts and Sciences. Additional teaching opportunities include work as junior and senior tutors with small groups or individuals majoring in religion, as well as work with HarvardX and the Harvard Extension School. Every effort is made to give students the best information for securing these teaching</p> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/what-are-opportunities-teaching" class="node-readmore" target="_top">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about What are the opportunities for teaching?</span></a></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-64191" class="node node-faq node-teaser article clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  
      <header class="toggle node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/what-average-length-doctoral-programs-study-religion" rel="bookmark" target="_top">What is the average length of study for doctoral candidates?</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="os-slider node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Program guidelines stipulate that students should complete their degrees in seven years. Some students may complete their doctoral programs sooner. Various factors, such as language study or research abroad, will affect the length of a student's program.</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-86751" class="node node-faq node-teaser article clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  
      <header class="toggle node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/do-i-need-submit-my-gre-scores-application-deadline" rel="bookmark" target="_top">Do I need to submit my GRE scores by the application deadline?</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="os-slider node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Yes. Applications that do not have GRE scores are considered incomplete. Refer to the <a href="http://www.gsas.harvard.edu/prospective_students/application_instructions_and_information.php" data-url="http://www.gsas.harvard.edu/prospective_students/application_instructions_and_information.php" target="_top">GSAS Application Instructions</a> for more details on submitting scores.</p> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/do-i-need-submit-my-gre-scores-application-deadline" class="node-readmore" target="_top">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about Do I need to submit my GRE scores by the application deadline?</span></a></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-476446" class="node node-faq node-teaser article clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  
      <header class="toggle node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/do-i-need-mail-my-transcripts" rel="bookmark" target="_top">Do I need to mail my transcripts by the application deadline?</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="os-slider node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>When applying to the Doctoral Program, the Graduate School of Arts and Sciences requires that you upload a copy of your transcript from each college/university attended with your online application. An official transcript showing the conferral of the undergraduate degree is required to register in the Graduate School. An official transcript that differs from the application copy may bar an admitted candidate from registering.</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-598186" class="node node-faq node-teaser article clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  
      <header class="toggle node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/can-i-pursue-degree-law-and-study-religion" rel="bookmark" target="_top">Can I pursue a degree in Law and the Study of Religion?</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="os-slider node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Harvard offers a coordinated JD/PhD Program which is designed for students interested in completing interdisciplinary work and is founded on the belief that students’ legal studies and their arts and sciences graduate studies can be mutually enriched through this pursuit. Students completing the coordinated program receive a JD from Harvard Law School (HLS) and a PhD from the <a href="http://www.gsas.harvard.edu/" target="_top">Graduate School of Arts and Sciences</a> (GSAS). It is expected that these students will be strong candidates for teaching posts at law schools and in arts and sciences programs</p> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/can-i-pursue-degree-law-and-study-religion" class="node-readmore" target="_top">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about Can I pursue a degree in Law and the Study of Religion?</span></a></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-892626" class="node node-faq node-teaser article clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  
      <header class="toggle node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/when-are-stipends-disbursed" rel="bookmark" target="_top">When are stipends disbursed?</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="os-slider node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Incoming new graduate students receive their stipend disbursement on orientation day. Returning graduate students are issued stipend the first of September for the fall term. If you have not set up direct deposit, the check will be mailed on that date.</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-892836" class="node node-faq node-teaser article clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  
      <header class="toggle node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/how-does-my-advisor-lift-hold" rel="bookmark" target="_top">How does my advisor lift the "hold"?</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="os-slider node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Faculty advisors can<a href="http://about.my.harvard.edu/study-card-advisors" data-url="http://about.my.harvard.edu/study-card-advisors" target="_top"> review instruction here for lifting a registration hold</a>.</p> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/how-does-my-advisor-lift-hold" class="node-readmore" target="_top">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about How does my advisor lift the "hold"?</span></a></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-892841" class="node node-faq node-teaser article clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  
      <header class="toggle node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/what-are-family-accommodations-graduate-students" rel="bookmark" target="_top">What are "Family Accommodations" for graduate students?</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="os-slider node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>The Graduate School of Arts and Sciences offers accommodations to students who are anticipating the birth or adoption of a child. You may review the policy here: <strong><a href="https://gsas.harvard.edu/student-life/harvard-resources/parental-accommodation-and-financial-support" data-url="https://gsas.harvard.edu/student-life/harvard-resources/parental-accommodation-and-financial-support" target="_top">https://gsas.harvard.edu/student-life/harvard-resources/parental-accommodation-and-financial-support</a></strong></p> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/what-are-family-accommodations-graduate-students" class="node-readmore" target="_top">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about What are "Family Accommodations" for graduate students?</span></a></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-896466" class="node node-faq node-teaser article clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  
      <header class="toggle node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/can-doctoral-students-defer-funding" rel="bookmark" target="_top">Can doctoral students defer funding?</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="os-slider node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>The GSAS made some changes to their funding structure for doctoral students entering 2016-17 and beyond. These allow for some deferrals of teaching fellowships to later G years and other enhancements. <a href="https://gsas.harvard.edu/news/stories/gsas-implements-enhancements-funding-packages" data-url="https://gsas.harvard.edu/news/stories/gsas-implements-enhancements-funding-packages" target="_top">Read more.</a></p> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/can-doctoral-students-defer-funding" class="node-readmore" target="_top">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about Can doctoral students defer funding?</span></a></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-916981" class="node node-faq node-teaser article clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  
      <header class="toggle node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/how-do-i-apply-phd-program-study-religion-harvard-university" rel="bookmark" target="_top">How do I apply to the Ph.D. Program in the Study of Religion at Harvard University?</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="os-slider node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Please go to <a data-url="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/apply-phd" href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/apply-phd" target="_blank" title="" target="_top">"Apply PhD"</a> and follow instructions on applying to the Graduate School of Arts and Sciences at Harvard University.</p> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/how-do-i-apply-phd-program-study-religion-harvard-university" class="node-readmore" target="_top">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about How do I apply to the Ph.D. Program in the Study of Religion at Harvard University?</span></a></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-932736" class="node node-faq node-teaser article clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  
      <header class="toggle node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/do-you-require-writing-sample" rel="bookmark" target="_top">Is a writing sample required for applicants?</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="os-slider node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>For applicants to the Ph.D. program in the Study of Religion, a writing sample is required. The 10-page limit/2500-word limit refers to the main body of the paper and does not include bibliographies.</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-982876" class="node node-faq node-teaser article clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  
      <header class="toggle node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/can-i-teach-years-g5-and-g6-priority-student" rel="bookmark" target="_top">Can I teach in years G5 and G6, as a priority student?</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="os-slider node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>GSAS made some recent changes which allow students to shift their priority years to any combination within G3, G4, G5, and G6 years. This allows students in the Study of Religion to do research work earlier in their program, if they have secured alternative sources of funding. Read the guidance here: https://gsas.harvard.edu/news/stories/gsas-implements-enhancements-funding-packages.</p> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/can-i-teach-years-g5-and-g6-priority-student" class="node-readmore" target="_top">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about Can I teach in years G5 and G6, as a priority student?</span></a></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-1000166" class="node node-faq node-teaser article clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  
      <header class="toggle node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/what-latest-information-unionization-graduate-students-harvard" rel="bookmark" target="_top">What is the latest information on the unionization of graduate students at Harvard?</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="os-slider node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>&#13;
	To keep current on the unionization of graduate students at Harvard, please refer to <a data-url="https://provost.harvard.edu/studentvote" href="https://provost.harvard.edu/studentvote" title="" target="_top">the page managed by the Office of the Provost.</a> Please note that the provost also sends direct communications to graduate students, faculty, and other members of the Harvard community.&#13;
</p>&#13;
 <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/what-latest-information-unionization-graduate-students-harvard" class="node-readmore" target="_top">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about What is the latest information on the unionization of graduate students at Harvard?</span></a></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-31161"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics"  class="active-trail active">Academics</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31166"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/undergraduate" >Undergraduate</a></li><li class="last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-31171"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral"  class="active-trail active">Doctoral</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first collapsed menu-depth-3 menu-item-31306"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/phd-program" >PhD Program &amp; Timeline</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-33061"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/links-doctoral-students" >Links for Doctoral Students</a></li><li class="leaf active-trail active-trail menu-depth-3 menu-item-32971"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/faqs-doctoral"  class="active-trail active active">FAQ&#039;s: Doctoral</a></li><li class="last collapsed menu-depth-3 menu-item-31311"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/thd-program" >ThD Program</a></li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1472248730" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_media"  module="boxes" delta="1472248730"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Doctoral Program Calendar</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1472248730' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id="file-697671" class="file file-html file-html-embed">

          <h2 class="element-invisible"><a href="">fd67661077608f54d6ac9d4470ac003a</a></h2>
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="file-info"></div><div class="field field-name-field-html-code field-type-text-long field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><iframe src="https://calendar.google.com/calendar/embed?showTitle=0&amp;showNav=0&amp;showPrint=0&amp;showCalendars=0&amp;showTz=0&amp;mode=AGENDA&amp;height=600&amp;wkst=1&amp;bgcolor=%23cccccc&amp;src=harvard.edu_tdumcqt6psi863e4fqd2re2tek%40group.calendar.google.com&amp;color=%23cccccc&amp;src=9qpvg4b8brruceh6v118kbht2k%40group.calendar.google.com&amp;color=%23cccccc&amp;ctz=America%2FNew_York" style="border-width:0" width="260" height="600" frameborder="0" scrolling="no"></iframe></div></div></div>  </div>

  
</div>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_info' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h1><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >Committee on the Study of Religion</a></h1>

menu-path-node-61716   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/religions-americas"  title="">Religions of the Americas</a></li><li class="menu-3293 menu-path-node-61726   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/south-asian-religions"  title="">South Asian Religions</a></li><li class="menu-3294 menu-path-node-61731   even   last "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/theology"  title="">Theology</a></li></ul></li><li class="menu-2615 menu-path-people-taxonomy-term-12866   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/taxonomy/term/12866" >People</a></li><li class="menu-2338 menuparent  menu-path-node-56666   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/about"  title="">About</a><span class="open-submenu"></span><ul><li class="menu-2607 menu-path-node-63446  first   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/historical-overview" >Historical Overview</a></li><li class="menu-2360 menu-path-node-57086   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/contact" >Contact</a></li><li class="menu-2789 menu-path-node-75856   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/courses" >Courses</a></li><li class="menu-2809 menu-path-node-63841   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/links"  title="">Related Organizations</a></li><li class="menu-2339 menu-path-node-56811   odd   last "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/mailing-list"  title="">Mailing List</a></li></ul></li><li class="menu-17680 menu-path-node-881226   odd   last "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/calendars"  title="">Calendar</a></li></ul>

  </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Forms                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-928971" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><h2>Faculty Report Forms</h2><p>For comprehensive student academic information, please refer to student record in the advising section of the SIS found at my.harvard.edu.</p><ul><li>G1: Your advisee should review their Plan of Study with you; you may approve their email submission with an email confirmation or sign their paper form.</li><li>G2: <a href="https://goo.gl/forms/NgNj99nce4rVtHUy2" target="_blank" title="">Second Year Review</a> </li><li>G3 and up: <a href="https://goo.gl/forms/wA7cy3SuNMIlhu4R2" target="_blank" title="">General Examinations Report</a> (if needed, <a href="https://goo.gl/forms/f1y58E2NCrrUqV6r2" target="_blank" title="">Re-examination</a> Report)</li><li>G3 and up: <a href="https://goo.gl/forms/dvIuYnOfEUHRW1QC3" target="_blank" title="">Prospectus Committee Chair Report</a></li><li>G5 and up: <a href="https://goo.gl/forms/NvLG4klgaDYnkenH2" target="_blank" title="Dissertation Defense">Dissertation Defense Chair Report</a></li></ul><h2> </h2><h2>Financial Forms for Visitors, Students, and Faculty</h2><p><em>You may submit forms by email, mail or fax. If you are a visitor, the Student &amp; Visitor Reimbursement Form and a W-9 are required.</em></p><ul><li><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/hcominequalityfellows_0.pdf">Student &amp; Visitor Reimbursement Form</a> <em>*Be sure to include your current address to avoid errors in mailed payments.</em></li><li><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/fw9.pdf">W-9</a> <em>*A new W-9 is required if you have not been <strong>REIMBURSED (this is different from being paid)</strong> in the last 6 months.</em></li><li><a href="https://www.uscis.gov/i-9-central">I-9</a> <em>The link takes you to the most current I-9 info; downloadable from their homepage.</em></li><li><a href="https://www.irs.gov/Forms-&amp;-Pubs">W-4 Employee Withholding Form</a></li><li><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/fn_oracle_vendor_request_form.pdf">Foreign Individual Vendor Request Form</a><br />Foreign individuals should submit this form instead of a W-9. After submitting this form, individuals will also need to complete the GLACIER program (an online Self-Service tool to determine U.S. residency status) and submit required documents to the NRA Tax Group office. The individual will receive an email from <a href="mailto:support@online-tax.net">support@online-tax.net</a>providing information on how to log into the GLACIER program.  A hold will be automatically placed until the individual submits the GLACIER documents to the NRA Tax Group.</li><li><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/huuef4-writable.pdf">Faculty Universal Expense Form</a></li></ul><p><em>*Paper clips please - thank you!</em></p><p> </p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
				
			</div>
		</div>
		<!--footer region beg-->

<div id="page" class="container page os_pages-section-56816 header-main header-right content-top footer-left">
	<div id="page-wrapper">

		
					<!--header regions beg-->
			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-info" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_info no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_info"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_info' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h1><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >Committee on the Study of Religion</a></h1>
    
    <p>
    </p></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>					  					  <div class="region region-header-third"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-secondary-menu" class="block block-os no-title"  module="os" delta="secondary-menu"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-secondary-menu" id="nice-menu-secondary-menu"><li class="menu-22511 menu-path-faq  first   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq"  title="List of FAQs">FAQ</a></li><li class="menu-2605 menu-path-node-63151   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/apply-phd" >Apply PhD</a></li><li class="menu-6668 menu-path-studyofreligionfasharvardedu-pages-forms   odd  "><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/forms"  title="For Current Students &amp; Faculty">Forms</a></li><li class="menu-2603 menu-path-node-57086   even   last "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/contact" >Contact</a></li></ul>
</div>

				  <!--main menu region beg-->
		  <div id="menu-bar" class="nav region-menu-bar clearfix"><nav id="block-os-primary-menu" class="block block-os no-title menu-wrapper menu-bar-wrapper clearfix"  module="os" delta="primary-menu">  
  
  <ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-primary-menu" id="nice-menu-primary-menu"><li class="menu-2336 menu-path-  first   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a></li><li class="menu-17860 menu-path-node-893786   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/undergraduate"  title="Information for undergraduate students enrolled in Harvard College interested in the Comparative Study of Religion program.">Undergraduate</a></li><li class="menu-2341 menu-path-node-56831   odd   active-trail"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral"  class="active">Doctoral</a></li><li class="menu-2379 menuparent  menu-path-node-57301   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/research"  title="">Research</a><span class="open-submenu"></span><ul><li class="menu-3285 menu-path-node-57416  first   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/african-religions"  title="">African Religions</a></li><li class="menu-3295 menu-path-node-57436   even  "><a 		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics" >ACADEMICS</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral" >DOCTORAL</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/thd-program" >THD PROGRAM</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/first-two-years-pre-generals-requirements" >THE FIRST TWO YEARS: THD PRE-GENERALS</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Guidelines for the Foreign Language Certification Course (Div 4999)                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-63361" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p> </p><h2>1. Eligibility</h2><p><br />Students who apply to do a Readings and Research class to fulfill the language requirement should first have:<br /><br />a. attempted to prepare for the exam by completing course work at Harvard; and<br />b. attempted the qualifying exam and been unsuccessful.</p><h2>2. Procedure for applying</h2><p><br />To apply to do a Readings and Research course, a student first must consult with and have permission of:<br />a. her/his advisor; and<br />b. the Director of Language Studies; and<br />c. the proposed instructor of the course.<br /><br />After this initial approval, and before registering for the course, the student should submit a list of readings and copies thereof to the Director of Language Studies and the instructor for approval. It is the student's responsibility to collect the readings, in consultation with the instructor and the Director of Language Studies if necessary.</p><h2>3. Procedure for certification of course work</h2><p><br />After completion of the readings, the instructor will evaluate and report on the student's performance. The certification process entails three steps (a-c below).<br /><br />a. The instructor administers an exam (written or oral) evaluating the student's ability to translate.<br />b. The instructor submits the results to the Director of Language Studies for certification.<br />The results may take one of two forms:<br />1. corrected translations; or,<br />2. a brief letter describing the translation and the testing method.<br />c. After receiving the material described above, the Director of Language Studies informs the Th.D. administrator that the student has completed the requirement successfully.<br /><br /><em>February 15, 1999</em></p><p> </p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-31161"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics"  class="active-trail active">Academics</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31166"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/undergraduate" >Undergraduate</a></li><li class="last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-31171"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral"  class="active-trail active">Doctoral</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first collapsed menu-depth-3 menu-item-31306"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/phd-program" >PhD Program &amp; Timeline</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-33061"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/links-doctoral-students" >Links for Doctoral Students</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-32971"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/faqs-doctoral" >FAQ&#039;s: Doctoral</a></li><li class="last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-3 menu-item-31311"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/thd-program"  class="active-trail active">ThD Program</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32706"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/thd-program-requirements" >Th.D. Program Requirements</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32691"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/timeline-0" >Th.D. Timeline</a></li><li class="leaf active-trail active-trail menu-depth-4 menu-item-32716"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/first-two-years-pre-generals-requirements"  class="active-trail active">The First Two Years: ThD Pre-Generals</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32756"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-three-thd-general-exams-0" >Year Three: Th.D. General Exams</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32781"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-three-thd-teaching-0" >Year Three: Th.D. Teaching</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32761"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-four-thd-dissertation-prospectus-0" >Year Four: Th.D. Dissertation Prospectus</a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32776"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-five-and-following-dissertation-and-graduationupon-formal-approval-prospectus" >Year Five and Following: The Dissertation and Graduation</a></li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1472238788" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1472238788"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

<meta name="description" content="Any student who wishes to replace one ancient language for another; take a leave of absence; or take extra time beyond the time allowed for languages, studying for Generals, preparing the Dissertation prospectus, or writing the Dissertation must petition for an extension of time. Petitions for extensions of time should include: 1) a summary of progress, 2) if applicable, an indication of any circumstances that have made progress difficult, 3) a probable time-table for completion of the requirement, and 4) the countersignature of your advisor." />
<meta property="og:title" content="Petitions in the Th.D. program" />

					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics" >ACADEMICS</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral" >DOCTORAL</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/thd-program" >THD PROGRAM</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Petitions in the Th.D. program                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-63406" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Any student who wishes to replace one ancient language for another; take a leave of absence; or take extra time beyond the time allowed for languages, studying for Generals, preparing the Dissertation prospectus, or writing the Dissertation must petition for an extension of time. Petitions for extensions of time should include: 1) a summary of progress, 2) if applicable, an indication of any circumstances that have made progress difficult, 3) a probable time-table for completion of the requirement, and 4) the countersignature of your advisor. Though petitions need to be addressed to the Director of Th.D. Studies, they must be given to Kathryn Kunkel, the Th.D. Administrator. Petitions are reviewed by the Director of Th.D. Studies and occasionally may be brought up before the Doctoral Subcommittee. Please remember that petitions are not automatically approved.<br /><br />N.B. Th.D. students who wish to take a one-year leave of absence should also consult the Registrar in order to review her or his account and to clarify such matters as tuition credit and insurance coverage. Please consult the Divinity School Handbook for further details. Students should, of course, also discuss this step with their advisor and with the Th.D. Administrator.</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-31161"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics"  class="active-trail active">Academics</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31166"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/undergraduate" >Undergraduate</a></li><li class="last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-31171"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral"  class="active-trail active">Doctoral</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first collapsed menu-depth-3 menu-item-31306"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/phd-program" >PhD Program &amp; Timeline</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-33061"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/links-doctoral-students" >Links for Doctoral Students</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-32971"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/faqs-doctoral" >FAQ&#039;s: Doctoral</a></li><li class="last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-3 menu-item-31311"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/thd-program"  class="active-trail active">ThD Program</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32706"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/thd-program-requirements" >Th.D. Program Requirements</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32691"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/timeline-0" >Th.D. Timeline</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32716"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/first-two-years-pre-generals-requirements" >The First Two Years: ThD Pre-Generals</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32756"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-three-thd-general-exams-0" >Year Three: Th.D. General Exams</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32781"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-three-thd-teaching-0" >Year Three: Th.D. Teaching</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32761"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-four-thd-dissertation-prospectus-0" >Year Four: Th.D. Dissertation Prospectus</a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32776"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-five-and-following-dissertation-and-graduationupon-formal-approval-prospectus" >Year Five and Following: The Dissertation and Graduation</a></li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1472238788" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1472238788"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

			</div>
		</div>
		<!--footer region beg-->
		<footer id="footer" class="clearfix" role="contentinfo">

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics" >ACADEMICS</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral" >DOCTORAL</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/phd-program" >PHD PROGRAM &amp; TIMELINE</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-3-general-exams" >YEAR 3: GENERAL EXAMS</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Policy on Failure of General Exams                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-63231" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Should a student fail any part or all of his or her General Examinations, the student would normally be required to re-take all the exams unless exemptions from certain areas were recommended by the examining committee and approved by the Doctoral Subcommittee. Should the examiners wish to exempt certain areas, they must provide a rationale for their decision in writing to the Doctoral Subcommittee. Likewise, an examining committee must provide a written rationale to the Doctoral Subcommittee for any recommendation that a student re-take an exam in a different form (e.g., writing a paper in lieu of re-taking an exam).</p><p>A student may re-take General Examinations once and must re-take a failed exam in the next exam period. A student must also keep the same examiners (where possible) and the same bibliographies.<br /><br />This written report must be produced as soon as possible after the decision in order to provide clear and timely information to the student and to the Doctoral Subcommittee. If the Doctoral Subcommittee denies the exemption or the request that a student re-take an exam in a different form, the examining committee may appeal to the Standing Committee.<br /><br />Any recommendation to exempt a student from re-taking one or more of the General Examinations, or to have the student re-take an exam in a different form, must be made by the examining committee as a whole.<br /><br />The categories of ‘bar’ and ‘no bar’ shall no longer be used. No student will be barred from re-taking failed General Examinations once. Should members of an examining committee feel a student would be best served by not re-taking the exams, they should communicate this to the student and explore options with him or her.</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-31161"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics"  class="active-trail active">Academics</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31166"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/undergraduate" >Undergraduate</a></li><li class="last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-31171"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral"  class="active-trail active">Doctoral</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-3 menu-item-31306"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/phd-program"  class="active-trail active">PhD Program &amp; Timeline</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32681"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral-advising" >Advising</a></li><li class="menu-depth-4 menu-item-32586"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/years-1-%26-2" >Years 1 &amp; 2</a></li><li class="leaf active-trail active-trail menu-depth-4 menu-item-32631"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-3-general-exams"  class="active-trail active">Year 3: General Exams</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32656"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-3-%26-4-teaching" >Year 3 &amp; 4: Teaching</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32661"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-4-dissertation-prospectus" >Year 4: Dissertation Prospectus</a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32666"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-5-the-dissertation" >Year 5 &amp; up: The Dissertation</a></li></ul></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-33061"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/links-doctoral-students" >Links for Doctoral Students</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-32971"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/faqs-doctoral" >FAQ&#039;s: Doctoral</a></li><li class="last collapsed menu-depth-3 menu-item-31311"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/thd-program" >ThD Program</a></li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1472238788" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1472238788"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Doctoral Student Handbooks</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1472238788' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/139pqOBBoI0KkYhpsZAZiNDa0VU4E-uOZInpygx-Mco8/edit?usp=sharing" target="_blank" title="">Ph.D. Student Handbook</a><br /><a href="http://handbook.gsas.harvard.edu/gsas-handbook" title="">GSAS Student Handbook</a><br /><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/thd_handbook_2016.pdf">Th.D.   </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1476823074" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1476823074"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Forms for Current Students in Ph.D. Program</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1476823074' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>These forms are for students who are *enrolled* in the Ph.D. program. <strong>Do *not* request access</strong> if you are applying to the Ph.D. program.</p><ul><li><a href="https://docs.google.com/a/harvard.edu/document/d/16wlb4LD2NgMteJ7X0q_9d418vFBUBU1qjjcrFOXdP2I/edit?usp=sharing" title="">Plan of Study</a></li><li><a href="https://goo.gl/forms/w80b6mQGPVRBOIi33" title="">Intent to Take the Second Year Review</a></li><li><a href="https://goo.gl/forms/qrVDPsjLzTIIeWM32" title="">Intent to Take General Exams</a></li><li><a href="https://docs.google.com/a/harvard.edu/document/d/1uLO2yz184gawZctHd6uawOwB4auSDdueAnmytjk3TGY/edit?usp=sharing" title="">Dissertation Prospectus Checklist</a></li></ul></div></div></div>

		  <div class="branding-left"><a href="http://www.harvard.edu" ><img src="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/profiles/openscholar/themes/hwpi_basetheme/images/harvard-logo.png" width="235" height="32" alt="Harvard Logo" /></a></div><div class="branding-right"><a href="http://www.harvard.edu" >HARVARD.EDU</a></div>		</div>

<div id="page" class="container page os_pages-section-57301 header-main header-right content-top footer-left">
	<div id="page-wrapper">

		
					<!--header regions beg-->
			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-info" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_info no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_info"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_info' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h1><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >Committee on the Study of Religion</a></h1>
    
    <p>
    </p></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>					  					  <div class="region region-header-third"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-secondary-menu" class="block block-os no-title"  module="os" delta="secondary-menu"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-secondary-menu" id="nice-menu-secondary-menu"><li class="menu-22511 menu-path-faq  first   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq"  title="List of FAQs">FAQ</a></li><li class="menu-2605 menu-path-node-63151   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/apply-phd" >Apply PhD</a></li><li class="menu-6668 menu-path-studyofreligionfasharvardedu-pages-forms   odd  "><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/forms"  title="For Current Students &amp; Faculty">Forms</a></li><li class="menu-2603 menu-path-node-57086   even   last "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/contact" >Contact</a></li></ul>
</div>
