		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Research                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-57301" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><img height="250" width="655" alt="Research" title="Research" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-xlarge" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_xlarge/public/religion/files/research.jpg?m=1372183819&amp;itok=WkZECvAj" /></p>
<div>
<p>At Harvard, advanced programs of study involving religion may be arranged under many auspices. The Ph.D. under this Committee is in "The Study of Religion". Some candidates will find that they can best pursue their interests by becoming a candidate for the Ph.D. in such departments as Anthropology, Classics, History, East Asian or Near Eastern Languages and Civilizations, Philosophy, or Sanskrit and Indian Studies. Likewise, some candidates may find the program for the M.T.S., M.Div., or Th.M. degree in the Harvard Divinity School more suitable for focusing their interests and strengthening their preparation for doctoral studies. The Committee reserves the right to advise the applicant to seek training in one of these alternative programs if in its judgment such a course would be in the applicant's interest.</p>
<p>Fields of study, admissions, and requirements differ; applicants should indicate in their submission which field will be their primary specialization. If you indicate one of the fields marked below by an asterisk*, please specify the religious traditions(s) and/or approximate geographical range(s) or temporal period(s) from which the primary sources for your focus of inquiry will be drawn. You may also propose comparative work within any of these fields.<br /><br />For descriptions and related faculty, please refer to the corresponding field page under the Research section.</p>
<ul><li>African Religions</li>
<li>Buddhist Studies</li>
<li>Comparative Studies</li>
<li>East Asian Religions</li>
<li>Ethics*</li>
<li>Greco-Roman Religions</li>
<li>Hebrew Bible/Old Testament</li>
<li>History of Christianity</li>
<li>Islamic Studies</li>
<li>Jewish Studies</li>
<li>New Testament and Early Christianity</li>
<li>Philosophy of Religion*</li>
<li>Religion and Society*</li>
<li>Religion, Gender and Culture*</li>
<li>Religions of the Americas</li>
<li>Religions of Late Antiquity: Judaism and Christianity</li>
<li>South Asian Religions</li>
<li>Theology*</li>
</ul></div></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail menu-item-32351"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/religions-americas" >Religions of the Americas</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32361"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/south-asian-religions" >South Asian Religions</a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32366"><a   </div></div></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->

It is your responsibility to ensure that the computer being used is in good working condition. In the event of a malfunction, the administrator, in consultation with the your faculty advisor, will make all possible efforts for a re-examination as soon as possible. You should check your computer&#039;s functionality and battery life well in advance and save work often during the exam period." />

It is your responsibility to ensure that the computer being used is in good working condition. In the event of a malfunction, the administrator, in consultation with the your faculty advisor, will make all possible efforts for a re-examination as soon as possible. You should check your computer&#039;s functionality and battery life well in advance and save work often during the exam period." />

<title>Submission of General Exams | Committee on the Study of Religion</title>

					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics" >ACADEMICS</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral" >DOCTORAL</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/phd-program" >PHD PROGRAM &amp; TIMELINE</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-3-general-exams" >YEAR 3: GENERAL EXAMS</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Submission of General Exams                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-63226" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>General Examinations are customarily typed, though you may hand-write your exam. All editing and proof-reading must be completed during the exam time. It is your responsibility to ensure that the computer being used is in good working condition. In the event of a malfunction, the administrator, in consultation with the your faculty advisor, will make all possible efforts for a re-examination as soon as possible. You should check your computer's functionality and battery life well in advance and save work often during the exam period. If you are using an uncommon software please consult with the program administrator a minimum of two weeks prior to the first exam to make any necessary arrangements.</p><h2>Honor Pledge</h2><p>You must sign an honor pledge before taking the general exams, stating that you will use the computer for word processing only (provided by the program administrator on exam day).</p><h2>Submission of Exams</h2><p>At the end of each exam period, you will email your exam to the program administrator, who will confirm receipt and provide copies to your examiners. Exams will be retained as part of your student record in the Study of Religion office.</p><p>If you plan to hand-write your exam, please consult with the program administrator at least two weeks prior to the first exam. For handwritten exams, you must first return the original exam to the Study of Religion office at the conclusion of each exam period. A photocopy will be made for you to convert to a typed format. Each exams must be converted and returned within 24 hours to the office, unless other arrangements have been made. No changes may be made from the original exam, including spelling, grammar, capitalization, and content. The typed version will be checked against the original.</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-31161"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics"  class="active-trail active">Academics</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31166"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/undergraduate" >Undergraduate</a></li><li class="last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-31171"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral"  class="active-trail active">Doctoral</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-3 menu-item-31306"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/phd-program"  class="active-trail active">PhD Program &amp; Timeline</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32681"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral-advising" >Advising</a></li><li class="menu-depth-4 menu-item-32586"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/years-1-%26-2" >Years 1 &amp; 2</a></li><li class="leaf active-trail active-trail menu-depth-4 menu-item-32631"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-3-general-exams"  class="active-trail active">Year 3: General Exams</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32656"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-3-%26-4-teaching" >Year 3 &amp; 4: Teaching</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32661"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-4-dissertation-prospectus" >Year 4: Dissertation Prospectus</a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32666"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-5-the-dissertation" >Year 5 &amp; up: The Dissertation</a></li></ul></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-33061"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/links-doctoral-students" >Links for Doctoral Students</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-32971"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/faqs-doctoral" >FAQ&#039;s: Doctoral</a></li><li class="last collapsed menu-depth-3 menu-item-31311"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/thd-program" >ThD Program</a></li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1472238788" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1472238788"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

      <h2 class="block-title">Forms for Current Students in Ph.D. Program</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1476823074' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>These forms are for students who are *enrolled* in the Ph.D. program. <strong>Do *not* request access</strong> if you are applying to the Ph.D. program.</p><ul><li><a href="https://docs.google.com/a/harvard.edu/document/d/16wlb4LD2NgMteJ7X0q_9d418vFBUBU1qjjcrFOXdP2I/edit?usp=sharing" title="">Plan of Study</a></li><li><a href="https://goo.gl/forms/w80b6mQGPVRBOIi33" title="">Intent to Take the Second Year Review</a></li><li><a href="https://goo.gl/forms/qrVDPsjLzTIIeWM32" title="">Intent to Take General Exams</a></li><li><a href="https://docs.google.com/a/harvard.edu/document/d/1uLO2yz184gawZctHd6uawOwB4auSDdueAnmytjk3TGY/edit?usp=sharing" title="">Dissertation Prospectus Checklist</a></li></ul></div></div></div>

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1476823712' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><strong>For Th.D. Program Forms, <a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/thd-program" title="">click here</a>.</strong></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1472248730" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_media"  module="boxes" delta="1472248730"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Doctoral Program Calendar</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1472248730' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id="file-697671" class="file file-html file-html-embed">

          <h2 class="element-invisible"><a href="">fd67661077608f54d6ac9d4470ac003a</a></h2>
      
  
  <div class="content">

<meta name="description" content="If the student&#039;s advisor agrees,  a doctoral candidate for either the PhD or ThD may submit a paper between 20 and 30 pages in length in lieu of a fourth (Ph.D) or third (Th.D) exam, namely the special field exam. Intent to write such a paper, with a bibliography and brief description, should be submitted together with other General Exam bibliographies six months prior to the exam period. An updated bibliography should be submitted with the paper. The chosen topic should anticipate the expected focus of the dissertation." />
<meta property="og:title" content="Substituting a Paper for the Fourth Exam" />
<meta property="og:type" content="article" />

Intent to write such a paper, with a bibliography and brief description, should be submitted together with other General Exam bibliographies six months prior to the exam period. An updated bibliography should be submitted with the paper. The chosen topic should anticipate the expected focus of the dissertation." />

			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics" >ACADEMICS</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral" >DOCTORAL</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/phd-program" >PHD PROGRAM &amp; TIMELINE</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-3-general-exams" >YEAR 3: GENERAL EXAMS</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Substituting a Paper for the Fourth Exam                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-63216" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>If the student's advisor agrees,  a doctoral candidate for either the PhD or ThD may submit a paper between 20 and 30 pages in length in lieu of a fourth (Ph.D) or third (Th.D) exam, namely the special field exam. <strong>Intent to write such a paper, with a bibliography and brief description, should be submitted together with other General Exam bibliographies six months prior to the exam period.</strong> An updated bibliography should be submitted with the paper. The chosen topic should anticipate the expected focus of the dissertation. This option may only be exercised with the approval of the student’s academic advisor, and the paper should be developed in consultation with the advisor. It must be original work prepared for this purpose; work previously submitted for any other purpose (including a course, colloquium, or presentation) is not acceptable.<br /><br /><strong>The paper must be submitted by 5:00 p.m. to the program administrator at the Study of Religion offices in the Barker Center, not later than one month prior to the first exam date</strong> (e.g., if the first exam would have been given on April 21, the paper would be due by March 21, or the nearest day to that date on which the office is open.) This is a non-negotiable deadline. If a paper is not submitted by the deadline, the student must sit for the exam based on the original bibliography. The submitted paper will be copied and distributed to the general examination readers and discussed at the oral examination along with the other three exams.<br /><br />This option has been approved in the past on an ad hoc basis for a number of students. Most have found it to be an excellent way to begin work on their dissertation topic, receive meaningful feedback from a number of faculty at an early stage in this process, and often to curtail the ‘lag’ time after generals and before submitting the prospectus by providing a strong intellectual link between these stages in the program.</p><p><em>Approved at the Doctoral Sub-committee meeting</em><br /><em>December 7, 2007</em></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-31161"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics"  class="active-trail active">Academics</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31166"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/undergraduate" >Undergraduate</a></li><li class="last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-31171"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral"  class="active-trail active">Doctoral</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-3 menu-item-31306"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/phd-program"  class="active-trail active">PhD Program &amp; Timeline</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32681"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral-advising" >Advising</a></li><li class="menu-depth-4 menu-item-32586"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/years-1-%26-2" >Years 1 &amp; 2</a></li><li class="leaf active-trail active-trail menu-depth-4 menu-item-32631"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-3-general-exams"  class="active-trail active">Year 3: General Exams</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32656"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-3-%26-4-teaching" >Year 3 &amp; up: The Dissertation</a></li></ul></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-33061"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/links-doctoral-students" >Links for Doctoral Students</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-32971"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/faqs-doctoral" >FAQ&#039;s: Doctoral</a></li><li class="last collapsed menu-depth-3 menu-item-31311"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/thd-program" >ThD Program</a></li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1472238788" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1472238788"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1476823074' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>These forms are for students who are *enrolled* in the Ph.D. program. <strong>Do *not* request access</strong> if you are applying to the Ph.D. program.</p><ul><li><a href="https://docs.google.com/a/harvard.edu/document/d/16wlb4LD2NgMteJ7X0q_9d418vFBUBU1qjjcrFOXdP2I/edit?usp=sharing" title="">Plan of Study</a></li><li><a href="https://goo.gl/forms/w80b6mQGPVRBOIi33" title="">Intent to Take the Second Year Review</a></li><li><a href="https://goo.gl/forms/qrVDPsjLzTIIeWM32" title="">Intent to Take General Exams</a></li><li><a href="https://docs.google.com/a/harvard.edu/document/d/1uLO2yz184gawZctHd6uawOwB4auSDdueAnmytjk3TGY/edit?usp=sharing" title="">Dissertation Prospectus Checklist</a></li></ul></div></div></div>

<!--FLEXIBLE ADMIN HEADER FOR USE BY SELECT GROUPS USING OS-->
	<div id="branding_header">
		<div  class="branding-container clearfix">

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics" >ACADEMICS</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral" >DOCTORAL</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      ThD Program                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-57201" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Prospective students interested in doctoral work in religion may only apply for the Ph.D. program in the Study of Religion at Harvard University.</p><p>The Th.D. program of the Harvard Divinity School was inaugurated in 1914 and the final cohort was admitted in 2014. The Committee on the Study of Religion continues to administer those students enrolled in the Th.D. program. The Th.D. program emphasizes the study of the literatures, languages, practices, and institutions that shape religious and theological traditions and thought from a range of methodological and theoretical perspectives. Although the Western humanistic traditions in their histories and their encounters with other cultures and religions, past and present, form the historic basis for the Th.D. at Harvard Divinity School, the program also offers the opportunity for students to engage in the study of varieties of geographical/historical complexes and religious traditions.</p><h3>Th.D. Program Forms</h3><ul><li><a href="pages/overview-program-requirements">Overview of Program Requirements</a></li><li><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/thd_handbook_2016.pdf">ThD Handbook</a></li><li><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/thd_study_plan_0.doc">Plan of Study</a></li><li><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/guidelines-foreign-language-certification-course-div-4999" title="">Guidelines for the Foreign Language Certification Course</a></li><li><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/2nd_year_review_intent_thd.doc">Intent to take Second Year Review</a></li><li><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/general_intent_form.doc?m=1443548036">Intent to take General Exams</a></li><li><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/petitions-thd-program" target="_blank" title="">Petitions in the Th.D. Program</a></li></ul></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-31161"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics"  class="active-trail active">Academics</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31166"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/undergraduate" >Undergraduate</a></li><li class="last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-31171"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral"  class="active-trail active">Doctoral</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first collapsed menu-depth-3 menu-item-31306"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/phd-program" >PhD Program &amp; Timeline</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-33061"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/links-doctoral-students" >Links for Doctoral Students</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-32971"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/faqs-doctoral" >FAQ&#039;s: Doctoral</a></li><li class="last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-3 menu-item-31311"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/thd-program"  class="active-trail active active">ThD Program</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32706"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/thd-program-requirements" >Th.D. Program Requirements</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32691"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/timeline-0" >Th.D. Timeline</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32716"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/first-two-years-pre-generals-requirements" >The First Two Years: ThD Pre-Generals</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32756"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-three-thd-general-exams-0" >Year Three: Th.D. General Exams</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32781"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-three-thd-teaching-0" >Year Three: Th.D. Teaching</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32761"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-four-thd-dissertation-prospectus-0" >Year Four: Th.D. Dissertation Prospectus</a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32776"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-five-and-following-dissertation-and-graduationupon-formal-approval-prospectus" >Year Five and Following: The Dissertation and Graduation</a></li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1472248730" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_media"  module="boxes" delta="1472248730"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Doctoral Program Calendar</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1472248730' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id="file-697671" class="file file-html file-html-embed">

          <h2 class="element-invisible"><a href="">fd67661077608f54d6ac9d4470ac003a</a></h2>
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="file-info"></div><div class="field field-name-field-html-code field-type-text-long field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><iframe src="https://calendar.google.com/calendar/embed?showTitle=0&amp;showNav=0&amp;showPrint=0&amp;showCalendars=0&amp;showTz=0&amp;mode=AGENDA&amp;height=600&amp;wkst=1&amp;bgcolor=%23cccccc&amp;src=harvard.edu_tdumcqt6psi863e4fqd2re2tek%40group.calendar.google.com&amp;color=%23cccccc&amp;src=9qpvg4b8brruceh6v118kbht2k%40group.calendar.google.com&amp;color=%23cccccc&amp;ctz=America%2FNew_York" style="border-width:0" width="260" height="600" frameborder="0" scrolling="no"></iframe></div></div></div>  </div>

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics" >ACADEMICS</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Undergraduate                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-56826" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Harvard’s concentration in the Comparative Study of Religion is a vibrant community comprised of dynamic, devoted students and the nation’s most distinguished teaching faculty in the study of religion.  Students interact regularly with faculty and graduate students who share their interests. The program provides students with an understanding of the religious traditions of the world through study of sacred texts and rituals; philosophy, literature and theology; and the lived experiences and history of participants in the tradition.  Courses engage life’s biggest questions including the meaning of life and death, humanity and divinity, good and evil, sacrifice and community.  Course work exposes students to central concepts in the field such as god(s), ritual, gender, authority, orthodoxy, scripture and prophecy.  Anthropological, historical, philosophical, phenomenological, sociological and literary approaches open religion to closer analysis and deeper understanding.</p>
<p>Students consistently rate our concentration and courses very highly.  Tutorials are small, tailored to student interests and designed to develop and refine students’ ability to analyze texts closely and to write coherently.  Close attention to excellent writing--through drafting, comments and revising--is a priority in our tutorial program. <em><br /><br /></em>Concentrators pursue a wide range of careers after graduation, including business, law, medicine, politics, public service, scholarship, creative art and teaching.  Recent graduates are studying at Harvard Law School, teaching with Teach for America, pursuing graduate work at Cambridge University, practicing medicine and starring in television roles.  Our students consistently report back to us that the understanding of religion, the critical thinking skills, and the refined writing ability they gained in this concentration have been significantly important in making sense of current events and global politics, and in succeeding in their workplaces and local communities.  Most of our graduates have a strong interest in service to their communities and are committed to working in their chosen profession to make the world a better place. </p>
<p><em>The Undergraduate section of this site reflects the information found in the Undergraduate Handbook, which is the standard reference work for requirements, rules, and advising procedures in the Study of Religion and it updated annually. Faculty advisers and tutorial leaders will assume students are familiar with it. Please read its contents carefully.</em></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div><div id="block-boxes-1469475875" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_media no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1469475875"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1469475875' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id="file-678781" class="file file-html file-html-embed">

          <h2 class="element-invisible"><a href="">A.B. Study of Religion Calendar</a></h2>
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <div class="file-info"></div><div class="field field-name-field-html-code field-type-text-long field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><iframe src="https://calendar.google.com/calendar/embed?title=A.B.%20Study%20of%20Religion%20Calendar&amp;mode=AGENDA&amp;height=400&amp;wkst=1&amp;bgcolor=%23FFFFFF&amp;src=harvard.edu_gknbrjcsb0f1j1sjif3rua58l8%40group.calendar.google.com&amp;color=%23711616&amp;ctz=America%2FNew_York" style="border-width:0" width="600" height="400" frameborder="0" scrolling="no"></iframe></div></div></div>  </div>

  
</div>
</div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-first"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374163646" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374163646"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Guides &amp; Handbooks</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374163646' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/religious_studies_guide_print_10-1-13.pdf">Guide to Writing in the Study of Religion</a></li>
<li><a href="http://writing.fas.harvard.edu/" target="_blank">Writing Resources at Harvard</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_handbook_2016-7_final_0.pdf">Undergraduate Handbook</a> (2016-17)</li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/senior_thesis_handbook_2015-16_student.pdf">Senior Thesis Handbook</a> (2015-16)</li>
</ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1374515432" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374515432"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Undergraduate Resources</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374515432' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="http://osl.fas.harvard.edu/icb/icb.do?keyword=k65178&amp;pageid=icb.page305611">Office of Student Life – Student Organizations</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ocs.fas.harvard.edu/">Office of Career Services</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.funding.fas.harvard.edu/">Harvard College Funding Sources</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.college.harvard.edu/icb/icb.do?keyword=k61161&amp;pageid=icb.page257820">Harvard College</a></li>
<li><a href="http://oie.fas.harvard.edu/">Office of International Education</a></li>
<li><a href="http://cuhs.harvard.edu/">Harvard’s Committee on the Use of Human Subjects</a></li>
</ul><p>Register your travel abroad for emergency support:<br /><a href="https://www.globalsupport.harvard.edu/travel-tools">www.globalsupport.harvard.edu/travel-tools</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374178945" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374178945"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Plan of Study Forms for Undergraduates</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374178945' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_a_2014-15_writeable.doc">Option A: Two Major Traditions in Comparative Context</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_b_2014-15_writeable.doc">Option B: One Major Tradition in Comparative Context</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_c_2014-15_writeable.doc">*Option C: Joint Concentration with Religion as the Primary Field</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_d_2014-15_writeable.doc">*Option D: Joint Concentration with Religion as a Allied Field</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_secondary_field_2014-15_writeable.doc">Religion as a Secondary Field</a></li>
</ul><p>*Students pursuing a Joint Concentration must also complete the college form<a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/joint_conc_app_2_-_without_list_of_programs.pdf"> "Joint Concentration Application".</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>																	</div>

								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-31161"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics"  class="active-trail active">Academics</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-31166"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/undergraduate"  class="active-trail active active">Undergraduate</a></li><li class="last collapsed menu-depth-2 menu-item-31171"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral" >Doctoral</a></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1373989095" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1373989095"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Concentration Questions?</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1373989095' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/courtney-bickel-lamberth">Director of Undergraduate Studies, Courtney Lamberth</a></p>
<p><a href="mailto:kstreet@fas.harvard.edu">Assistant Director of Undergraduate Studies, Kera Street</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1472238788" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1472238788"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Doctoral Student Handbooks</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1472238788' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/139pqOBBoI0KkYhpsZAZiNDa0VU4E-uOZInpygx-Mco8/edit?usp=sharing" target="_blank" title="">Ph.D. Student Handbook</a><br /><a href="http://handbook.gsas.harvard.edu/gsas-handbook" title="">GSAS Student Handbook</a><br /><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/thd_handbook_2016.pdf">Th.D. Student Handbook</a><a href=""  class="os-embed-link" data-delta="1472238788">&lt;embed&gt;</a><div id="embed-popup-1472238788" class="embed-popup"><ul class="links num-links-2"><li class="link-count-iframe first"><a href="#1472238788-iframe" >Iframe</a></li><li class="link-count-oembed last"><a href="#1472238788-oembed" >URL</a></li></ul><div id="1472238788-iframe"><div class="form-item form-type-textarea form-item-web-widgets">
  <label for="web_widgets_1">Embed code </label>

</div></div></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1476823074" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1476823074"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Forms for Current Students in Ph.D. Program</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1476823074' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>These forms are for students who are *enrolled* in the Ph.D. program. <strong>Do *not* request access</strong> if you are applying to the Ph.D. program.</p><ul><li><a href="https://docs.google.com/a/harvard.edu/document/d/16wlb4LD2NgMteJ7X0q_9d418vFBUBU1qjjcrFOXdP2I/edit?usp=sharing" title="">Plan of Study</a></li><li><a href="https://goo.gl/forms/w80b6mQGPVRBOIi33" title="">Intent to Take the Second Year Review</a></li><li><a href="https://goo.gl/forms/qrVDPsjLzTIIeWM32" title="">Intent to Take General Exams</a></li><li><a href="https://docs.google.com/a/harvard.edu/document/d/1uLO2yz184gawZctHd6uawOwB4auSDdueAnmytjk3TGY/edit?usp=sharing" title="">Dissertation Prospectus Checklist</a></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1364321266" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1364321266"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Words from our Students</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1364321266' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><address>"The structure of the concentration gives students a lot of flexibility and freedom to explore the religions and themes they're interested in. In my experience, the professors are also very involved and want to get to know you on a personal level, which is something you don't get in the larger concentrations." – Hebert, '13</address></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1374086388" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374086388"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Approved Traditions and Themes</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374086388' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h3>Approved Traditions</h3>
<ul><li>Ancient Near Eastern / Israelite</li>
<li>Buddhist</li>
<li>Christian</li>
<li>East Asian</li>
<li>Greek-Hellenistic-Roman</li>
<li>Hindu</li>
<li>Islamic</li>
<li>Judaic</li>
<li>Modern Western / Religions of the Americas</li>
<li>South Asian</li>
<li>African and Afro-Atlantic Religions</li>
</ul><h3>Approved Themes</h3>
<ul><li>Religion and Gender</li>
<li>Religion and Society</li>
<li>Religion and the Arts</li>
<li>Philosophy of Religion</li>
</ul><p><em>It may be possible to substitute other traditions or themes depending on faculty and course offerings.</em></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1476823712" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1476823712"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Forms for Th.D. Program</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1476823712' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><strong>For Th.D. Program Forms, <a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/thd-program" title="">click here</a>.</strong></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1472248730" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_media"  module="boxes" delta="1472248730"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Doctoral Program Calendar</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1472248730' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id="file-697671" class="file file-html file-html-embed">

<meta name="description" content="Upon formal approval of the prospectus, the student commences the writing of the dissertation. Following the approval of the prospectus, one chapter per year of the dissertation must be submitted to the advisor. The length of dissertations is limited to a maximum of approximately 75,000 words or 300 pages, exclusive of bibliography. Permission to exceed this length may be granted by the Doctoral Subcommittee or the Chairman at the request of the dissertation advisor. " />
<meta property="og:description" content="Upon formal approval of the prospectus, the student commences the writing of the dissertation. Following the approval of the prospectus, one chapter per year of the dissertation must be submitted to the advisor. The length of dissertations is limited to a maximum of approximately 75,000 words or 300 pages, exclusive of bibliography. Permission to exceed this length may be granted by the Doctoral Subcommittee or the Chairman at the request of the dissertation advisor. " />

<div id="page" class="container page os_pages-section-56816 header-main header-right content-top footer-left">
	<div id="page-wrapper">

		
					<!--header regions beg-->
			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-info" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_info no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_info"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_info' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h1><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >Committee on the Study of Religion</a></h1>
    
    <p>
    </p></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>					  					  <div class="region region-header-third"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-secondary-menu" class="block block-os no-title"  module="os" delta="secondary-menu"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-secondary-menu" id="nice-menu-secondary-menu"><li class="menu-22511 menu-path-faq  first   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq"  title="List of FAQs">FAQ</a></li><li class="menu-2605 menu-path-node-63151   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/apply-phd" >Apply PhD</a></li><li class="menu-6668 menu-path-studyofreligionfasharvardedu-pages-forms   odd  "><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/forms"  title="For Current Students &amp; Faculty">Forms</a></li><li class="menu-2603 menu-path-node-57086   even   last "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/contact" >Contact</a></li></ul>
</div>
  </div></div><div id="block-boxes-solr-search-box" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_search_solr_search_box no-title"  module="boxes" delta="solr_search_box"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics" >ACADEMICS</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral" >DOCTORAL</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/phd-program" >PHD PROGRAM &amp; TIMELINE</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Year 5 &amp; up: The Dissertation                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-63246" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><span>Upon formal approval of the prospectus, the student commences the writing of the dissertation. Following the approval of the prospectus, one chapter per year of the dissertation must be submitted to the advisor. The length of dissertations is limited to a maximum of approximately 75,000 words or 300 pages, exclusive of bibliography. Permission to exceed this length may be granted by the Doctoral Subcommittee or the Chairman at the request of the dissertation advisor. </span></p><p><span>Once the dissertation is completed and approved by the advisor, the degree candidate is examined orally by a committee of at least three faculty readers, two of whom must be members of the Faculty of Arts and Sciences. In practice, any member of HDS faculty who is eligible to serve on the Standing Committee in the Study of Religion is authorized to sign Dissertation Acceptance Certificates as FAS members. Any faculty members from other schools at Harvard who have held or currently hold appointments in the CSR are authorized to sign Dissertation Acceptance Certificates as FAS members.</span></p><p dir="ltr"><b>Please review this comprehensive guide to degree submission, form of dissertation, and electronic submisssion to Registrar: <a href="https://gsas.harvard.edu/academics/dissertations">Dissertations: A Guide to Preparing and Submitting Your Dissertation</a>.</b></p><p>The entire Ph.D. program should not exceed seven years. Students who do not complete the degree in seven years must petition the Committee for an extension of time in the program. Petitions may be made only for one year at a time. In such a petition, the student and the dissertation advisor must present evidence of reasonable and substantial progress as well as a timetable for completion of the dissertation. Extensions will not be granted beyond the tenth year.</p><h4>The Timing of Submission to the Standing Committee</h4><p>When you are within reach of completing your dissertation draft, your dissertation advisor should write a letter to the Standing Committee proposing an examining committee. <u>The advisor’s letter should be received at least one week prior to the Standing Committee meeting at which it would be considered</u>. Please check the <a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/calendars" target="_blank" title="">website calendar for meeting dates of the Standing Committee</a> or contact the office of the Study of Religion for dates in order that you and your advisor may plan the timing of submission and defense. </p><p><span>The final dissertation draft must be submitted directly to each reader and to the Study of Religion Office. Once the examining committee is in place, a date for the dissertation defense will be set. <strong>In anticipating a defense date, keep in mind that your readers may need up to <u>six weeks</u> of reading time. </strong>You will need to prepare a dissertation abstract, not to exceed 350 words, prior to the dissertation defense. This document is required for publication in Dissertation Abstracts International.</span></p><p><span><strong>Prior to your defense</strong>, the Program Administrator will prepare and deliver to the Chair of your committee your Dissertation Acceptance Certificate (DAC). If no revisions are required, or as soon as any and all revisions are completed, and all examiners have signed the DAC, it should be returned to the Study of Religion office. The completed DAC will be scanned for the student and for the office; the original will be delivered to the Registrar’s Office.</span></p><p><span>Upon submission of the electronic copy of the dissertation, you will be required to submit a signed University Microfilms International form (included in the Registrar’s online submission tool).</span></p><p><strong>Degree Applicant Deadlines</strong> - The submission and application dates are generally the same each year. Students must check for the current deadlines, as late submissions are not accepted. The previous year’s dates can be used as a guide for planning, until a current year’s deadlines are posted.</p><h4><span>Registration During Dissertation Years</span></h4><p>Throughout your doctoral program, you must be registered as a full-time student. You may register in various ways depending on your location, financial needs and progress to degree. Please review the <a href="http://handbook.gsas.harvard.edu/non-resident-students" target="_blank" title="">Non-Resident option in the GSAS Student Handbook</a>. If you need to interrupt your program, you may register for a <a href="http://handbook.gsas.harvard.edu/leave-absence" title="">Leave of Absence by application to GSAS</a>. Students may also benefit from the <a href="http://handbook.gsas.harvard.edu/exchange-scholar-program" target="_blank" title="">Exchange Scholar Program</a>, which allows for registration with a select group of schools which participate in the program with Harvard GSAS.</p><h4><b>Graduation &amp; Diplomas</b></h4><p>An application for degree must be submitted by the deadline indicated in the Degree Calendar for a student to receive a degree from a GSAS degree program on one of the three annual degree conferral dates. <a href="http://handbook.gsas.harvard.edu/application-degree">Please refer to the current guidelines for preparation and submission of the dissertation in the GSAS Handbook</a>.</p><p>Online submission of the dissertation is required by the Graduate School. Please review the <a href="http://registrar.fas.harvard.edu/registration-enrollment-degrees/graduation-diplomas/phd-dissertation-submission">submission details found on the FAS Registrar’s site.</a> No exceptions are granted for late submissions, nor are improperly formatted submissions accepted. <a href="http://dissertation.gsas.harvard.edu/formatting-guidelines">Carefully review the formatting guidelines - you are responsible for proper formatting of the required documents.</a></p><p><em>The signed, original </em>Dissertation Acceptance Certificate<em> following must be submitted to the Registrar’s Office by 5:00 PM on the dissertation deadline date. No exceptions are allowed.</em></p><p dir="ltr"></p><h4>Registration and Tuition for Graduating Students</h4><p><b>March degree candidates: </b>the last term of enrollment is the fall term; do not register for spring.<br /><b>May degree candidates:</b> the last term of enrollment is the spring term<b>.<br />November degree candidates:</b> the last term of enrollment is the previous spring term.</p><p>Students who do not deposit a dissertation by the deadline, must register for the fall term. Please see the current <a href="http://handbook.gsas.harvard.edu/ii-academic-calendar">degree calendar on in the GSAS Handbook</a>. <a href="http://handbook.gsas.harvard.edu/harvard-university-student-health-program">Deadlines for health coverage selections</a> may differ from degree submission deadlines; it is your responsibility to plan accordingly.</p><p>In addition to academic requirements, students are required to meet the financial requirements for the degree. For details please review the <a href="http://handbook.gsas.harvard.edu/viii-financial-aid-and-requirements">Financial Aid &amp; Requirements section of the GSAS Handbook</a>.</p><h5><em>Diplomas and Commencement:  </em></h5><h5><a href="http://registrar.fas.harvard.edu/registration-enrollment-degrees/graduation-diplomas">Please refer to the costs and processes outlines by the FAS Registrar for diplomas and commencement.</a> All students who receive degrees in November, March and May of the academic year of that May graduation, may participate in the Commencement celebration.</h5></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-31161"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics"  class="active-trail active">Academics</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31166"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/undergraduate" >Undergraduate</a></li><li class="last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-31171"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral"  class="active-trail active">Doctoral</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-3 menu-item-31306"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/phd-program"  class="active-trail active">PhD Program &amp; Timeline</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32681"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral-advising" >Advising</a></li><li class="menu-depth-4 menu-item-32586"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/years-1-%26-2" >Years 1 &amp; 2</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32631"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-3-general-exams" >Year 3: General Exams</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32656"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-3-%26-4-teaching" >Year 3 &amp; up: The Dissertation</a></li></ul></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-33061"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/links-doctoral-students" >Links for Doctoral Students</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-32971"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/faqs-doctoral" >FAQ&#039;s: Doctoral</a></li><li class="last collapsed menu-depth-3 menu-item-31311"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/thd-program" >ThD Program</a></li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1472238788" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1472238788"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

Student Handbook</a><a href=""  class="os-embed-link" data-delta="1472238788">&lt;embed&gt;</a><div id="embed-popup-1472238788" class="embed-popup"><ul class="links num-links-2"><li class="link-count-iframe first"><a href="#1472238788-iframe" >Iframe</a></li><li class="link-count-oembed last"><a href="#1472238788-oembed" >URL</a></li></ul><div id="1472238788-iframe"><div class="form-item form-type-textarea form-item-web-widgets">

      <h2 class="block-title">Forms for Current Students in Ph.D. Program</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1476823074' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>These forms are for students who are *enrolled* in the Ph.D. program. <strong>Do *not* request access</strong> if you are applying to the Ph.D. program.</p><ul><li><a href="https://docs.google.com/a/harvard.edu/document/d/16wlb4LD2NgMteJ7X0q_9d418vFBUBU1qjjcrFOXdP2I/edit?usp=sharing" title="">Plan of Study</a></li><li><a href="https://goo.gl/forms/w80b6mQGPVRBOIi33" title="">Intent to Take the Second Year Review</a></li><li><a href="https://goo.gl/forms/qrVDPsjLzTIIeWM32" title="">Intent to Take General Exams</a></li><li><a href="https://docs.google.com/a/harvard.edu/document/d/1uLO2yz184gawZctHd6uawOwB4auSDdueAnmytjk3TGY/edit?usp=sharing" title="">Dissertation Prospectus Checklist</a></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1472248730" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_media"  module="boxes" delta="1472248730"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

								<div class="region region-footer-first"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1371845153" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_media no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1371845153"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1371845153' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id="file-53886" class="file file-image file-image-png">

          <h2 class="element-invisible"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/religion-footer.png?m=1479879567">religion-footer.png</a></h2>
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <img class="image-style-os-files-xxlarge" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_xxlarge/public/religion/files/religion-footer.png?m=1499733428&amp;itok=K-pEO8QM" width="300" height="63" alt="" title="" />  </div>

  
</div>
</div></div></div>

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">

				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												Undergraduate											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<div  class="os-taxonomy-term depth-0"><div class="term-listing-heading"></div><article id="node-892836" class="node node-faq node-teaser article clearfix" role="article">
  
      <header class="toggle node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/how-does-my-advisor-lift-hold" rel="bookmark">How does my advisor lift the "hold"?</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="os-slider node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Faculty advisors can<a href="http://about.my.harvard.edu/study-card-advisors" data-url="http://about.my.harvard.edu/study-card-advisors"> review instruction here for lifting a registration hold</a>.</p> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/how-does-my-advisor-lift-hold" class="node-readmore">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about How does my advisor lift the "hold"?</span></a></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-63991" class="node node-faq node-teaser article clearfix" role="article">
  
      <header class="toggle node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/what-happens-if-i%E2%80%99ve-been-away-harvard-and-requirements-my-field-changed-while-i-was" rel="bookmark">What happens if I’ve been away from Harvard and the requirements for my field changed while I was gone?</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="os-slider node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Normally you will be allowed to complete your work in the Study of Religion under the guidelines that existed when you entered the program. See the <a href="pages/coursework">Coursework section for historical handbooks</a>.</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-63921" class="node node-faq node-teaser article clearfix" role="article">
  
      <header class="toggle node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/if-i-transfer-religion-another-concentration-sophomore-or-junior-can-i-get-credit" rel="bookmark">Can I transfer from another concentration as a sophomore or junior and get credit for tutorials taken in other departments?</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="os-slider node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Yes, this is possible. Make an appointment to see the Director of Undergraduate Studies, and be sure to bring with you syllabi from your other tutorials and a completed <a href="pages/concentration-plans">Plan of Study from the Study of Religion</a>.</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-63896" class="node node-faq node-teaser article clearfix" role="article">
  
      <header class="toggle node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/can-courses-%E2%80%9Cdouble-count%E2%80%9D-meet-both-gen-ed-and-concentration-requirements" rel="bookmark">Can courses “double-count” for both Gen Ed and Religion requirements?</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="os-slider node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Yes!</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-63891" class="node node-faq node-teaser article clearfix" role="article">
  
      <header class="toggle node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/can-i-concentrate-religion-and-still-go-law-or-medical-school" rel="bookmark">Can I concentrate in religion and still go to law or medical school?</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="os-slider node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Yes! Many of our concentrators do. Prepare to take the classes necessary for graduate school in your chosen field in addition to fulfilling our concentration requirements.</div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-63851" class="node node-faq node-teaser article clearfix" role="article">
  
      <header class="toggle node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/why-should-i-concentrate-religion-0" rel="bookmark">Why should I concentrate in Religion?</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="os-slider node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">In the religion program students study a range of human experiences that have produced much of the greatest literature of the world, inspired its art and philosophy and shaped its moral consciousness. As a small concentration at Harvard, the Study of Religion is an intimate community within the larger university. Religion students regularly interact with faculty members and graduate students who share their interests. Tutorials are small (frequently one-on-one) and tailored to student interests. Student satisfaction with our program is consistently very high.</div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-57536" class="node node-faq node-teaser article clearfix" role="article">
  
      <header class="toggle node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/do-people-who-concentrate-religion-also-practice-certain-religion-do-you-have-believe" rel="bookmark">Do people who concentrate in religion also practice a religion?</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="os-slider node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Some of our students are religious and some are not. Those who are religious practice different faiths—Judaism, Islam, Christianity, Buddhism, Hinduism and others. There is no presumption that students in religion will believe in God or practice a certain faith.</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>									</div>
								
							</section><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

				
				
			</div>
		</div>
		<!--footer region beg-->
		<footer id="footer" class="clearfix" role="contentinfo">

					<!--header regions beg-->
			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-info" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_info no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_info"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_info' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h1><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >Committee on the Study of Religion</a></h1>
    
    <p>
    </p></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>					  					  <div class="region region-header-third"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-secondary-menu" class="block block-os no-title"  module="os" delta="secondary-menu"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/religion-and-society"  title="">Religion and Society</a></li><li class="menu-3300 menu-path-node-61721   odd  "><a menu-path-node-61716   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/religions-americas"  title="">Religions of the Americas</a></li><li class="menu-3293 menu-path-node-61726   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/south-asian-religions"  title="">South Asian Religions</a></li><li class="menu-3294 menu-path-node-61731   even   last "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/theology"  title="">Theology</a></li></ul></li><li class="menu-2615 menu-path-people-taxonomy-term-12866   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/taxonomy/term/12866" >People</a></li><li class="menu-2338 menuparent  menu-path-node-56666   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/about"  title="">About</a><span class="open-submenu"></span><ul><li class="menu-2607 menu-path-node-63446  first   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/historical-overview" >Historical Overview</a></li><li class="menu-2360 menu-path-node-57086   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/contact" >Contact</a></li><li class="menu-2789 menu-path-node-75856   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/courses" >Courses</a></li><li class="menu-2809 menu-path-node-63841   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/links"  title="">Related Organizations</a></li><li class="menu-2339   </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq" >FAQ</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												Can courses “double-count” for both Gen Ed and Religion requirements?											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<article id="node-63896" class="node node-faq article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Yes!</p></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-og-vocabulary field-type-entityreference field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">See also: <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq-taxonomy/undergraduate" >Undergraduate</a></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
									</div>
								
							</section><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1372193109" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_taxonomy_fbt"  module="boxes" delta="1372193109"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">FAQs by Program</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1372193109' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div class="item-list"><ul><li class="term-graduate"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/faq-taxonomy/graduate"  class="" title="">Graduate <span class="count">(18)</span></a></li><li class="term-undergraduate"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/faq-taxonomy/undergraduate"  class="" title="">Undergraduate <span class="count">(7)</span></a></li></ul></div></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-os-faq-sv-list" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_sv_list_box"  module="boxes" delta="os_faq_sv_list"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Recent FAQs</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_faq_sv_list' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id='box-os_faq_sv_list-page' data-page='0' data-delta='os_faq_sv_list' class='os-sv-list os_sv_list_box sv-list-faq sv-list-view-title sv-list-layout-list sv-grid-3'><div class="item-list"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/what-latest-information-unionization-graduate-students-harvard"  target="_top">What is the latest information on the unionization of graduate students at Harvard?</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/can-i-teach-years-g5-and-g6-priority-student"  target="_top">Can I teach in years G5 and G6, as a priority student?</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/do-you-require-writing-sample"  target="_top">Is a writing sample required for applicants?</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/how-do-i-apply-phd-program-study-religion-harvard-university"  target="_top">How do I apply to the Ph.D. Program in the Study of Religion at Harvard University?</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/can-doctoral-students-defer-funding"  target="_top">Can doctoral students defer funding?</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/what-are-family-accommodations-graduate-students"  target="_top">What are "Family Accommodations" for graduate students?</a></li></ul></div></div><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq"  class="more-link">More</a></div></div></div>

		  <div id="menu-bar" class="nav region-menu-bar clearfix"><nav id="block-os-primary-menu" class="block block-os no-title menu-wrapper menu-bar-wrapper clearfix"  module="os" delta="primary-menu">  
  
  <ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-primary-menu" id="nice-menu-primary-menu"><li class="menu-2336 menu-path-  first   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/east-asian-religions"  title="">East Asian Religions</a></li><li class="menu-3287 menu-path-node-57511   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/ethics"  title="">Ethics</a></li><li class="menu-3297 menu-path-node-57516   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/greco-roman-religions"  title="">Greco-Roman Religions</a></li><li class="menu-3288 menu-path-node-57521   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/hebrew-bibleold-testament"  title="">Hebrew Bible/Old Testament</a></li><li class="menu-3289 menu-path-node-61681   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/history-christianity"  title="">History of Christianity</a></li><li class="menu-3302 menu-path-node-61686   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/philosophy-religion"  title="">Philosophy of Religion</a></li><li class="menu-3301 menu-path-node-61711   odd  "><a menu-path-node-61716   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/religions-americas"  title="">Religions of the Americas</a></li><li class="menu-3293 menu-path-node-61726   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/south-asian-religions"  title="">South Asian Religions</a></li><li class="menu-3294 menu-path-node-61731   even   last "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/theology"  title="">Theology</a></li></ul></li><li class="menu-2615 menu-path-people-taxonomy-term-12866   odd  "><a
