			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-info" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_info no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_info"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_info' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h1><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >Committee on the Study of Religion</a></h1>
    
    <p>
    </p></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>					  					  <div class="region region-header-third"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-secondary-menu" class="block block-os no-title"  module="os" delta="secondary-menu"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

</div>

				  <!--main menu region beg-->
		  <div id="menu-bar" class="nav region-menu-bar clearfix"><nav id="block-os-primary-menu" class="block block-os no-title menu-wrapper menu-bar-wrapper clearfix"  module="os" delta="primary-menu">  
  
  <ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-primary-menu" id="nice-menu-primary-menu"><li class="menu-2336 menu-path-  first   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a></li><li class="menu-17860 menu-path-node-893786   even   active-trail"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/undergraduate"  title="Information for undergraduate students enrolled in Harvard College interested in the Comparative Study of Religion program." class="active">Undergraduate</a></li><li class="menu-2341 menu-path-node-56831   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral" >Doctoral</a></li><li class="menu-2379 menuparent  menu-path-node-57301   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/research"  title="">Research</a><span class="open-submenu"></span><ul><li class="menu-3285 menu-path-node-57416  first   odd  "><a   </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/undergraduate" >UNDERGRADUATE</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/advising" >ADVISING</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Concentration Options                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-63676" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Concentrators draw up a concentration plan and statement of focus under the supervision of the Director of Undergraduate Studies and their adviser in consultation with appropriate members of the Committee on the Study of Religion. There are five concentration options – all require general, methodological, or comparative courses outside of the major religious tradition(s) being studied. These courses provide analytical tools and knowledge of other traditions that enable students to think with comparative and theoretical imagination about diverse phenomena in religion.</p>
<h2>Option A. Two Major Traditions in Comparative Context</h2>
<p>Option A allows students to study two traditions, or one tradition and one theme, in depth. Students are required to take a small number of "General, Comparative, Methodological" courses. Students might examine comparative categories (e.g., pilgrimage, ritual, myth and so on) or interreligious contact and change across two traditions, or they might designate one tradition and one of the approved themes. Ideally, Option A students who choose to write a senior honors thesis will combine both of their two traditions (or their tradition and theme) in the thesis.</p>
<h2>Option B. One Major Tradition in Comparative Context</h2>
<p>Option B allows students to focus on one major tradition; the “General, Comparative, Methodological” requirement here is augmented slightly to ensure that students are exposed to comparative themes and different methodologies.</p>
<h2>Option C. Joint Concentration with Religion as the Primary Field</h2>
<p>Students will have a joint concentration with <span style="text-decoration:underline">religion as their primary field</span>. This option requires that a senior honors thesis be written.<span style="text-decoration:underline"><br /></span></p>
<h2>Option D. Joint Concentration with Religion as a Secondary Field</h2>
<p>Students will have a joint concentration with <span style="text-decoration:underline">religion as their secondary field</span>. This option also requires that a senior honors thesis be written.<span style="text-decoration:underline"></span></p>
<h2>Option Religion as a Secondary Field</h2>
<p>Religion as a Secondary Field does not require the writing of an honors thesis. The secondary field does require a combination of a) focused work in one area (a tradition or theme); and b) comparative or methodological courses that provide a broader framework for considering the tradition on which a student will focus. Students pursuing a Secondary Field in Religion are also asked to complete a Plan of Study and discuss it with the Director of Undergraduate Studies.</p>
<p>At the beginning of each semester, students are asked to complete a Plan of Study and discuss it with their advisers.</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-first"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374178945" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374178945"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Plan of Study Forms for Undergraduates</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374178945' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_a_2014-15_writeable.doc">Option A: Two Major Traditions in Comparative Context</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_b_2014-15_writeable.doc">Option B: One Major Tradition in Comparative Context</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_c_2014-15_writeable.doc">*Option C: Joint Concentration with Religion as the Primary Field</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_d_2014-15_writeable.doc">*Option D: Joint Concentration with Religion as a Allied Field</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_secondary_field_2014-15_writeable.doc">Religion as a Secondary Field</a></li>
</ul><p>*Students pursuing a Joint Concentration must also complete the college form<a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/joint_conc_app_2_-_without_list_of_programs.pdf"> "Joint Concentration Application".</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374163646" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374163646"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Guides &amp; Handbooks</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374163646' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/religious_studies_guide_print_10-1-13.pdf">Guide to Writing in the Study of Religion</a></li>
<li><a href="http://writing.fas.harvard.edu/" target="_blank">Writing Resources at Harvard</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_handbook_2016-7_final_0.pdf">Undergraduate Handbook</a> (2016-17)</li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/senior_thesis_handbook_2015-16_student.pdf">Senior Thesis Handbook</a> (2015-16)</li>
</ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>																	</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail   </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1374086388" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374086388"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Approved Traditions and Themes</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374086388' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h3>Approved Traditions</h3>
<ul><li>Ancient Near Eastern / Israelite</li>
<li>Buddhist</li>
<li>Christian</li>
<li>East Asian</li>
<li>Greek-Hellenistic-Roman</li>
<li>Hindu</li>
<li>Islamic</li>
<li>Judaic</li>
<li>Modern Western / Religions of the Americas</li>
<li>South Asian</li>
<li>African and Afro-Atlantic Religions</li>
</ul><h3>Approved Themes</h3>
<ul><li>Religion and Gender</li>
<li>Religion and Society</li>
<li>Religion and the Arts</li>
<li>Philosophy of Religion</li>
</ul><p><em>It may be possible to substitute other traditions or themes depending on faculty and course offerings.</em></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1373989095" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1373989095"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Concentration Questions?</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1373989095' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/courtney-bickel-lamberth">Director of Undergraduate Studies, Courtney Lamberth</a></p>
<p><a href="mailto:kstreet@fas.harvard.edu">Assistant Director of Undergraduate Studies, Kera Street</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->

					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/about" >ABOUT</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>

															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Contact                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-57086" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Committee on the Study of Religion at Harvard University <br />12 Quincy St., Barker Center 302<br />Cambridge, MA 02138<br /><a href="mailto:csrel@fas.harvard.edu">csrel@fas.harvard.edu</a><br /><br /><em>The main entrance to the Barker Center is through the Quincy St. gate (across from the bus stop) and directly across from the Harvard Faculty Club.</em><br /><em>Deliveries can enter via the Prescott St. entrance. 15 minute parking is available with hazard lights on and access to the elevator is near this entrance.</em></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-31281"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/about"  class="active-trail active">About</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-31286"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/contact"  class="active-trail active active">Contact</a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32816"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/historical-overview" >Historical Overview</a></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>

      <h2 class="block-title">Contact</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374589885' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div class="item-list"><ul class="featured-links"><li><article id="node-62351" class="node node-person node-unpublished node-teaser article with-person-photo modified-in-os_profiles_process_node clearfix" role="article">

					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/undergraduate" >UNDERGRADUATE</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/about" >ABOUT</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Courses                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1408379148" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1408379148"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Courses Designed for Undergraduates</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1408379148' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	A full list of Undergraduate Courses for 2017-18 with descriptions can be found <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/2017-2018_relcoruses_long.pdf">here</a>. This list is updated as new courses are added.
</p>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-146421"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/undergraduate"  class="active-trail active">Undergraduate</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32966"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/faqs-undergraduate-program" >FAQ&#039;s: Undergraduate Program</a></li><li class="leaf active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-35426"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/courses"  class="active-trail active active">Courses</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32561"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/admission" >Concentrating</a></li><li class="collapsed menu-depth-2 menu-item-32581"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/advising" >Advising</a></li><li class="collapsed menu-depth-2 menu-item-32596"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/coursework" >Coursework</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-33086"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/links-undergraduates" >Resources for Undergraduates</a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-39351"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/beyond-harvard-0" >Beyond Harvard</a></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1373989095" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1373989095"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Concentration Questions?</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1373989095' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/courtney-bickel-lamberth">Director of Undergraduate Studies, Courtney Lamberth</a></p>
<p><a href="mailto:kstreet@fas.harvard.edu">Assistant Director of Undergraduate Studies, Kera Street</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1374077585" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374077585"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Courses</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374077585' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p></p>
<ul><li><strong><a href="https://my.harvard.edu/">my.harvard.edu</a> - for current students and faculty</strong><a href="http://coursecatalog.harvard.edu/icb/icb.do" target="_blank"></a></li>
<li><a href="http://coursecatalog.harvard.edu/icb/icb.do" target="_blank">Harvard University Course Catalog</a> - searchable database across schools</li>
<li><a href="http://www.registrar.fas.harvard.edu/faculty-staff/classrooms">FAS Course Meetings Location Report</a></li>
<li><strong>Historical: </strong><a href="http://www.registrar.fas.harvard.edu/courses-exams/courses-instruction/study-religion">FAS Registrar Courses of Instruction, The Study of Religion section</a></li>
</ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1364321266" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1364321266"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Words from our Students</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1364321266' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><address>"The structure of the concentration gives students a lot of flexibility and freedom to explore the religions and themes they're interested in. In my experience, the professors are also very involved and want to get to know you on a personal level, which is something you don't get in the larger concentrations." – Hebert, '13</address></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1374163646" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374163646"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Guides &amp; Handbooks</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374163646' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/religious_studies_guide_print_10-1-13.pdf">Guide to Writing in the Study of Religion</a></li>
<li><a href="http://writing.fas.harvard.edu/" target="_blank">Writing Resources at Harvard</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_handbook_2016-7_final_0.pdf">Undergraduate Handbook</a> (2016-17)</li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/senior_thesis_handbook_2015-16_student.pdf">Senior Thesis Handbook</a> (2015-16)</li>
</ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>
		<!--footer region beg-->
		<footer id="footer" class="clearfix" role="contentinfo">
		<!-- Three column 3x33 Gpanel -->
		
			<div class="at-panel gpanel panel-display footer clearfix">
								<div class="region region-footer-first"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1371845153" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_media no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1371845153"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1371845153' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id="file-53886" class="file file-image file-image-png">

          <h2 class="element-invisible"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/religion-footer.png?m=1479879567">religion-footer.png</a></h2>

    <img class="image-style-os-files-xxlarge" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_xxlarge/public/religion/files/religion-footer.png?m=1499733428&amp;itok=K-pEO8QM" width="300" height="63" alt="" title="" />  </div>

					<!--header regions beg-->
			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">

					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-info" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_info no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_info"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_info' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h1><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >Committee on the Study of Religion</a></h1>
    
    <p>
    </p></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>					  					  <div class="region region-header-third"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-secondary-menu" class="block block-os no-title"  module="os" delta="secondary-menu"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/undergraduate" >UNDERGRADUATE</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Coursework                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-63176" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><h2>Honors and Non-Honors Tracks</h2>
<p>The Comparative Study of Religion offers an <strong>honors</strong> (14 half-courses) and a <strong>non-honors</strong> (12 half-courses) track. For all concentrators, 12 half-courses are distributed as follows:</p>
<div class="topic">
<div class="topic-wrap">
<div class="content">
<div class="wrap">
<ul><li>One introductory Religion course (Rel. 11-20)</li>
<li>One semester of sophomore tutorial (Rel. 97)</li>
<li>One semester of junior tutorial (Rel. 98a or b)</li>
<li>Nine other Religion courses</li>
</ul><p>Students in the honors track also enroll in:</p>
<ul><li>Two semesters of senior tutorial (Rel. 99a and 99b)</li>
</ul><p>To be considered for the honors track, students must write an honors thesis and participate in the senior tutorial (Religion 99). In order to be eligible to write a thesis, students must maintain a minimum average in the concentration of B+. Especially because the thesis is optional and is intended for students pursuing exceptional levels of achievement, we expect students to have developed, with the guidance of their advisers and mentors, the necessary competencies for their work, among them linguistic skills, fieldwork preparation, and archival practice. In particular, students who wish to pursue a thesis using ethnographic or anthropological approaches are required to complete <strong>Religion 20</strong> or another approved course introducing these methods. Any student planning to write a thesis involving work with human subjects should plan to take an approved course in ethnographic or anthropological methods by the end of the junior year. For a list of courses that would fulfill this requirement, contact the Director or Assistant Director of Undergraduate Studies. Note that students pursuing research using human subjects must also apply to <a href="http://cuhs.harvard.edu">Harvard’s Committee on the Use of Human Subjects</a> for approval.</p>
<p>In addition to Religion 99a and 99b (which is graded SAT/UNSAT), one half-course taken SAT/UNSAT at Harvard can be counted for concentration credit.</p>
<p><em>Download the current or previous undergraduate concentrator handbooks: <a href="http://isites.harvard.edu/fs/docs/icb.topic772568.files/ab_handbook_2004-05.pdf" target="_blank"></a><a href="http://isites.harvard.edu/fs/docs/icb.topic768603.files//ab_handbook_2011-12.pdf" target="_blank"></a><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_handbook_2013-14_rev_of_final_2-2-2014.pdf?m=1391452773">2013-14</a>, <a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_handbook_2014-15_8-18-14_final_test.pdf?m=1408557166">2014-15</a>, <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_handbook_2015-6.pdf">2015-16</a><br /></em></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1374084810" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374084810"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Language Requirement</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374084810' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>While students are no longer required to take an intermediate language course, the concentration expects that they will study languages necessary to their specialty. Students who elect to write a senior honors thesis should integrate the use of relevant languages into their analysis (e.g., if a student is writing about Qur’anic interpretation, he or she needs to have some knowledge of Arabic). An important consideration in the evaluation of a senior thesis is whether students demonstrate an awareness of primary sources in their original language.</p>
<p>In general, students may count up to two language courses towards concentration credit when the texts they are reading are either from a religious tradition or relevant to the study of a religious tradition, beginning with the second term of instruction in a single language.</p></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-first"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374178945" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374178945"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Plan of Study Forms for Undergraduates</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374178945' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_a_2014-15_writeable.doc">Option A: Two Major Traditions in Comparative Context</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_b_2014-15_writeable.doc">Option B: One Major Tradition in Comparative Context</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_c_2014-15_writeable.doc">*Option C: Joint Concentration with Religion as the Primary Field</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_d_2014-15_writeable.doc">*Option D: Joint Concentration with Religion as a Allied Field</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_secondary_field_2014-15_writeable.doc">Religion as a Secondary Field</a></li>
</ul><p>*Students pursuing a Joint Concentration must also complete the college form<a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/joint_conc_app_2_-_without_list_of_programs.pdf"> "Joint Concentration Application".</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374163646" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374163646"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Guides &amp; Handbooks</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374163646' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/religious_studies_guide_print_10-1-13.pdf">Guide to Writing in the Study of Religion</a></li>
<li><a href="http://writing.fas.harvard.edu/" target="_blank">Writing Resources at Harvard</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_handbook_2016-7_final_0.pdf">Undergraduate Handbook</a> (2016-17)</li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/senior_thesis_handbook_2015-16_student.pdf">Senior Thesis Handbook</a> (2015-16)</li>
</ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>																	</div>

  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1374077585" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374077585"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374077585' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p></p>

  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1373989095" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1373989095"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Concentration Questions?</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1373989095' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/courtney-bickel-lamberth">Director of Undergraduate Studies, Courtney Lamberth</a></p>
<p><a href="mailto:kstreet@fas.harvard.edu">Assistant Director of Undergraduate Studies, Kera Street</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1364321266" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1364321266"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Words from our Students</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1364321266' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><address>"The structure of the concentration gives students a lot of flexibility and freedom to explore the religions and themes they're interested in. In my experience, the professors are also very involved and want to get to know you on a personal level, which is something you don't get in the larger concentrations." – Hebert, '13</address></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->

<meta name="description" content="The Introductory Courses in the Comparative Study of Religion are intended to introduce students to key categories in the study of religion (e.g., scripture, ethics, myth, body and practice), both within a comparative context (specifically in more than three traditions) and with significant attention to theoretical and methodological. These courses are an excellent way to explore the field." />
<meta property="og:description" content="The Introductory Courses in the Comparative Study of Religion are intended to introduce students to key categories in the study of religion (e.g., scripture, ethics, myth, body and practice), both within a comparative context (specifically in more than three traditions) and with significant attention to theoretical and methodological. These courses are an excellent way to explore the field." />

    <div id="page_wrap" class="page_wrap">

				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/undergraduate" >UNDERGRADUATE</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/coursework" >COURSEWORK</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Introductory Courses                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-63331" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>The Introductory Courses in the Comparative Study of Religion are intended to introduce students to key categories in the study of religion (e.g., scripture, ethics, myth, body and practice), both within a comparative context (specifically in more than three traditions) and with significant attention to theoretical and methodological. These courses are an excellent way to explore the field.</p>
<p>An introductory course with a comparative component (one numbered 11 through 20) is required of all concentrators, and students are advised to take one during their first three semesters at Harvard. Currently offered introductory courses include the following:</p>
<p><a href="http://isites.harvard.edu/icb/icb.do?keyword=k16845&amp;pageid=icb.page80031&amp;pageContentId=icb.pagecontent189795&amp;view=choose_method&amp;viewParam_course_instance_id=308614"><strong></strong></a><a href="http://isites.harvard.edu/icb/icb.do?keyword=k87099"><strong>Religion 12. Critical Issues in the Comparative Study of Religion</strong></a> <br /><strong><a href="http://isites.harvard.edu/course/colgsas-54506">Religion 13. Scriptures and Classics</a></strong><br /><a href="http://isites.harvard.edu/icb/icb.do?keyword=k87108"><strong>Religion 20. Ethnographies of Religion, Texts and Contexts</strong></a></p>
<p><strong>Other courses designed for undergraduates exploring the concentration:</strong></p>
<p><strong><a href="http://isites.harvard.edu/course/colgsas-34366">Religion 25: Introduction to Judaism</a></strong><br /><a href="http://isites.harvard.edu/icb/icb.do?keyword=k90096"><strong>Religion 40. Incarnation and Desire: An Introduction to Christianity</strong></a><br /><strong> <a href="http://www.courses.fas.harvard.edu/18768">Religion 50. Religion, Law and American Politics: Seminar</a></strong><br /><strong><a href="http://isites.harvard.edu/course/colgsas-44656">Religion 57: Faith and Authenticity: Religion, Existentialism and the Human Condition</a></strong><br /><strong><a href="http://isites.harvard.edu/course/colgsas-1694">Religion 1003: Comparative Religion: History, Challenge, Potential</a></strong><br /><strong><a href="http://isites.harvard.edu/course/colgsas-61121">Religion 1006: Religion and Literature: An Introduction</a></strong><br /><strong><a href="http://isites.harvard.edu/course/colgsas-99892">Religion 1018: African American Religions: An Introduction</a></strong><br /><strong><a href="http://isites.harvard.edu/course/colgsas-1701">Religion 1806: The Vocabulary of Islam</a></strong></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-first"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374163646" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374163646"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Guides &amp; Handbooks</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374163646' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/religious_studies_guide_print_10-1-13.pdf">Guide to Writing in the Study of Religion</a></li>
<li><a href="http://writing.fas.harvard.edu/" target="_blank">Writing Resources at Harvard</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_handbook_2016-7_final_0.pdf">Undergraduate Handbook</a> (2016-17)</li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/senior_thesis_handbook_2015-16_student.pdf">Senior Thesis Handbook</a> (2015-16)</li>
</ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1374515432" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374515432"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Undergraduate Resources</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374515432' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="http://osl.fas.harvard.edu/icb/icb.do?keyword=k65178&amp;pageid=icb.page305611">Office of Student Life – Student Organizations</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ocs.fas.harvard.edu/">Office of Career Services</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.funding.fas.harvard.edu/">Harvard College Funding Sources</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.college.harvard.edu/icb/icb.do?keyword=k61161&amp;pageid=icb.page257820">Harvard College</a></li>
<li><a href="http://oie.fas.harvard.edu/">Office of International Education</a></li>
<li><a href="http://cuhs.harvard.edu/">Harvard’s Committee on the Use of Human Subjects</a></li>
</ul><p>Register your travel abroad for emergency support:<br /><a href="https://www.globalsupport.harvard.edu/travel-tools">www.globalsupport.harvard.edu/travel-tools</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374178945" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374178945"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Plan of Study Forms for Undergraduates</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374178945' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_a_2014-15_writeable.doc">Option A: Two Major Traditions in Comparative Context</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_b_2014-15_writeable.doc">Option B: One Major Tradition in Comparative Context</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_c_2014-15_writeable.doc">*Option C: Joint Concentration with Religion as the Primary Field</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_d_2014-15_writeable.doc">*Option D: Joint Concentration with Religion as a Allied Field</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_secondary_field_2014-15_writeable.doc">Religion as a Secondary Field</a></li>
</ul><p>*Students pursuing a Joint Concentration must also complete the college form<a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/joint_conc_app_2_-_without_list_of_programs.pdf"> "Joint Concentration Application".</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>																	</div>

  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1373989095" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1373989095"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Concentration Questions?</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1373989095' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/courtney-bickel-lamberth">Director of Undergraduate Studies, Courtney Lamberth</a></p>
<p><a href="mailto:kstreet@fas.harvard.edu">Assistant Director of Undergraduate Studies, Kera Street</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1374077585" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374077585"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Courses</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374077585' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p></p>
<ul><li><strong><a href="https://my.harvard.edu/">my.harvard.edu</a> - for current students and faculty</strong><a href="http://coursecatalog.harvard.edu/icb/icb.do" target="_blank"></a></li>
<li><a href="http://coursecatalog.harvard.edu/icb/icb.do" target="_blank">Harvard University Course Catalog</a> - searchable database across schools</li>
<li><a href="http://www.registrar.fas.harvard.edu/faculty-staff/classrooms">FAS Course Meetings Location Report</a></li>
<li><strong>Historical: </strong><a href="http://www.registrar.fas.harvard.edu/courses-exams/courses-instruction/study-religion">FAS Registrar Courses of Instruction, The Study of Religion section</a></li>
</ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1364321266" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1364321266"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Words from our Students</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1364321266' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><address>"The structure of the concentration gives students a lot of flexibility and freedom to explore the religions and themes they're interested in. In my experience, the professors are also very involved and want to get to know you on a personal level, which is something you don't get in the larger concentrations." – Hebert, '13</address></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>

		<!--footer region beg-->
		<footer id="footer" class="clearfix" role="contentinfo">
		<!-- Three column 3x33 Gpanel -->
		
			<div class="at-panel gpanel panel-display footer clearfix">
								<div class="region region-footer-first"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1371845153" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_media no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1371845153"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1371845153' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id="file-53886" class="file file-image file-image-png">

          <h2 class="element-invisible"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/religion-footer.png?m=1479879567">religion-footer.png</a></h2>
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <img class="image-style-os-files-xxlarge" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_xxlarge/public/religion/files/religion-footer.png?m=1499733428&amp;itok=K-pEO8QM" width="300" height="63" alt="" title="" />  </div>

  
</div>
</div></div></div>
  </div></div><div id="block-boxes-1372101242" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1372101242"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1372101242' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><strong>Committee on the Study of Religion</strong><br />Barker Center, Cambridge, MA 02138<br />Telephone: (617) 495-5781<br /><a href="mailto:csrel@fas.harvard.edu">csrel@fas.harvard.edu</a></p></div></div></div>

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics" >ACADEMICS</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Doctoral                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-56831" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
      </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1372167823" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1372167823"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">PhD Program</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1372167823' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>The Ph.D. program in religion at Harvard dates from 1934, when the Faculty of Arts and Sciences established a degree of Ph.D. in "The History and Philosophy of Religion". Its purpose, as stated by the Faculty, was "to make possible a course of studies which shall enable the candidate both to lay a broad and sufficient foundation for teaching and study within the field of religion, and to do individual research at some point in that field". In accordance with that expressed intention, the Faculty voted in 1963 to name the program The Study of Religion. This program as of 2015, is jointly offered by the Graduate School of Arts and Sciences and Harvard Divinity School. It is administered by the Committee on the Study of Religion in the Faculty of Arts and Sciences. Faculty from both schools advise Ph.D. students and offer courses in the program. Applicants to the Ph.D. program apply to the Graduate School of Arts and Sciences, Harvard University.</p>
<p>From 1914 to 2014 students were admitted to the Th.D. program, with the degree conferred by the Harvard Divinity School. The program came to be administered by the Committee on the Study of Religion (FAS) beginning in 1982. In 2015 Harvard Divinity School merged its doctoral designation into the Ph.D. program. Those students previously admitted into the Th.D. program in the Study of Religion continue to be candidates for the Th.D., however no new students will be admitted to earn the Th.D.</p>
<p>At Harvard, advanced programs of study involving religion may be arranged under many auspices. The Ph.D. under the Committee on the Study of Religion, in "The Study of Religion", is one among various possibilities. Some candidates will find that they can best pursue their interests by becoming a candidate for the Ph.D. in such departments as Anthropology, Classics, History, East Asian or Near Eastern Languages and Civilizations, Philosophy, or South Asian Studies.</p>
<p>Resources for the study of religion at Harvard are vast. We offer courses in the range of religious traditions from the ancient Zoroastrian tradition to modern Christian liberation movements, Islamic and Jewish philosophies, Buddhist social movements, and Hindu arts and culture. Some of us work primarily as historians, others as scholars of texts, others as anthropologists, although the boundaries of these methodologies are never firm. Some of us are adherents of a religious tradition; others are not at all religious. The Study of Religion is exciting and challenging precisely because of the conversations that take place across the complexities of disciplines, traditions, and intellectual commitments.</p>
<p>Courses in religion are offered in many departments – Near Eastern Languages and Civilizations, East Asian Languages and Civilizations, Anthropology, South Asian Studies, and Medieval Studies, among others. Faculty members in these and other departments are affiliated with the Study of Religion. In addition, Harvard Divinity School has a wide-ranging faculty many of whose courses are available to students for cross-registration.</p>
<p>To review the areas of study in which students may pursue doctoral work, please see: <a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/research">Research</a>.</p></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-31161"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics"  class="active-trail active">Academics</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31166"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/undergraduate" >Undergraduate</a></li><li class="last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-31171"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral"  class="active-trail active active">Doctoral</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first collapsed menu-depth-3 menu-item-31306"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/phd-program" >PhD Program &amp; Timeline</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-33061"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/links-doctoral-students" >Links for Doctoral Students</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-32971"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/faqs-doctoral" >FAQ&#039;s: Doctoral</a></li><li class="last collapsed menu-depth-3 menu-item-31311"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/thd-program" >ThD Program</a></li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1472238788" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1472238788"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Doctoral Student Handbooks</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1472238788' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/139pqOBBoI0KkYhpsZAZiNDa0VU4E-uOZInpygx-Mco8/edit?usp=sharing" target="_blank" title="">Ph.D. Student Handbook</a><br /><a href="http://handbook.gsas.harvard.edu/gsas-handbook" title="">GSAS Student Handbook</a><br /><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/thd_handbook_2016.pdf">Th.D. Student Handbook</a><a href=""  class="os-embed-link" data-delta="1472238788">&lt;embed&gt;</a><div id="embed-popup-1472238788" class="embed-popup"><ul class="links num-links-2"><li class="link-count-iframe first"><a href="#1472238788-iframe" >Iframe</a></li><li class="link-count-oembed last"><a href="#1472238788-oembed" >URL</a></li></ul><div id="1472238788-iframe"><div class="form-item form-type-textarea form-item-web-widgets">

  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1374089186" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374089186"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Doctoral Program Contacts</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374089186' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	Director of Graduate Studies, Professor David Holland<br /><a href="mailto:dholland@hds.harvard.edu">dholland@hds.harvard.edu</a>

	Program Administrator, Elise Ciregna<br /><a href="mailto:emciregna@fas.harvard.edu">emciregna@fas.harvard.edu</a><br /><br />ThD Administrator, Kathryn Kunkel<br /><a href="mailto:kkunkel@hds.harvard.edu">kkunkel@hds.harvard.edu</a>

</div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1476823074" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1476823074"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Forms for Current Students in Ph.D. Program</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1476823074' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>These forms are for students who are *enrolled* in the Ph.D. program. <strong>Do *not* request access</strong> if you are applying to the Ph.D. program.</p><ul><li><a href="https://docs.google.com/a/harvard.edu/document/d/16wlb4LD2NgMteJ7X0q_9d418vFBUBU1qjjcrFOXdP2I/edit?usp=sharing" title="">Plan of Study</a></li><li><a href="https://goo.gl/forms/w80b6mQGPVRBOIi33" title="">Intent to Take the Second Year Review</a></li><li><a href="https://goo.gl/forms/qrVDPsjLzTIIeWM32" title="">Intent to Take General Exams</a></li><li><a href="https://docs.google.com/a/harvard.edu/document/d/1uLO2yz184gawZctHd6uawOwB4auSDdueAnmytjk3TGY/edit?usp=sharing" title="">Dissertation Prospectus Checklist</a></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1472248730" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_media"  module="boxes" delta="1472248730"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

<meta name="description" content="Guidelines for Advising and Mentoring Doctoral Students The advising of doctoral students is one of the most important aspects of our work as teachers and scholars. This document is meant to establish some general guidelines or best practices for the advisor-doctoral student relationship as a set of mutual or shared responsibilities. “Guidelines for Advising and Mentoring Doctoral Students” was developed in conversations among members of the Doctoral Subcommittee (which includes doctoral student representatives) and more broadly with students in the program." />
<meta property="og:description" content="Guidelines for Advising and Mentoring Doctoral Students The advising of doctoral students is one of the most important aspects of our work as teachers and scholars. This document is meant to establish some general guidelines or best practices for the advisor-doctoral student relationship as a set of mutual or shared responsibilities. “Guidelines for Advising and Mentoring Doctoral Students” was developed in conversations among members of the Doctoral Subcommittee (which includes doctoral student representatives) and more broadly with students in the program." />

<div id="page" class="container page os_pages-section-56816 header-main header-right content-top footer-left">
	<div id="page-wrapper">

		
					<!--header regions beg-->
			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-info" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_info no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_info"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_info' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h1><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >Committee on the Study of Religion</a></h1>
    
    <p>
    </p></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>					  					  <div class="region region-header-third"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-secondary-menu" class="block block-os no-title"  module="os" delta="secondary-menu"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-secondary-menu" id="nice-menu-secondary-menu"><li class="menu-22511 menu-path-faq  first   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq"  title="List of FAQs">FAQ</a></li><li class="menu-2605 menu-path-node-63151   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/apply-phd" >Apply PhD</a></li><li class="menu-6668 menu-path-studyofreligionfasharvardedu-pages-forms   odd  "><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/forms"  title="For Current Students &amp; Faculty">Forms</a></li><li class="menu-2603 menu-path-node-57086   even   last "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/contact" >Contact</a></li></ul>
</div>
  </div></div><div id="block-boxes-solr-search-box" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_search_solr_search_box no-title"  module="boxes" delta="solr_search_box"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-solr_search_box' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><form class="search-block-form" action="/pages/doctoral-advising" method="post" id="search-block-form" accept-charset="UTF-8"><div><div class="container-inline">

			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics" >ACADEMICS</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral" >DOCTORAL</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/phd-program" >PHD PROGRAM &amp; TIMELINE</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Advising                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-63266" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><h2>Guidelines for Advising and Mentoring Doctoral Students</h2>
<p></p>
<p>The advising of doctoral students is one of the most important aspects of our work as teachers and scholars. This document is meant to establish some general guidelines or best practices for the advisor-doctoral student relationship as a set of mutual or shared responsibilities. “Guidelines for Advising and Mentoring Doctoral Students” was developed in conversations among members of the Doctoral Subcommittee (which includes doctoral student representatives) and more broadly with students in the program.</p>
<p>Entering doctoral students may request a specific advisor; customarily the faculty member indicated in the student's application based on the area of specialization is assigned. Doctoral students can and should request a change of advisor if the need arises, and all students are encouraged to work with as many faculty members in their field as possible. Occasionally students will have two co-advisors.</p>
<p>The primary responsibilities of the advisor are a) to counsel the student on how best to lay the foundations, through course work and seminars, for more independent work in the area of specialization; and b) to help ensure that these specialized studies are set within the general context of the study of religion. The faculty advisor participates in a student’s second year review, ordinarily chairs the examining committee for the general examinations, works with the student in formulating a prospectus, and directs the writing of the dissertation.</p>
<h2>Academic Advising</h2>
<p></p>
<p>Advisors meet with their doctoral students—especially those at the pre-dissertation stage—a minimum of three times per semester, for at least an hour each meeting: at the beginning, mid-point, and end of the semester. For students who are working elsewhere and easily accessible via phone and/or email, the same general guidelines for contact hours apply.</p>
<p>Advisors remain in contact with doctoral students as above during periods of leave.</p>
<p>In advising first- and second-year doctoral students, special attention is paid to the work of choosing classes. Coursework selections are meant to be general enough to provide context for the student’s special area(s) of interest and specific enough to guide the student toward both general examination fields and a workable dissertation topic. Advisors also help ensure that students meet their language requirements and their general course requirements in a timely fashion.</p>
<p>In advising third-year students, special attention is paid to helping the student assemble a committee for general examinations.</p>
<p>For students who are post-generals, advisors provide timely reading (within four weeks of submission) and substantial commenting on drafts of the dissertation prospectus and all subsequent chapters. Advisors also counsel students on seeking employment, from reading drafts of letters of application to commenting on writing samples and job talks to introducing students to scholars in the field at conferences and seminars.</p>
<p>Requests for recommendation letters are to be made by the student at least three weeks in advance of the deadline; recommendation letters are written and submitted by the advisor in a timely fashion.</p>
<h2>Mentoring about Teaching</h2>
<p></p>
<p>Mentoring doctoral students in teaching constitutes an extremely important part of the advisor’s (and other faculty members’) role. Faculty meet with all Teaching Fellows for at least one hour per week to discuss the course materials and provide instruction and feedback on matters pertaining to good pedagogy. Ideally such meetings are run as small seminars, allowing student-teachers to think through the intellectual issues raised by the course with the instructor, to read beyond the syllabus as necessary, and to reflect upon the best means of engaging students in class discussion of the material.</p>
<p>Currently, the CSR has a Departmental Teaching Fellow appointed jointly by the CSR and the Bok Center (see Resources).</p>
<p></p>
<p></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-31161"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics"  class="active-trail active">Academics</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31166"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/undergraduate" >Undergraduate</a></li><li class="last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-31171"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral"  class="active-trail active">Doctoral</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-3 menu-item-31306"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/phd-program"  class="active-trail active">PhD Program &amp;   </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1472238788" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1472238788"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/research" >RESEARCH</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      East Asian Religions                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-57506" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><img height="246" width="645" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-xlarge" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_xlarge/public/religion/files/taoist_monk_copy.jpg?m=1374763992&amp;itok=J1j-465m" alt="" title="" /></p>
<h2>Description</h2>
<p>The East Asian Religions subfield addresses the religions of China, Korea, and Japan through their historical and doctrinal development, their interactions, and in their social, political, and cultural contexts. The subfield addresses Buddhism, Confucianism, Christianity, Islam, Daoism, Shinto, new religious movements, and other religious phenomena of the region.<br /><br /><em>Recent and current dissertation topics include:</em></p>
<ul><li>Peak of Gold: Trace, Place and Religion in Heian Japan</li>
<li>Learning as a Way of Living: Lu Xiangshan and the Neo-Confucian Orientation to Learning</li>
<li>Toward a New History of Japanese and Korean Buddhist Relations, 1877-1912</li>
<li>Kakunyo and the Making of Shinran and Shin Buddhism</li>
</ul></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-31391"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/research"  class="active-trail active">Research</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/ethics" >Ethics</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31456"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/greco-roman-religions" href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/theology" >Theology</a></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1374004361" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_sv_list_box"  module="boxes" delta="1374004361"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Affiliated Faculty</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374004361' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id='box-1374004361-page' data-page='0' data-delta='1374004361' class='os-sv-list os_sv_list_box sv-list-person sv-list-view-title sv-list-layout-list sv-grid-3'><div class="item-list"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/ry%C3%BBichi-ab%C3%A9"  target="_top">Ryûichi Abé</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/helen-hardacre"  target="_top">Helen Hardacre</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/michael-james-puett"  target="_top">Michael James Puett</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/james-robson-0"  target="_top">James Robson</a></li></ul></div></div></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1377027303" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_sv_list_box"  module="boxes" delta="1377027303"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Doctoral Students in East Asian Religions</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1377027303' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id='box-1377027303-page' data-page='0' data-delta='1377027303' class='os-sv-list os_sv_list_box sv-list-person sv-list-view-title sv-list-layout-list sv-grid-3'><div class="item-list"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/sara-klingenstein"  target="_top">Sara Klingenstein</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/yuxin-qin"  target="_top">Yuxin Qin</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/lina-verchery"  target="_top">Lina Verchery</a></li></ul></div></div><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people"  class="more-link">More</a></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>

			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/research" >RESEARCH</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Ethics                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-57511" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><img height="246" width="645" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-xlarge" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_xlarge/public/religion/files/good_samaritain_copy_0.jpg?m=1374762076&amp;itok=_Sy-jimY" alt="" title="" /></p>
<p></p>
<h2>Description</h2>
<p><br />This field of concentration attends to the many ethical dimensions in religions, with particular interest in the formation of subjects by textual traditions, communities of exemplary instruction, social or political structures, and rituals or bodily disciplines. Faculty who teach in the area study ethics across diverse periods, regions, and traditions. Students are expected to concentrate on specific topics and theories while keeping in view cross-cultural or comparative contexts.<br /><br /></p>
<h2>General Examinations</h2>
<p><br />Four General Examinations are required for the Ph.D. in ethics, three for the Th.D.</p>
<ol><li>Theory and Methods (elective for Th.D. students)<br />The student will compose the list for this examination by adapting the general doctoral guidelines to ethics.</li>
<li>Context of Study<br />For this examination, the student will consider the ethical dimensions of a particular religious tradition or a specific historical complex that will serve as context for more specialized study.</li>
<li>Religious Ethics<br />The student will use this examination to become conversant in religious ethics considered as a field. The list for this examination should include important arguments, analyses, and terminologies from the academic study of religious ethics.</li>
<li>Special Topic<br />For this examination, the student will engage the primary sources and best scholarship related to the inquiry or project that will become the dissertation.</li>
</ol><p>The bibliography for each examination is to be composed in consultation with the faculty who will be conducting it under the general direction of the student’s advisor.<br /><br /><em>Recent and current dissertation topics include:</em></p>
<ul><li>Law, Equity, and Calvin’s Moral Critique of Protestant Faith</li>
<li>For the Common Moral Benefit: Thinking Through the conditions Necessary to Secure the Moral Priority and Fixity of Individual Rights</li>
</ul></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail   </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1374004469" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_sv_list_box"  module="boxes" delta="1374004469"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

<div id="page" class="container page os_pages-section-56816 header-main header-right content-top footer-left">
	<div id="page-wrapper">

		
					<!--header regions beg-->
			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-info" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_info no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_info"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_info' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h1><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >Committee on the Study of Religion</a></h1>
    
    <p>
    </p></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>					  					  <div class="region region-header-third"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-secondary-menu" class="block block-os no-title"  module="os" delta="secondary-menu"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-secondary-menu" id="nice-menu-secondary-menu"><li class="menu-22511 menu-path-faq  first   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq"  title="List of FAQs">FAQ</a></li><li class="menu-2605 menu-path-node-63151   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/apply-phd" >Apply PhD</a></li><li class="menu-6668 menu-path-studyofreligionfasharvardedu-pages-forms   odd  "><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/forms"  title="For Current Students &amp; Faculty">Forms</a></li><li class="menu-2603 menu-path-node-57086   even   last "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/contact" >Contact</a></li></ul>
</div>
  </div></div><div id="block-boxes-solr-search-box" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_search_solr_search_box no-title"  module="boxes" delta="solr_search_box"><div class="block-inner clearfix">
