		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/about" >ABOUT</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Historical Overview                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-63446" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>As a humanistic enterprise in the liberal arts, the study of religion is, like the social sciences, a relatively recent field of study in the curriculum of the western university. It is a field that spans the older tradition of the humanities, as well as the younger ones of the social sciences. At Harvard, it has been traditionally rooted in the study of history, languages, and philosophy, and if a bias still exists today, it is in the direction of these fields, in all of which the university is particularly strong.</p>
<p>Harvard's concern with religion is as old as the college itself, which its founders hoped would advance learning so as not "to leave an illiterate ministry to the churches" in succeeding generations. The oldest professorship at Harvard is the Hollis Professor of Divinity, dating from 1721; the first graduate program for ministers was begun in 1811; and the Harvard Divinity School was founded in 1816. The tradition of professional ministerial education continues in the Divinity School through the M.Div. degree, and other graduate degree programs have been developed at the school.</p>
<p>In the Yard, the Committee on the Study of Religion in the Faculty of Arts and Sciences administers two programs of study in religion, the more recent of which is the undergraduate concentration in "the Comparative Study of Religion", established by the Faculty of Arts and Sciences in 1974. The older program for the Ph.D. in the Study of Religion dates to 1934, when Ph.D. studies in "the History and Philosophy of Religion" were initiated. Harvard's distinguished record of scholarship in the study of religion in the arts and sciences context goes back still farther. One need only mention the name of William James, the great scholar of psychological and philosophical approaches to religion, or that of George Foot Moore, the eminent Semiticist and first renowned student of the religions of the world at Harvard.</p>
<p>More recently, Arthur Darby Nock established a worldwide reputation in the study of Greco-Roman and Hellenistic religion and early Christianity. In recent years, Professor Emeritus Wilfred Cantwell Smith (1916-2000), one of the foremost historians of world religion, stands out for his major role in shaping the current structure of both the A.B. and Ph.D. programs in religion. The founding of the <strong>Center for the Study of World Religions</strong> at Harvard in 1960, and the tenure of Smith as the second director (1964-1974) were milestones in religious studies at Harvard. The Center has brought to Cambridge many beginning students as well as senior scholars from around the world over the past twenty-five years. It remains a major resource for students interested in comparative studies, both at the graduate and at the undergraduate level.</p>
<p>The Committee on the Study of Religion is the interdisciplinary standing committee of the Faculty of Arts and Sciences that oversees both the undergraduate and doctoral (Ph.D. and Th.D.) programs in religion. The membership of this committee is drawn equally from the Arts and Sciences faculty and the Divinity faculty. Diverse departments are represented on the Committee, and students may find themselves working with professors in very different fields during their program of study: Classics, English, Archaeology, Fine Arts, Anthropology, History of Science, Psychology, and Philosophy, among others.</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-31281"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/about"  class="active-trail active">About</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31286"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/contact" >Contact</a></li><li class="last leaf active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-32816"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/historical-overview"  class="active-trail active active">Historical Overview</a></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>

					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/research" >RESEARCH</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      History of Christianity                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-61681" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><img height="246" width="645" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-xlarge" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_xlarge/public/religion/files/bishops_and_saints_in_st_g_copy.jpg?m=1374763707&amp;itok=OqMXO10A" alt="" title="" /></p>
<p></p>
<h2>Description</h2>
<p><br />Students in this area may specialize in any aspect of the history of Christianity broadly conceived including theology and religious thought, devotional practices and expressions, institutions and movements, social and cultural contexts, and lived religion. Students are expected to develop critical skills of documentary, artifactual and ethnographical interpretation, to develop methodological expertise appropriate for their chosen topic, and to familiarize themselves with the history of interpretive and historiographical traditions in their field. Although projects on all aspects of the history of Christianity are welcomed, the faculty has particular strengths in late antique, medieval, European, transatlantic, Caribbean, and American Christianity. Within those periods and locations there is particular expertise in the history of mysticism and enthusiasm, ethics and religious thought, race, gender and sexuality, radical, liberal, and evangelical expressions of Christianity, and African American Christianity and media culture. Students working on the history of American Christianity are expected to attend the bimonthly North American Religions Colloquium.<br /><br /><em>Recent and current dissertation topics include:</em></p>
<p></p>
<ul><li>The Cult of the Saints and its Christological Foundations in Eustratios of Constantinople’s De statu animarum post mortem</li>
<li>The ‘Eternal Return’ of the Byzantine Icon: Sacred and Secular in the Painting of Photis Kontoglou</li>
<li>Sainte-Anne-du-Petit-Cap: The Making of an Early Modern Shrine</li>
<li>No Closure: Catholic Practice and Boston's Parish Shutdowns</li>
<li>Protestant Sainthood: Martyrdom, Apocalypticism, and the Meaning of Sanctity in Early New England Failed Pygmalions: The Conversion and “Apostasy” of Pierre-Anthoine Pastedechouan, Seventeenth-Century Montagnais Indian</li>
<li>God-talk in the Yard: Religion in the Nineteenth Century Harvard College Curriculum</li>
<li>The Irish and the Incarnation: Images of Christ in the Old Irish Poems of Blathmac</li>
<li>Traditionary Religion: The Great Awakening and the Shaping of Native Cultures in Southern New England, 1736-1776</li>
<li>The Map of the Cosmos and the Ascent of the Soul: Synderesis, Weight, and the Affect in the Thought of Bonaventure</li>
<li>Heaven in a Bottle: Franciscan Apocalypticism and the Elixir, 1250–1360</li>
<li>The Vital Landscape: Evangelicalism and the Culture of Nature in America, 1790-1870</li>
</ul></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1374004658" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_sv_list_box"  module="boxes" delta="1374004658"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1371845153' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id="file-53886" class="file file-image file-image-png">

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/undergraduate" >UNDERGRADUATE</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/coursework" >COURSEWORK</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Independent Reading: Religion 91r                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-63371" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><br /><p><strong>Religion 91r</strong> is a course of supervised reading and research on a special topic in the Study of Religion. The 91r permits individuals or small groups to examine subjects that cannot be studied in regular courses. It involves reading and written work, both of which are evaluated by the faculty director with a letter grade and written comments. Religion 91r is normally open only to concentrators. The director of the course must be a member of the Harvard faculty—though exceptions to this rule may, in some cases, be authorized by the Director of Undergraduate Studies.</p>
<p>Students who wish to enroll in a 91r must give the Director of Undergraduate Studies a petition, signed by the proposed faculty director, that describes the reading and written work to be completed. <strong>The 91r petition is available from the Director of Undergraduate Studies.</strong> All Religion 91r proposals must receive the approval of the Director of Undergraduate Studies <span style="text-decoration:underline">prior to the deadline for handing in study cards.</span></p>
<p></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-first"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374178945" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374178945"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Plan of Study Forms for Undergraduates</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374178945' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_a_2014-15_writeable.doc">Option A: Two Major Traditions in Comparative Context</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_b_2014-15_writeable.doc">Option B: One Major Tradition in Comparative Context</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_c_2014-15_writeable.doc">*Option C: Joint Concentration with Religion as the Primary Field</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_d_2014-15_writeable.doc">*Option D: Joint Concentration with Religion as a Allied Field</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_secondary_field_2014-15_writeable.doc">Religion as a Secondary Field</a></li>
</ul><p>*Students pursuing a Joint Concentration must also complete the college form<a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/joint_conc_app_2_-_without_list_of_programs.pdf"> "Joint Concentration Application".</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374163646" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374163646"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Guides &amp; Handbooks</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374163646' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/religious_studies_guide_print_10-1-13.pdf">Guide to Writing in the Study of Religion</a></li>
<li><a href="http://writing.fas.harvard.edu/" target="_blank">Writing Resources at Harvard</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_handbook_2016-7_final_0.pdf">Undergraduate Handbook</a> (2016-17)</li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/senior_thesis_handbook_2015-16_student.pdf">Senior Thesis Handbook</a> (2015-16)</li>
</ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>																	</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-146421"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/undergraduate"  class="active-trail active">Undergraduate</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32966"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/faqs-undergraduate-program" >FAQ&#039;s: Undergraduate Program</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-35426"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/courses" >Courses</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32561"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/admission" >Concentrating</a></li><li class="collapsed menu-depth-2 menu-item-32581"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/advising" >Advising</a></li><li class="expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-32596"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/coursework"  class="active-trail active">Coursework</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-32711"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/coursework/introductory" >Introductory Courses</a></li><li class="collapsed menu-depth-3 menu-item-32771"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/tutorial-system" >Tutorial System</a></li><li class="collapsed menu-depth-3 menu-item-32836"><a menu-depth-2 menu-item-33086"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/links-undergraduates" >Resources for Undergraduates</a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-39351"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/beyond-harvard-0" >Beyond Harvard</a></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1373989095" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1373989095"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Concentration Questions?</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1373989095' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/courtney-bickel-lamberth">Director of Undergraduate Studies, Courtney Lamberth</a></p>
<p><a href="mailto:kstreet@fas.harvard.edu">Assistant Director of Undergraduate Studies, Kera Street</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1364321266" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1364321266"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Words from our Students</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1364321266' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><address>"The structure of the concentration gives students a lot of flexibility and freedom to explore the religions and themes they're interested in. In my experience, the professors are also very involved and want to get to know you on a personal level, which is something you don't get in the larger concentrations." – Hebert, '13</address></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>

					<!--header regions beg-->
			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-info" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_info no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_info"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_info' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h1><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >Committee on the Study of Religion</a></h1>
    
    <p>
    </p></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>					  					  <div class="region region-header-third"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-secondary-menu" class="block block-os no-title"  module="os" delta="secondary-menu"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-secondary-menu" id="nice-menu-secondary-menu"><li class="menu-22511 menu-path-faq  first   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq"  title="List of FAQs">FAQ</a></li><li class="menu-2605 menu-path-node-63151   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/apply-phd" >Apply PhD</a></li><li class="menu-6668 menu-path-studyofreligionfasharvardedu-pages-forms   odd  "><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/forms"  title="For Current Students &amp; Faculty">Forms</a></li><li class="menu-2603 menu-path-node-57086   even   last "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/contact" >Contact</a></li></ul>
</div>
  </div></div><div id="block-boxes-solr-search-box" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_search_solr_search_box no-title"  module="boxes" delta="solr_search_box"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

				  <!--main menu region beg-->
		  <div id="menu-bar" class="nav region-menu-bar clearfix"><nav id="block-os-primary-menu" class="block block-os no-title menu-wrapper menu-bar-wrapper clearfix"  module="os" delta="primary-menu">  
  
  <ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-primary-menu" id="nice-menu-primary-menu"><li class="menu-2336 menu-path-  first   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/research"  title="" class="active">Research</a><span class="open-submenu"></span><ul><li class="menu-3285 menu-path-node-57416  first   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/african-religions"  title="">African Religions</a></li><li class="menu-3295 menu-path-node-57436   even  "><a   </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/research" >RESEARCH</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Islamic Studies                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-61686" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><img height="246" width="645" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-xlarge" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_xlarge/public/religion/files/800px-qazvin_jameh_mosque_mosaic_copy.jpg?m=1376419510&amp;itok=mS-Ls01w" alt="" title="" /></p>
<p></p>
<h2>Description</h2>
<p><br />Islamic Studies engages students in the study of the religious institutions, texts and devotional life of Muslim societies. It encourages the study of Islam within a framework emphasizing the dynamic interaction between a global religious tradition and its multiple contexts (political, social, historical, literary, etc). Comparative work is welcome, as is the study of Islam in regional and transnational contexts. Study in this field usually requires some competence in Arabic and/or another language relevant to the student's specific Islamic research interests.<br /><br /><em>Recent and current dissertation topics include:</em></p>
<p></p>
<ul><li>Restricting the Public: France, the Veil and Religious Freedom</li>
<li>The Evolution of Religious Nationalism in Pakistan: Islamic Identity, Ideology and State Power</li>
<li>Forging New identities: Genealogy, Ethnicity, and the Pre-Islamic Prophets in Medieval Islam</li>
<li>Executing Justice in Islam: Historical, Poetical, Eschatological and Legal Dimensions of Punishment under the Saljuqs (1055-1194 CE)</li>
<li>Innovation of Deviation?: Exploring the Boundaries of Islamic Devotional Law</li>
<li>Reviving Religion: The Qadiri Sufi Order, Popular Devotion to Sufi Saint Muhyiuddin ‘Abdul Qadir al-Gilani and Process of “Islamization” in Tamil Nadu and Sri Lanka</li>
<li>Three Conceptions of Justice in Early Islam: Toward Understanding the Role of Religion in the History of Muslim Societies</li>
<li>Naguib Mahfouz’s ‘Socialistic Sufism’</li>
<li>Marriage, Divorce, and Child Custody as Experienced by American Muslims: Religious, Social, and Legal Considerations</li>
<li>The Poetics of Iblis: Qur’anic Narrative as Theology</li>
<li>Stoning in the Islamic Tradition: The Case of Northern Nigeria</li>
</ul></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail   </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1374004722" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_sv_list_box"  module="boxes" delta="1374004722"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/research" >RESEARCH</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Jewish Studies                     </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-61691" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><img height="246" width="645" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-xlarge" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_xlarge/public/religion/files/1850ukr_pesah_copy_0.jpg?m=1508251615&amp;itok=2v6XseI-" alt="" title="" /></p>
<p></p>
<h2>Description</h2>
<p><br />This field offers a wide variety of foci in which to study Judaism in periods ranging from the Second Temple to the contemporary. The methods of study vary with the concentration of the individual candidate, but in all cases involve substantial involvement in historical and textual approaches in the original languages and in the placement of the phenomena of Jewish religion within the larger cultural and religious contexts of the period. The students are encouraged to acquire basic familiarity with the broad sweep of Jewish history, literature, and religious thought beyond the limits of their own specialization and to develop an understanding of Judaism within the broader framework of the study of religion.<br /><br /></p>
<h2>Requirements</h2>
<p><br />Students are expected to have, or acquire, advanced proficiency in Hebrew and a good reading knowledge of German. In addition, depending on the individual specialization, they may be expected to acquire a sound reading knowledge in other languages, such as Aramaic, Greek, Latin, Arabic, Yiddish, and French. <br /><br /></p>
<h2>General Examinations</h2>
<p><br />Students are to work out their general examination structure and the bibliography for specific examinations in consultation with the faculty in the field and with awareness of the overall expectations of the doctoral program in the Committee on the Study of Religion. At least one examination will ordinarily be based on a special topic.<br /><br /><em>Recent and Current Dissertation Topics Include:</em></p>
<p></p>
<ul><li>An Intellectual and Spiritual Biography of Rabbi Avraham Yitzhaq Ha-Cohen Kook, 1865 - 1904</li>
<li>‘Big Boston’: the impact of Community Organizing on Christian and Jewish Congregations in Boston</li>
<li>Post-WWII American Judaism: How Judaism Became an American Religion</li>
<li>The Power of Silence: The Empty Temple Mount in Late Antique Jerusalem</li>
<li>Reciprocity and Responsiveness: Self-Transcendence and the Dynamics of Covenant in the Theology and Spirituality of Abraham Joshua Heschel</li>
</ul></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1374004796" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_sv_list_box"  module="boxes" delta="1374004796"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/undergraduate" >UNDERGRADUATE</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/coursework" >COURSEWORK</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/tutorial-system" >TUTORIAL SYSTEM</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Junior                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-63451" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><strong>The Junior Tutorial</strong> is an opportunity for students to work closely with a tutor and one to four other students on a specific topic in the study of religion. The tutorial should be within the student’s major tradition (or in one of the two in the case of students in Option A). Juniors have the option of taking a second tutorial. Students wishing to pursue this option should discuss it with the Director of Undergraduate Studies. The purposes of junior tutorials are:</p>
<ol><li>to read primary texts closely and critically;</li>
<li>to engage in rigorous discussion of these texts and the issues they raise;</li>
<li>to refine writing skills by writing papers and revising them; and</li>
<li>to help students explore in greater depth a topic that they may be considering for a thesis.</li>
</ol><p>In short, junior tutorials help students read texts carefully and make persuasive arguments about them. They also are an opportunity for students to begin work on an area of special academic interest.  The most important part of the junior tutorial is the work assigned for each and every week, and tutorial preparation should have top priority in a student’s studies. In addition, students will usually use the tutorial as a context in which to write the junior paper.</p>
<p><strong>The Junior Paper</strong> is completed by all juniors. It provides an opportunity to engage in an extended research project leading to a substantial piece of scholarship (approximately 25 pages). The paper should address a significant question or problem in the Study of Religion. It must engage both primary and secondary sources and be explicit regarding the methodology utilized. The final product should be the polished result of multiple drafts and rewriting.</p>
<p>Most often, students will write their junior paper in the context of the junior tutorial. In exceptional circumstances, arrangements can be made to write the paper in the context of a seminar. Students are encouraged to use this project as a starting point for the senior thesis.</p>
<p><strong>Junior Year Abroad</strong> is an excellent opportunity for Harvard College students. In the Study of Religion, if a student studies abroad usually they also have to double up on tutorials for one semester, either before leaving or after returning to campus. Tutorials cannot be taken out of residence. We recommend study abroad for the fall or spring of the junior year.</p>
<p><strong>Funding for International Experience</strong> may be found via the <a href="http://www.funding.fas.harvard.edu//">Harvard College Funding Sources Database.</a></p>
<p>See the <a href="http://oie.fas.harvard.edu/">Office of International Education</a> for more resources.</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-first"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374515432" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374515432"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Undergraduate Resources</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374515432' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="http://osl.fas.harvard.edu/icb/icb.do?keyword=k65178&amp;pageid=icb.page305611">Office of Student Life – Student Organizations</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ocs.fas.harvard.edu/">Office of Career Services</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.funding.fas.harvard.edu/">Harvard College Funding Sources</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.college.harvard.edu/icb/icb.do?keyword=k61161&amp;pageid=icb.page257820">Harvard College</a></li>
<li><a href="http://oie.fas.harvard.edu/">Office of International Education</a></li>
<li><a href="http://cuhs.harvard.edu/">Harvard’s Committee on the Use of Human Subjects</a></li>
</ul><p>Register your travel abroad for emergency support:<br /><a href="https://www.globalsupport.harvard.edu/travel-tools">www.globalsupport.harvard.edu/travel-tools</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374163646" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374163646"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Guides &amp; Handbooks</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374163646' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/religious_studies_guide_print_10-1-13.pdf">Guide to Writing in the Study of Religion</a></li>
<li><a href="http://writing.fas.harvard.edu/" target="_blank">Writing Resources at Harvard</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_handbook_2016-7_final_0.pdf">Undergraduate Handbook</a> (2016-17)</li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/senior_thesis_handbook_2015-16_student.pdf">Senior Thesis Handbook</a> (2015-16)</li>
</ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>																	</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-146421"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/undergraduate"  class="active-trail active">Undergraduate</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32966"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/faqs-undergraduate-program" >FAQ&#039;s: Undergraduate Program</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-35426"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/courses" >Courses</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32561"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/admission" >Concentrating</a></li><li class="collapsed menu-depth-2 menu-item-32581"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/advising" >Advising</a></li><li class="expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-32596"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/coursework"  class="active-trail active">Coursework</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-32711"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/coursework/introductory" >Introductory Courses</a></li><li class="expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-3 menu-item-32771"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/tutorial-system"  class="active-trail active">Tutorial System</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32811"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/tutorial-sophmore" >Sophmore</a></li><li class="leaf active-trail active-trail menu-depth-4 menu-item-32821"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/junior"  class="active-trail active active">Junior</a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32826"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/senior-tutorial" >Senior</a></li></ul></li><li class="collapsed menu-depth-3 menu-item-32836"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/senior-thesis" >Senior Honors Thesis</a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-32751"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/independent-reading-religion-91r" >Independent Reading: Religion 91r</a></li></ul></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-33086"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/links-undergraduates" >Resources for Undergraduates</a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-39351"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/beyond-harvard-0" >Beyond Harvard</a></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1373999204" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1373999204"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Sample Junior Tutorial Topics</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1373999204' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li>Comparative Mysticism</li>
<li>Literature and Religious Experience</li>
<li>Phenomenology of religion</li>
<li>Tibetan Buddhism</li>
<li>Readings in Mahäyäna Buddhism</li>
<li>Medieval Christian Eschatology</li>
<li>The Love of God: Readings in Augustine, Calvin, Kierkegaard, Buber</li>
<li>Creeds and Controversies of the First Six Centuries</li>
<li>The Development of Ancient Mystery religions</li>
<li>Hindu Renaissance</li>
<li>The Hindu Epic Tradition</li>
<li>Muslim Mysticism (Sufism)</li>
<li>Early Development of Islam and Islamic Institutions</li>
<li>Social Theory</li>
</ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1373989095" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1373989095"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Concentration Questions?</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1373989095' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/courtney-bickel-lamberth">Director of Undergraduate Studies, Courtney Lamberth</a></p>
<p><a href="mailto:kstreet@fas.harvard.edu">Assistant Director of Undergraduate Studies, Kera Street</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1364321266" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1364321266"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Words from our Students</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1364321266' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><address>"The structure of the concentration gives students a lot of flexibility and freedom to explore the religions and themes they're interested in. In my experience, the professors are also very involved and want to get to know you on a personal level, which is something you don't get in the larger concentrations." – Hebert, '13</address></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>
		<!--footer region beg-->
		<footer id="footer" class="clearfix" role="contentinfo">

					<!--header regions beg-->
			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-info" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_info no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_info"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_info' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h1><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >Committee on the Study of Religion</a></h1>
    
    <p>
    </p></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>					  					  <div class="region region-header-third"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-secondary-menu" class="block block-os no-title"  module="os" delta="secondary-menu"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-secondary-menu" id="nice-menu-secondary-menu"><li class="menu-22511 menu-path-faq  first   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq"  title="List of FAQs">FAQ</a></li><li class="menu-2605 menu-path-node-63151   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/apply-phd" >Apply PhD</a></li><li class="menu-6668 menu-path-studyofreligionfasharvardedu-pages-forms   odd  "><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/forms"  title="For Current Students &amp; Faculty">Forms</a></li><li class="menu-2603 menu-path-node-57086   even   last "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/contact" >Contact</a></li></ul>
</div>
  </div></div><div id="block-boxes-solr-search-box" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_search_solr_search_box no-title"  module="boxes" delta="solr_search_box"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

				  <!--main menu region beg-->
		  <div id="menu-bar" class="nav region-menu-bar clearfix"><nav id="block-os-primary-menu" class="block block-os no-title menu-wrapper menu-bar-wrapper clearfix"  module="os" delta="primary-menu">  
  
  <ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-primary-menu" id="nice-menu-primary-menu"><li class="menu-2336 menu-path-  first   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/african-religions"  title="">African Religions</a></li><li class="menu-3295 menu-path-node-57436   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/buddhist-studies"  title="">Buddhist Studies</a></li><li class="menu-3286 menu-path-node-57471   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/comparative-studies"  title="">Comparative Studies</a></li><li class="menu-3296 menu-path-node-57506   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/east-asian-religions"  title="">East Asian Religions</a></li><li class="menu-3287 menu-path-node-57511   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/ethics"  title="">Ethics</a></li><li class="menu-3297 menu-path-node-57516   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/greco-roman-religions"  title="">Greco-Roman Religions</a></li><li class="menu-3288 menu-path-node-57521   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/hebrew-bibleold-testament"  title="">Hebrew Bible/Old Testament</a></li><li class="menu-3289 menu-path-node-61681   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/history-christianity"  title="">History of Christianity</a></li><li class="menu-3302 menu-path-node-61686   odd  "><a menu-path-node-61716   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/religions-americas"  title="">Religions of the Americas</a></li><li class="menu-3293 menu-path-node-61726   odd   </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/resources" >RESOURCES</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/about" >ABOUT</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Resources                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374086901" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374086901"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Related Organizations at Harvard</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374086901' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><em>Many of these organizations have their own events calendars and mailing lists. We do not usually repeat events from the mailing lists of other organizations in our own newsletter, so if you are interested in staying up to date, you are encouraged to subscribe to the appropriate mailing list.</em></p><table border="0" style="width:642px; height:284px"><tr><td><ul><li><p><a href="http://hds.harvard.edu/">Harvard Divinity School</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://cswr.hds.harvard.edu/home">Center for the Study of World Religions at the Harvard Divinity School</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://wsrp.hds.harvard.edu/home">Women's Studies in Religion Program at the Harvard Divinity School</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://rpp.hds.harvard.edu/">Religions and the Practice of Peace Initiative</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://mahindrahumanities.fas.harvard.edu/">Mahindra Humanities Center</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://pluralism.org/">The Pluralism Project</a> </p></li><li><p><a href="http://wcfia.harvard.edu/">Weatherhead Center for International Affairs</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://www.islamicstudies.harvard.edu/">The Prince Alwaleed Bin Talal Islamic Studies Program</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://www.doaks.org/" title="">Dumbarton Oaks Research Library and Collection</a></p></li></ul></td><td><ul><li><p><a href="http://cmes.fas.harvard.edu">Harvard University Center For Middle Eastern Studies</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://southasiainstitute.harvard.edu/">Harvard University South Asia Institute</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://asiacenter.harvard.edu/">Harvard University Asia Center</a> </p></li><li><p><a href="http://rijs.fas.harvard.edu/">Reischauer Institute of Japanese Studies</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://fairbank.fas.harvard.edu/">Fairbank Center for Chinese Studies</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://hutchinscenter.fas.harvard.edu/">Hutchins Center for African and African American Research</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://iaas.fas.harvard.edu/">Committee on Inner Asia and Altaic Studies</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://isites.harvard.edu/icb/icb.do?keyword=k21071" target="_blank">Harvard Buddhist Studies Forum</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://chaplains.harvard.edu/">Harvard Chaplains</a></p></li></ul></td></tr></table></div></div></div>
  </div></section><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-63841" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
      </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->

				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1372094510" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1372094510"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Connecting</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1372094510' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><img height="124" width="280" alt="Undergraduate and Graduate Students at F2013 Reception" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-medium" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_medium/public/religion/files/dscn0043_for_web.jpg?m=1508252735&amp;itok=NHyCrIp2" title="" /></p><ul><li>LinkedIn Group: "<a href="http://www.linkedin.com/groups?home=&amp;gid=4887651&amp;trk=anet_ug_hm" target="_blank">Alumni of Harvard University Comparative Study of Religion <strong>Undergraduate</strong> Concentration</a>"</li><li>LinkedIn Group: "<a href="http://www.linkedin.com/groups?gid=4887339&amp;trk=myg_ugrp_ovr" target="_blank"><strong>Doctoral</strong> Alumni from the Study of Religion at Harvard University</a>"</li><li><a href="https://www.aarweb.org/2013-employment-center">AAR Employment Center</a></li><li><a href="http://www.academia.edu/">Academia.edu</a></li><li><a href="http://openscholar.harvard.edu/">Open Scholar - Personal Scholar Sites</a></li><li>The Study of Religion at Harvard University public <a href="https://www.facebook.com/studyofreligionharvarduniversity/" title="">Facebook</a> page (weekly announcements are posted here)</li><li><a href="http://www.facebook.com/groups/religionatharvard/" title="">Doctoral student Facebook group</a> - log-in required</li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1374515860" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374515860"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Additional Links by Program</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374515860' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="/religion/pages/links-undergraduates">Undergraduate Resources</a></p>

<div id="page" class="container page os_pages-section-56816 header-main header-right content-top content-left content-right footer-left">
	<div id="page-wrapper">

		
					<!--header regions beg-->
			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-info" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_info no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_info"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1374503596" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374503596"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Teaching Fellows</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374503596' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><em> <a href="http://projects.iq.harvard.edu/teachingfellows_studyofreligion">Teaching Fellows in the Study of Religion Site</a></em><br /> 2016-17 <em>Departmental Teaching Fellow (FAS) is Tyler Schwaller<br /> Departmental Teaching Fellow (HDS) is Eleanor Craig </em></li>
<li><a href="http://bokcenter.harvard.edu/" target="_blank">The Derek Bok Center for Teaching and Learning</a> <br /><em>Contains many resources for teaching and professional development</em></li>
<li><a href="http://icg.harvard.edu/" target="_blank">FAS IT - Academic Technology Group</a> <br /><em>For information about course iSites, the PITF program, and teaching with technology</em></li>
</ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1374086901" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374086901"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Related Organizations at Harvard</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374086901' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><em>Many of these organizations have their own events calendars and mailing lists. We do not usually repeat events from the mailing lists of other organizations in our own newsletter, so if you are interested in staying up to date, you are encouraged to subscribe to the appropriate mailing list.</em></p><table border="0" style="width:642px; height:284px"><tr><td><ul><li><p><a href="http://hds.harvard.edu/">Harvard Divinity School</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://cswr.hds.harvard.edu/home">Center for the Study of World Religions at the Harvard Divinity School</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://wsrp.hds.harvard.edu/home">Women's Studies in Religion Program at the Harvard Divinity School</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://rpp.hds.harvard.edu/">Religions and the Practice of Peace Initiative</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://mahindrahumanities.fas.harvard.edu/">Mahindra Humanities Center</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://pluralism.org/">The Pluralism Project</a> </p></li><li><p><a href="http://wcfia.harvard.edu/">Weatherhead Center for International Affairs</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://www.islamicstudies.harvard.edu/">The Prince Alwaleed Bin Talal Islamic Studies Program</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://www.doaks.org/" title="">Dumbarton Oaks Research Library and Collection</a></p></li></ul></td><td><ul><li><p><a href="http://cmes.fas.harvard.edu">Harvard University Center For Middle Eastern Studies</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://southasiainstitute.harvard.edu/">Harvard University South Asia Institute</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://asiacenter.harvard.edu/">Harvard University Asia Center</a> </p></li><li><p><a href="http://rijs.fas.harvard.edu/">Reischauer Institute of Japanese Studies</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://fairbank.fas.harvard.edu/">Fairbank Center for Chinese Studies</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://hutchinscenter.fas.harvard.edu/">Hutchins Center for African and African American Research</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://iaas.fas.harvard.edu/">Committee on Inner Asia and Altaic Studies</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://isites.harvard.edu/icb/icb.do?keyword=k21071" target="_blank">Harvard Buddhist Studies Forum</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://chaplains.harvard.edu/">Harvard Chaplains</a></p></li></ul></td></tr></table></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-first"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374504020" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374504020"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">General Resources for Students</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374504020' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="http://registrar.fas.harvard.edu/five-year-calendar" target="_blank">FAS 5-Year Academic Calendar</a></li><li><a href="http://my.harvard.edu/" target="_blank">My.Harvard</a></li><li><a href="http://www.huhousing.harvard.edu/HarvardUniversityHousing/index.aspx" target="_blank">Harvard Real Estate Services</a><br /><em>Area apartments and on-campus housing</em></li></ul><div> </div><h4>PhD Students</h4><ul><li><a href="https://gsas.harvard.edu/audiences/students">GSAS Student Resources</a></li><li><a href="https://gsas.harvard.edu/financial-support/fellowships" target="_blank">GSAS Fellowships Office</a></li><li><a href="http://www.gsas.harvard.edu/current_students/financial_aid.php" target="_blank">GSAS Office of Financial Aid</a></li></ul><div> </div><h4>ThD Students</h4><ul><li><a href="http://www.hds.harvard.edu/academics/registrar" target="_blank">HDS Registrar</a></li><li><a href="http://www.hds.harvard.edu/academics/registrar/academic-calendar" target="_blank">HDS Academic Calendar</a></li><li><a href="http://www.hds.harvard.edu/life-at-hds" target="_blank">HDS Community Life Resources</a></li></ul><p> </p></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374504428" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374504428"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Teaching Beyond Harvard</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374504428' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><em></em><a href="http://chronicle.com/jobs/100/500" target="_blank"><em>Chronicle of Higher Education</em> - Job Listings</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.aarweb.org/employment-services/employment-listings">American Academy of Religion - Job Listings</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.excollege.tufts.edu" target="_blank">Tufts Experimental College</a> - <em>Regularly seeks submissions for this course program</em></li>
</ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>																	</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-31161"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics"  class="active-trail active">Academics</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31166"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/undergraduate" >Undergraduate</a></li><li class="last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-31171"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral"  class="active-trail active">Doctoral</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first collapsed menu-depth-3 menu-item-31306"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/phd-program" >PhD Program &amp; Timeline</a></li><li class="leaf active-trail active-trail menu-depth-3 menu-item-33061"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/links-doctoral-students"  class="active-trail active active">Links for Doctoral Students</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-32971"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/faqs-doctoral" >FAQ&#039;s: Doctoral</a></li><li class="last collapsed menu-depth-3 menu-item-31311"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/thd-program" >ThD Program</a></li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1377194947" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1377194947"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Financial Forms</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1377194947' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><em>You may submit forms by email, mail or fax. If you are a visitor, the Student &amp; Visitor Reimbursement Form and a W-9 are required.</em></p><ul><li><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/hcominequalityfellows_0.pdf">Student &amp; Visitor Reimbursement Form</a> <em>*Be sure to include your current address to avoid errors in mailed payments. </em></li><li><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/w9_form.pdf">W-9</a> <em>*A new W-9 is required if you have not been <strong>REIMBURSED (this is different from being paid)</strong> <span style="text-decoration:underline">in the last 6 months</span>.</em></li><li><a href="https://www.uscis.gov/i-9-central">I-9</a> <em>The link takes you to the most current I-9 info; downloadable from their homepage. In order to TF, you must have an I-9 on file.</em></li><li><a href="https://www.irs.gov/Forms-&amp;-Pubs">W-4 Employee Withholding Form</a></li><li><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/fn_oracle_vendor_request_form.pdf?m=1460150181">Foreign Individual Vendor Request Form</a><br />Foreign individuals should submit this form instead of a W-9. After submitting this form, individuals will also need to complete the GLACIER program (an online Self-Service tool to determine U.S. residency status) and submit required documents to the NRA Tax Group office. The individual will receive an email from <a href="mailto:support@online-tax.net">support@online-tax.net</a> providing information on how to log into the GLACIER program.  A hold will be automatically placed until the individual submits the GLACIER documents to the NRA Tax Group.</li><li><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/huuef4-writable.pdf">Faculty Universal Expense Form</a></li></ul><p><em>*Paper clips please - thank you!</em></p><p> </p></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1374503911" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374503911"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Room Reservations</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374503911' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="http://registrar.fas.harvard.edu/faculty-staff/classrooms">FAS Classrooms</a><br /><em>Schedules classroom and event spaces outside of departmental rooms. Rooms can be requested and viewed via <a href="http://roombook.fas.harvard.edu/">RoomBook</a>. Questions: <a href="mailto:classrms@fas.harvard.edu">classrms@fas.harvard.edu</a> <br /></em></p>
<p><a href="http://fas.harvard.edu/%7Ecsrel/" target="_blank">The Study of Religion </a> <br /><em>Barker Center CSR Seminar Room (403), small meeting room (303), or teaching fellow office (408). Priority is given to CSR courses and faculty, then section meetings, followed by one-time events (both internal and external) Contact Staff Assistant: <a href="http://fas.harvard.edu/%7Ecsrel/" target="_blank">csrel@fas.harvard.edu</a><br /></em></p>
<p><a href="http://fas.harvard.edu/%7Ecsrel/" target="_blank">Barker Center Special Events<br /></a><em>The Thompson Room (Barker 110) is the large gathering space on the 1st floor. It is scheduled via <a href="http://roombook.fas.harvard.edu/">RoomBook</a>. <br /></em></p>
<p><a href="http://imsroombook.fas.harvard.edu/">View the Inventory of Classroom Spaces</a><br /><em>Select "<a href="http://ims.fas.harvard.edu/classrooms/browse.php">Browse by Buildings</a>" for the quickest views.<br /></em></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1472248730" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_media"  module="boxes" delta="1472248730"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Doctoral Program Calendar</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1472248730' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id="file-697671" class="file file-html file-html-embed">

  <div class="content">

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/undergraduate" >UNDERGRADUATE</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Resources for Undergraduates                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374086901" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374086901"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Related Organizations at Harvard</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374086901' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><em>Many of these organizations have their own events calendars and mailing lists. We do not usually repeat events from the mailing lists of other organizations in our own newsletter, so if you are interested in staying up to date, you are encouraged to subscribe to the appropriate mailing list.</em></p><table border="0" style="width:642px; height:284px"><tr><td><ul><li><p><a href="http://hds.harvard.edu/">Harvard Divinity School</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://cswr.hds.harvard.edu/home">Center for the Study of World Religions at the Harvard Divinity School</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://wsrp.hds.harvard.edu/home">Women's Studies in Religion Program at the Harvard Divinity School</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://rpp.hds.harvard.edu/">Religions and the Practice of Peace Initiative</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://mahindrahumanities.fas.harvard.edu/">Mahindra Humanities Center</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://pluralism.org/">The Pluralism Project</a> </p></li><li><p><a href="http://wcfia.harvard.edu/">Weatherhead Center for International Affairs</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://www.islamicstudies.harvard.edu/">The Prince Alwaleed Bin Talal Islamic Studies Program</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://www.doaks.org/" title="">Dumbarton Oaks Research Library and Collection</a></p></li></ul></td><td><ul><li><p><a href="http://cmes.fas.harvard.edu">Harvard University Center For Middle Eastern Studies</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://southasiainstitute.harvard.edu/">Harvard University South Asia Institute</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://asiacenter.harvard.edu/">Harvard University Asia Center</a> </p></li><li><p><a href="http://rijs.fas.harvard.edu/">Reischauer Institute of Japanese Studies</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://fairbank.fas.harvard.edu/">Fairbank Center for Chinese Studies</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://hutchinscenter.fas.harvard.edu/">Hutchins Center for African and African American Research</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://iaas.fas.harvard.edu/">Committee on Inner Asia and Altaic Studies</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://isites.harvard.edu/icb/icb.do?keyword=k21071" target="_blank">Harvard Buddhist Studies Forum</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://chaplains.harvard.edu/">Harvard Chaplains</a></p></li></ul></td></tr></table></div></div></div>
  </div></section><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-64781" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
      </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-first"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374178945" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374178945"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Plan of Study Forms for Undergraduates</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374178945' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_a_2014-15_writeable.doc">Option A: Two Major Traditions in Comparative Context</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_b_2014-15_writeable.doc">Option B: One Major Tradition in Comparative Context</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_c_2014-15_writeable.doc">*Option C: Joint Concentration with Religion as the Primary Field</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_d_2014-15_writeable.doc">*Option D: Joint Concentration with Religion as a Allied Field</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_secondary_field_2014-15_writeable.doc">Religion as a Secondary Field</a></li>
</ul><p>*Students pursuing a Joint Concentration must also complete the college form<a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/joint_conc_app_2_-_without_list_of_programs.pdf"> "Joint Concentration Application".</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374515432" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374515432"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Undergraduate Resources</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374515432' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="http://osl.fas.harvard.edu/icb/icb.do?keyword=k65178&amp;pageid=icb.page305611">Office of Student Life – Student Organizations</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ocs.fas.harvard.edu/">Office of Career Services</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.funding.fas.harvard.edu/">Harvard College Funding Sources</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.college.harvard.edu/icb/icb.do?keyword=k61161&amp;pageid=icb.page257820">Harvard College</a></li>
<li><a href="http://oie.fas.harvard.edu/">Office of International Education</a></li>
<li><a href="http://cuhs.harvard.edu/">Harvard’s Committee on the Use of Human Subjects</a></li>
</ul><p>Register your travel abroad for emergency support:<br /><a href="https://www.globalsupport.harvard.edu/travel-tools">www.globalsupport.harvard.edu/travel-tools</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1374163646" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374163646"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Guides &amp; Handbooks</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374163646' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/religious_studies_guide_print_10-1-13.pdf">Guide to Writing in the Study of Religion</a></li>
<li><a href="http://writing.fas.harvard.edu/" target="_blank">Writing Resources at Harvard</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_handbook_2016-7_final_0.pdf">Undergraduate Handbook</a> (2016-17)</li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/senior_thesis_handbook_2015-16_student.pdf">Senior Thesis Handbook</a> (2015-16)</li>
</ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>																	</div>

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-146421"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/undergraduate"  class="active-trail active">Undergraduate</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32966"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/faqs-undergraduate-program" >FAQ&#039;s: Undergraduate Program</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-35426"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/courses" >Courses</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32561"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/admission" >Concentrating</a></li><li class="collapsed menu-depth-2 menu-item-32581"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/advising" >Advising</a></li><li class="collapsed menu-depth-2 menu-item-32596"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/coursework" >Coursework</a></li><li class="leaf active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-33086"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/links-undergraduates"  class="active-trail active active">Resources for Undergraduates</a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-39351"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/beyond-harvard-0" >Beyond Harvard</a></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1373989095" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1373989095"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Concentration Questions?</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1373989095' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/courtney-bickel-lamberth">Director of Undergraduate Studies, Courtney Lamberth</a></p>
<p><a href="mailto:kstreet@fas.harvard.edu">Assistant Director of Undergraduate Studies, Kera Street</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1364321266" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1364321266"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Words from our Students</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1364321266' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><address>"The structure of the concentration gives students a lot of flexibility and freedom to explore the religions and themes they're interested in. In my experience, the professors are also very involved and want to get to know you on a personal level, which is something you don't get in the larger concentrations." – Hebert, '13</address></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>
