				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/about" >ABOUT</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Mailing List                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-56811" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Please submit any news items you would like featured in our weekly mailing to <a href="mailto:csrel@fas.harvard.edu">csrel@fas.harvard.edu</a> by 5pm on Friday of the previous week. </p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div><div id="block-boxes-1444232604" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1444232604"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1444232604' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><!--break--></p>
<p><span style="color:#ffffff">blank</span></p></div></div></div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1444232051" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1444232051"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">List an Event</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1444232051' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><!--break-->To list an event in the weekly e-mailer please include your event information as a text email to <a href="mailto:csrel@fas.harvard.edu">csrel@fas.harvard.edu</a> including: title, time, day, location, any related audience restrictions, cost (if not free) <em>and</em> a relevant hyperlink. Please do not send attachments. Submissions must be received by Friday to be included in the following week's announcements. The weekly mailer includes CFPs, job postings, lectures and program announcements. To list events on the web calendar, please send the same information and indicate your preference.</p></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-first"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1384887458" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_mailchimp"  module="boxes" delta="1384887458"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Mailing List</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1384887458' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><iframe src="https://harvard.us7.list-manage.com/subscribe?u=40cf9f0383c36b5a22a6cabf5&amp;id=e27fde4682" width="640px", height="1200"></iframe></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>																										</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1429728060" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1429728060"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">A History on the Committee on the Study of Religion at Harvard</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1429728060' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/religion_pdf.pdf">From Church History to Tibetan Buddhist Rituals: A History on the Committee on the Study of Religion</a>, by Ann Hall</p><a href=""  class="os-embed-link" data-delta="1429728060">&lt;embed&gt;</a><div id="embed-popup-1429728060" class="embed-popup"><ul class="links num-links-2"><li class="link-count-iframe first"><a href="#1429728060-iframe" >Iframe</a></li><li class="link-count-oembed last"><a href="#1429728060-oembed" >URL</a></li></ul><div id="1429728060-iframe"><div class="form-item form-type-textarea form-item-web-widgets">
  <label for="web_widgets_1">Embed code </label>
 <div class="form-textarea-wrapper resizable"><textarea onclick="this.focus(); this.select();" id="web_widgets_1" name="web_widgets" cols="30" rows="5" class="form-textarea">&lt;script type=&quot;text/javascript&quot; src=&quot;//studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/profiles/openscholar/modules/os/modules/os_boxes/misc/os_boxes.resize_parent.js&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;
&lt;iframe class=&quot;web-widgets-iframe&quot; src=&quot;//studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/widget/embed/1429728060/iframe&quot; scrolling=&quot;no&quot; frameborder=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot;&gt;&lt;/iframe&gt;
</textarea></div>
<div class="description">Copy and paste this code to your website.</div>
</div>
</div><div id="1429728060-oembed"><div class="form-item form-type-textarea form-item-web-widgets">
  <label for="web_widgets_2">Embed code </label>
 <div class="form-textarea-wrapper resizable"><textarea onclick="this.focus(); this.select();" id="web_widgets_2" name="web_widgets" cols="30" rows="5" class="form-textarea">https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/box/1429728060</textarea></div>
<div class="description">Copy and paste this code to your website.</div>
</div>
</div></div></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1414172146" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1414172146"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Donate</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1414172146' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>For alumni wishing to make gifts exclusively to the Study of Religion:</p>
<p>Gifts by credit card, please click <a href="https://secure.www.alumniconnections.com/olc/pub/HAA/onlinegiving/showGivingForm.jsp?form_id=60847">here</a> (for general University gifts) and follow the instructions.  When selecting a school/affiliate to donate to, please choose “<strong>Other”</strong> from the dropdown menu and enter a note in the “<strong>Comments/Other Designation”</strong> box with instructions that this gift should go to the “<strong>Committee on the Study of Religion</strong>”. You may include a program too (AB or PhD).</p>
<p>Gifts by check:  Harvard University, Recording Secretary’s Office, 124 Mount Auburn Street, Cambridge, MA  02138.  Please make checks payable to “The President and Fellows of Harvard College” and include a note in the memo line of the check that this is for the “<strong>The Committee on the Study of Religion</strong>”.</p>
<p>Thank you! Please contact us if you have any questions: <a href="mailto:csrel@fas.harvard.edu">csrel@fas.harvard.edu</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section><div id="block-boxes-1383155241" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1383155241"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1383155241' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="http://campaign.harvard.edu/fas/"><img height="280" width="252" style="display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;" alt="The Harvard Campaign for Arts and Sciences" title="The Harvard Campaign for Arts and Sciences" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-medium" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_medium/public/religion/files/hwp-fas-campaign-vert-students.jpg?m=1383155193&amp;itok=hbX7VqUw" /></a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_info' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h1><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >Committee on the Study of Religion</a></h1>

>Courses</a></li><li class="menu-2809 menu-path-node-63841   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/links"  title="">Related Organizations</a></li><li class="menu-2339 menu-path-node-56811   odd   last "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/mailing-list"  title="">Mailing List</a></li></ul></li><li class="menu-17680 menu-path-node-881226   odd   last "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/calendars"  title="">Calendar</a></li></ul>

  </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/research" >RESEARCH</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      New Testament and Early Christianity                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-61696" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><img height="246" width="645" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-xlarge" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_xlarge/public/religion/files/duccio_di_buoninsegna_-_ch_copy_1.jpg?m=1374763671&amp;itok=dpy8qHbq" alt="" title="" /></p>
<p></p>
<h2>Description</h2>
<p><br />The doctoral program (Th.D. and Ph.D.) in New Testament and Early Christianity involves the multidisciplinary study of Christian literature (canonical and extracanonical, from the first to the fourth centuries), history, religion, and theology within the broader context of the ancient Mediterranean world. The principal focus of this doctoral work is twofold: 1) to analyze ancient texts (including material culture) and to place these within a critical historiography of the ancient Mediterranean world; 2) to gain familiarity with a range of interpretive frameworks and critical approaches toward scriptures, ancient texts, and the scholarship of the field.<br /><br />The program offers particular strengths in diverse approaches to the field (feminist and postcolonial studies, hermeneutics, rhetoric and ethics of interpretation, and the analysis of the material culture of antiquity, [including archaeology and papyrology]), and diverse texts, including those of the New Testament (especially the Pauline Epistles, the Gospels, Acts, Revelation, 1 Peter), Nag Hammadi and other Coptic literature, as well as apologetic, apocalyptic, and martyrdom literatures.</p>
<h2>Requirements</h2>
<p><br /><em>Required Seminars:</em> Students generally pursue coursework during their first two years in the doctoral program. In addition to two seminars required of all first and second year doctoral students in the study of religion, doctoral candidates in New Testament/Early Christian Studies will participate in Religion 3420hf/HDS 1980: Seminar for Advanced New Testament Students.</p>
<p></p>
<p><em>Languages:</em> Doctoral candidates are required to demonstrate competence in Greek at an advanced level by passing the department’s Greek qualifying examination, and intermediate to advanced competency in at least one additional ancient language appropriate to their plan of study (usually Latin, Hebrew, Coptic, or Syriac), as well as reading facility in two modern research languages relevant to their area of study (usually French and German). <span style="text-decoration:underline">Prior language preparation is a significant factor in doctoral admissions.</span> Once students have passed the advanced Greek examination, they will pursue a Greek reading course offered by the department, or, in rare cases, upon consultation with their advisors, can be exempted from this course for an alternative Greek course (e.g., in Classics) or a course in another ancient language relevant for their research. The above are only minimum requirements, since candidates will find they will need to use all of these languages currently in their studies and research; furthermore, each candidate's interests will usually dictate familiarity with several additional languages, ancient and modern.<br /><br /></p>
<h2>General Examinations</h2>
<p><br />General Examinations in the field of New Testament and Early Christianity follow the required structure of three written examinations (of three hours each) plus an oral examination prescribed by the Committee on the Study of Religion and the Faculty of Divinity. Ph.D. candidates are additionally required to take a fourth examination in Method and Theory; Th.D. candidates are strongly encouraged to include this examination as well. In conversation with his/her faculty examiners, the student will develop a bibliography tailored to the student’s interests that encompasses a breadth of relevant sources and scholarship. Such breadth should include ancient texts with a variety of religious affiliations and genres, and a geographical range in the Ancient Mediterranean world.<br /><br />In addition, invaluable assistance to the program is also given by faculty from cognate fields across Harvard’s Graduate Faculty of Arts and Sciences and throughout the Boston Theological Institute.<br /><br /><em>Recent and current dissertation topics include:</em></p>
<p></p>
<ul><li>The Body of Christ as Demos: Democratic Discourse of the <em>Ekklesia</em> in 1 Corinthians</li>
<li>Carnal Resurrection: Sexuality and Sexual Difference in Early Christianity</li>
<li>Ecclesia Laus Corinthiensis: Negotiating Ethnicity under Empire</li>
<li>Gender is Secured to Them: Discourse on the Body and Women’s Practice in Tertullian</li>
<li>The Socioeconomic Status of Jewish and Christian Women in Asia Minor 50–200 C.E.</li>
<li>'This man performs many signs' (John 11:47): Political Controversies over the Raising of the Dead</li>
<li>The Transfiguration of Jesus and Its Trajectory during the First Two Centuries of the Christian Era</li>
<li>The <em>First Apocalypse of James</em>: Martyrdom and Sexual Difference</li>
<li>The Religious Practices of the Enslaved: a Case Study in Roman Ephesos</li>
</ul></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail   </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1374005208" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_sv_list_box"  module="boxes" delta="1374005208"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/undergraduate" >UNDERGRADUATE</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/advising" >ADVISING</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Options A and B Requirements                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-63686" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p></p>
<table style="height:100%; width:660px"><tr><td>
<h3>Option A: Two Major Traditions in Comparative Context</h3>
</td>
<td>
<h3>Option B: One Major Tradition in Comparative Context</h3>
</td>
</tr><tr><td><ol><li>General: Comparative and Methodological Studies (3 half-courses)</li>
<ol><li>1 half-course chosen from Religion 11-20</li>
<li>Religion 97. Sophomore Tutorial</li>
<li>1 other half-course</li>
</ol><li>Tradition A (5 half-courses)</li>
<ol><li>4 half-courses focusing on a particular era or cultural/geographical area important in the tradition</li>
<li>Religion 98. Junior Tutorial</li>
</ol><li>Tradition B (4 half-courses)</li>
<ol><li>4 half-courses focusing on a particular era or cultural/geographical area important in the tradition</li>
</ol></ol><p>Honors Track:<br />Religion 99a. Senior Seminar/Thesis<br />Religion 99b. Senior Seminar/Thesis</p>
</td>
<td><ol><li>General: Comparative and Methodological Studies (4 half-courses)</li>
<ol><li>1 half-course chosen from Religion 11-20</li>
<li>Religion 97. Sophomore Tutorial</li>
<li>2 other half-courses, of which normally one considers a tradition other than the major tradition</li>
</ol><li>Major Tradition (8 half-courses)</li>
<ol><li>Religion 98. Junior Tutorial</li>
<li>Seven half-courses, of which normally three focus on a particular era or cultural geographical area important in the tradition</li>
</ol></ol><p>Honors Track:<br />Religion 99a. Senior Seminar/Thesis<br />Religion 99b. Senior Seminar/Thesis</p>
</td>
</tr><tr><td></td>
<td></td>
</tr></table></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-first"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374178945" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374178945"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Plan of Study Forms for Undergraduates</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374178945' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_a_2014-15_writeable.doc">Option A: Two Major Traditions in Comparative Context</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_b_2014-15_writeable.doc">Option B: One Major Tradition in Comparative Context</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_c_2014-15_writeable.doc">*Option C: Joint Concentration with Religion as the Primary Field</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_d_2014-15_writeable.doc">*Option D: Joint Concentration with Religion as a Allied Field</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_secondary_field_2014-15_writeable.doc">Religion as a Secondary Field</a></li>
</ul><p>*Students pursuing a Joint Concentration must also complete the college form<a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/joint_conc_app_2_-_without_list_of_programs.pdf"> "Joint Concentration Application".</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374163646" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374163646"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Guides &amp; Handbooks</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374163646' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/religious_studies_guide_print_10-1-13.pdf">Guide to Writing in the Study of Religion</a></li>
<li><a href="http://writing.fas.harvard.edu/" target="_blank">Writing Resources at Harvard</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_handbook_2016-7_final_0.pdf">Undergraduate Handbook</a> (2016-17)</li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/senior_thesis_handbook_2015-16_student.pdf">Senior Thesis Handbook</a> (2015-16)</li>
</ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>																	</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/advising"  class="active-trail active">Advising</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-32856"><a   </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1373989095" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1373989095"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Concentration Questions?</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1373989095' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/courtney-bickel-lamberth">Director of Undergraduate Studies, Courtney Lamberth</a></p>
<p><a href="mailto:kstreet@fas.harvard.edu">Assistant Director of Undergraduate Studies, Kera Street</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1374086388" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374086388"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Approved Traditions and Themes</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374086388' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h3>Approved Traditions</h3>
<ul><li>Ancient Near Eastern / Israelite</li>
<li>Buddhist</li>
<li>Christian</li>
<li>East Asian</li>
<li>Greek-Hellenistic-Roman</li>
<li>Hindu</li>
<li>Islamic</li>
<li>Judaic</li>
<li>Modern Western / Religions of the Americas</li>
<li>South Asian</li>
<li>African and Afro-Atlantic Religions</li>
</ul><h3>Approved Themes</h3>
<ul><li>Religion and Gender</li>
<li>Religion and Society</li>
<li>Religion and the Arts</li>
<li>Philosophy of Religion</li>
</ul><p><em>It may be possible to substitute other traditions or themes depending on faculty and course offerings.</em></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>

</div><!--page area ends-->

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/undergraduate" >UNDERGRADUATE</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/advising" >ADVISING</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Options C and D Requirements                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-63846" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><table style="height:100%; width:660px"><tr><td>
<h3>Option C. Joint Concentration <br />with Religion as the Primary Field</h3>
</td>
<td>
<h3>Option D. Joint Concentration <br />with Religion as the Allied Field</h3>
</td>
</tr><tr><td><ol><li>General: Comparative and Methodological Studies (3 half-courses)</li>
<ol><li>1 half-course chosen from Religion 11-20</li>
<li>Religion 97. Sophomore Tutorial</li>
<li>1 other half-course</li>
</ol><li>Major Tradition (5 half-courses)</li>
<ol><li>4 half-courses focusing on a particular era or cultural/geographical area important in the tradition</li>
<li>Religion 98a (1 term)</li>
</ol><li>Allied Field (4 half-courses)</li>
<ol><li>1 term of junior tutorial in the secondary field is ordinarily required</li>
<li>Precise course requirements are subject to secondary concentration requirements of the department or committee that administers the program in the secondary field</li>
</ol></ol></td>
<td><ol><li>General: Comparative and Methodological Studies – three half-courses</li>
<ol><li>Religion 97. Sophomore Tutorial</li>
<li>2 other half-courses</li>
</ol><li>Major Tradition (4 half-courses)</li>
<ol><li>4 half-courses focusing on a particular era or cultural/geographical area important to the tradition</li>
</ol></ol></td>
</tr><tr><td></td>
<td></td>
</tr></table></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-first"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374178945" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374178945"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Plan of Study Forms for Undergraduates</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374178945' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_a_2014-15_writeable.doc">Option A: Two Major Traditions in Comparative Context</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_b_2014-15_writeable.doc">Option B: One Major Tradition in Comparative Context</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_c_2014-15_writeable.doc">*Option C: Joint Concentration with Religion as the Primary Field</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_d_2014-15_writeable.doc">*Option D: Joint Concentration with Religion as a Allied Field</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_secondary_field_2014-15_writeable.doc">Religion as a Secondary Field</a></li>
</ul><p>*Students pursuing a Joint Concentration must also complete the college form<a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/joint_conc_app_2_-_without_list_of_programs.pdf"> "Joint Concentration Application".</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374163646" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374163646"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Guides &amp; Handbooks</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374163646' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/religious_studies_guide_print_10-1-13.pdf">Guide to Writing in the Study of Religion</a></li>
<li><a href="http://writing.fas.harvard.edu/" target="_blank">Writing Resources at Harvard</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_handbook_2016-7_final_0.pdf">Undergraduate Handbook</a> (2016-17)</li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/senior_thesis_handbook_2015-16_student.pdf">Senior Thesis Handbook</a> (2015-16)</li>
</ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>																	</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-146421"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/undergraduate"  class="active-trail active">Undergraduate</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32966"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/faqs-undergraduate-program" >FAQ&#039;s: Undergraduate Program</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-35426"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/courses" >Courses</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32561"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/admission" >Concentrating</a></li><li class="expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-32581"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/advising"  class="active-trail active">Advising</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-32856"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/concentration-plans" >Concentration Options</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-32861"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/options-and-b" >Options A and B Requirements</a></li><li class="leaf active-trail active-trail menu-depth-3 menu-item-32981"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/options-c-and-d-requirements"  class="active-trail active active">Options C and D Requirements</a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-32986"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/religion-secondary-field" >Religion as a Secondary Field</a></li></ul></li><li class="collapsed menu-depth-2 menu-item-32596"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/coursework" >Coursework</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-33086"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/links-undergraduates" >Resources for Undergraduates</a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-39351"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/beyond-harvard-0" >Beyond Harvard</a></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1373989095" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1373989095"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Concentration Questions?</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1373989095' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/courtney-bickel-lamberth">Director of Undergraduate Studies, Courtney Lamberth</a></p>
<p><a href="mailto:kstreet@fas.harvard.edu">Assistant Director of Undergraduate Studies, Kera Street</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1374086388" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374086388"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Approved Traditions and Themes</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374086388' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h3>Approved Traditions</h3>
<ul><li>Ancient Near Eastern / Israelite</li>
<li>Buddhist</li>
<li>Christian</li>
<li>East Asian</li>
<li>Greek-Hellenistic-Roman</li>
<li>Hindu</li>
<li>Islamic</li>
<li>Judaic</li>
<li>Modern Western / Religions of the Americas</li>
<li>South Asian</li>
<li>African and Afro-Atlantic Religions</li>
</ul><h3>Approved Themes</h3>
<ul><li>Religion and Gender</li>
<li>Religion and Society</li>
<li>Religion and the Arts</li>
<li>Philosophy of Religion</li>
</ul><p><em>It may be possible to substitute other traditions or themes depending on faculty and course offerings.</em></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>
		<!--footer region beg-->
		<footer id="footer" class="clearfix" role="contentinfo">

In the oral exam students meet with their thesis readers and have a chance to address their questions or concerns. Oral exams are usually 1½ hours long and occur during late April or early May." />

					<!--header regions beg-->
			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-info" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_info no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_info"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_info' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h1><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >Committee on the Study of Religion</a></h1>
    
    <p>
    </p></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>					  					  <div class="region region-header-third"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-secondary-menu" class="block block-os no-title"  module="os" delta="secondary-menu"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-secondary-menu" id="nice-menu-secondary-menu"><li class="menu-22511 menu-path-faq  first   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq"  title="List of FAQs">FAQ</a></li><li class="menu-2605 menu-path-node-63151   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/apply-phd" >Apply PhD</a></li><li class="menu-6668 menu-path-studyofreligionfasharvardedu-pages-forms   odd  "><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/forms"  title="For Current Students &amp; Faculty">Forms</a></li><li class="menu-2603 menu-path-node-57086   even   last "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/contact" >Contact</a></li></ul>
</div>
  </div></div><div id="block-boxes-solr-search-box" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_search_solr_search_box no-title"  module="boxes" delta="solr_search_box"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

				  <!--main menu region beg-->
		  <div id="menu-bar" class="nav region-menu-bar clearfix"><nav id="block-os-primary-menu" class="block block-os no-title menu-wrapper menu-bar-wrapper clearfix"  module="os" delta="primary-menu">  
  
  <ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-primary-menu" id="nice-menu-primary-menu"><li class="menu-2336 menu-path-  first   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/comparative-studies"  title="">Comparative Studies</a></li><li class="menu-3296 menu-path-node-57506   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/east-asian-religions"  title="">East Asian Religions</a></li><li class="menu-3287 menu-path-node-57511   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/ethics"  title="">Ethics</a></li><li class="menu-3297 menu-path-node-57516   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/hebrew-bibleold-testament"  title="">Hebrew Bible/Old Testament</a></li><li class="menu-3289 menu-path-node-61681   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/history-christianity"  title="">History of Christianity</a></li><li class="menu-3302 menu-path-node-61686   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/religions-late-antiquity-judaism-and-christianity"  title="">Religions of Late Antiquity: Judaism and Christianity</a></li><li class="menu-3292 menu-path-node-61716   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/religions-americas"  title="">Religions of the Americas</a></li><li class="menu-3293 menu-path-node-61726   odd   </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/undergraduate" >UNDERGRADUATE</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/coursework" >COURSEWORK</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/senior-thesis" >SENIOR HONORS THESIS</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      The Oral Examination                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-63671" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>The oral examination is a chance for students to respond to comments provided by their thesis readers. In the oral exam students meet with their thesis readers and have a chance to address their questions or concerns. Oral exams are usually 1½ hours long and occur during late April or early May.</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-first"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374163646" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374163646"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Guides &amp; Handbooks</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374163646' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/religious_studies_guide_print_10-1-13.pdf">Guide to Writing in the Study of Religion</a></li>
<li><a href="http://writing.fas.harvard.edu/" target="_blank">Writing Resources at Harvard</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_handbook_2016-7_final_0.pdf">Undergraduate Handbook</a> (2016-17)</li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/senior_thesis_handbook_2015-16_student.pdf">Senior Thesis Handbook</a> (2015-16)</li>
</ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1374515432" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374515432"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Undergraduate Resources</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374515432' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="http://osl.fas.harvard.edu/icb/icb.do?keyword=k65178&amp;pageid=icb.page305611">Office of Student Life – Student Organizations</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ocs.fas.harvard.edu/">Office of Career Services</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.funding.fas.harvard.edu/">Harvard College Funding Sources</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.college.harvard.edu/icb/icb.do?keyword=k61161&amp;pageid=icb.page257820">Harvard College</a></li>
<li><a href="http://oie.fas.harvard.edu/">Office of International Education</a></li>
<li><a href="http://cuhs.harvard.edu/">Harvard’s Committee on the Use of Human Subjects</a></li>
</ul><p>Register your travel abroad for emergency support:<br /><a href="https://www.globalsupport.harvard.edu/travel-tools">www.globalsupport.harvard.edu/travel-tools</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374178945" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374178945"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Plan of Study Forms for Undergraduates</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374178945' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_a_2014-15_writeable.doc">Option A: Two Major Traditions in Comparative Context</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_b_2014-15_writeable.doc">Option B: One Major Tradition in Comparative Context</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_c_2014-15_writeable.doc">*Option C: Joint Concentration with Religion as the Primary Field</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_d_2014-15_writeable.doc">*Option D: Joint Concentration with Religion as a Allied Field</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_secondary_field_2014-15_writeable.doc">Religion as a Secondary Field</a></li>
</ul><p>*Students pursuing a Joint Concentration must also complete the college form<a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/joint_conc_app_2_-_without_list_of_programs.pdf"> "Joint Concentration Application".</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>																	</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail   </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1373989095" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1373989095"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Concentration Questions?</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1373989095' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/courtney-bickel-lamberth">Director of Undergraduate Studies, Courtney Lamberth</a></p>
<p><a href="mailto:kstreet@fas.harvard.edu">Assistant Director of Undergraduate Studies, Kera Street</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->

	<div id="branding_header">
		<div  class="branding-container clearfix">

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics" >ACADEMICS</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral" >DOCTORAL</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      PhD Program &amp; Timeline                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-57196" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Students are expected to complete the Ph.D. in five to seven years. Only in unusual cases can the program be completed in less than four-and-a-half academic years.</p><h3>Years 1 &amp; 2: Coursework, Languages &amp; 2nd Year Review</h3><p>Full time study is required during years one and two, which means 4 half-courses each term with a minimum of a "B" grade average. Students in the Ph.D. program register for courses through the Graduate School of Arts and Sciences. Courses pertinent to their different areas of study may be found across departments and schools in the Harvard University Catalog. Courses not designated with an FAS course number, may be available for cross-registration. For tuition requirements, see <a href="http://www.gsas.harvard.edu/gsas_handbook.php" target="_blank">the Graduate School of Arts and Sciences Handbook</a> or the <a href="http://www.gsas.harvard.edu/prospective_students/financial_aid.php" target="_blank">GSAS Guide to Admission and Financial Aid</a>.</p><ul><li>Courses required for specialization</li><li>Religion 2001 (first term)</li><li>Religion 2002 (fourth term)</li><li>Two additional courses outside the area of specialization</li><li>Two modern languages of secondary scholarship</li><li>Additional languages as required for specialization</li><li>The 2nd year review occurs by the end of the fourth term</li></ul><h3>Year 3: General Examinations &amp; Student Teaching</h3><ul><li>Students teaching is guaranteed for 2/5 per term (two traditional course sections)</li><li>General Examinations are to be completed by the end of the 6th term</li></ul><h3>Year 4: Dissertation Prospectus</h3><ul><li>To be completed within 12 months of taking of the general exams</li></ul><h3>Year 5 and Following: The Dissertation</h3><ul><li>After approval of the prospectus, at least one chapter per year must be submitted to the advisor</li><li>To be completed, normally, by the end of the seventh year</li></ul></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-31161"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics"  class="active-trail active">Academics</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31166"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/undergraduate" >Undergraduate</a></li><li class="last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-31171"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral"  class="active-trail active">Doctoral</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-3 menu-item-31306"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/phd-program"  class="active-trail active active">PhD Program &amp; Timeline</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32681"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral-advising" >Advising</a></li><li class="menu-depth-4 menu-item-32586"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/years-1-%26-2" >Years 1 &amp; 2</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32631"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-3-general-exams" >Year 3: General Exams</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32656"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-3-%26-4-teaching" >Year 3 &amp; 4: Teaching</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32661"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-4-dissertation-prospectus" >Year 4: Dissertation Prospectus</a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32666"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-5-the-dissertation" >Year 5 &amp; up: The Dissertation</a></li></ul></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-33061"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/links-doctoral-students" >Links for Doctoral Students</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-32971"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/faqs-doctoral" >FAQ&#039;s: Doctoral</a></li><li class="last collapsed menu-depth-3 menu-item-31311"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/thd-program" >ThD Program</a></li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1472238788" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1472238788"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

      <h2 class="block-title">Forms for Current Students in Ph.D. Program</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1476823074' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>These forms are for students who are *enrolled* in the Ph.D. program. <strong>Do *not* request access</strong> if you are applying to the Ph.D. program.</p><ul><li><a href="https://docs.google.com/a/harvard.edu/document/d/16wlb4LD2NgMteJ7X0q_9d418vFBUBU1qjjcrFOXdP2I/edit?usp=sharing" title="">Plan of Study</a></li><li><a href="https://goo.gl/forms/w80b6mQGPVRBOIi33" title="">Intent to Take the Second Year Review</a></li><li><a href="https://goo.gl/forms/qrVDPsjLzTIIeWM32" title="">Intent to Take General Exams</a></li><li><a href="https://docs.google.com/a/harvard.edu/document/d/1uLO2yz184gawZctHd6uawOwB4auSDdueAnmytjk3TGY/edit?usp=sharing" title="">Dissertation Prospectus Checklist</a></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1472248730" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_media"  module="boxes" delta="1472248730"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/research" >RESEARCH</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Philosophy of Religion                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-61701" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><img height="246" width="645" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-xlarge" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_xlarge/public/religion/files/back_view_of_fuji_from_dre_copy.jpg?m=1475098996&amp;itok=QhhzRJKS" alt="" title="" /></p>
<p></p>
<h2>Description</h2>
<p><br />Study in this field focuses on the philosophical interpretation and evaluation of religion, religions, belief and religious practice. Work in this area can be pursued in relation to European and American philosophy, the philosophical traditions of Asia, and/or comparative study. The faculty at Harvard has particular strength in modern 18th to 20th century American and European philosophy, post-structuralism, psychoanalysis, Indian philosophy and comparative philosophy of religion. <br /><br /><em>Recent and current dissertation topics include:</em></p>
<p></p>
<ul><li>A Law Unto Themselves: Religion and Autonomy in Modern Moral Thought</li>
<li>Cavell, the Skeptic and the Diva: The Human Self Between Gender and Transcendence</li>
<li>Grounding Human Rights in a Pluralist World: Assessing the Strategies of Minimalism</li>
</ul></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-31391"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/research"  class="active-trail active">Research</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31396"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/african-religions" >African Religions</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31401"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/buddhist-studies" >Buddhist Studies</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31416"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/comparative-studies" >Comparative Studies</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31446"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/east-asian-religions" >East Asian Religions</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31451"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/ethics" >Ethics</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31456"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/greco-roman-religions" >Greco-Roman Religions</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31461"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/hebrew-bibleold-testament" >Hebrew Bible/Old Testament</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32316"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/history-christianity" >History of Christianity</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32321"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/islamic-studies" >Islamic Studies</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32326"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/jewish-studies" >Jewish Studies </a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32331"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/new-testament-and-early-christianity" >New Testament and Early Christianity</a></li><li class="leaf active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-32336"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/philosophy-religion"  class="active-trail active active">Philosophy of Religion</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32341"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/religion-and-society" >Religion and Society</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32346"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/religion-gender-and-culture" >Religion, Gender and Culture</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32356"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/religions-late-antiquity-judaism-and-christianity" >Religions of Late Antiquity: Judaism and Christianity</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32351"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/religions-americas" >Religions of the Americas</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32361"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/south-asian-religions" >South Asian Religions</a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32366"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/theology" >Theology</a></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1374005275" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_sv_list_box"  module="boxes" delta="1374005275"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Affiliated Faculty</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374005275' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id='box-1374005275-page' data-page='0' data-delta='1374005275' class='os-sv-list os_sv_list_box sv-list-person sv-list-view-title sv-list-layout-list sv-grid-3'><div class="item-list"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/james-engell"  target="_top">James Engell</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/amy-hollywood"  target="_top">Amy Hollywood</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/david-c-lamberth"  target="_top">David C. Lamberth</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/parimal-g-patil"  target="_top">Parimal G. Patil</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/francis-sc%C3%BCssler-fiorenza"  target="_top">Francis Schüssler Fiorenza</a></li></ul></div></div></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1377028092" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_sv_list_box"  module="boxes" delta="1377028092"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Doctoral Students in Philosophy of Religion</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1377028092' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id='box-1377028092-page' data-page='0' data-delta='1377028092' class='os-sv-list os_sv_list_box sv-list-person sv-list-view-title sv-list-layout-list sv-grid-3'><div class="item-list"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/sherah-bloor"  target="_top">Sherah Bloor</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/aaron-j-goldman"  target="_top">Aaron J.  Goldman</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/danube-johnson"  target="_top">Danube Johnson</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/nicholas-low"  target="_top">Nicholas Low</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/rosanna-picascia"  target="_top">Rosanna Picascia</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/michael-putnam"  target="_top">Michael Putnam</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/julia-reed"  target="_top">Julia Reed</a></li></ul></div></div><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people"  class="more-link">More</a></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_info' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h1><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >Committee on the Study of Religion</a></h1>
    
    <p>

  </div></div></div></div>					  					  <div class="region region-header-third"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-secondary-menu" class="block block-os no-title"  module="os" delta="secondary-menu"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

menu-path-node-61716   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/religions-americas"  title="">Religions of the Americas</a></li><li class="menu-3293 menu-path-node-61726   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/south-asian-religions"  title="">South Asian Religions</a></li><li class="menu-3294 menu-path-node-61731   even   last "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/theology"  title="">Theology</a></li></ul></li><li class="menu-2615 menu-path-people-taxonomy-term-12866   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/taxonomy/term/12866" >People</a></li><li class="menu-2338 menuparent  menu-path-node-56666   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/about"  title="">About</a><span class="open-submenu"></span><ul><li class="menu-2607 menu-path-node-63446  first   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/historical-overview" >Historical Overview</a></li><li class="menu-2360 menu-path-node-57086   even  "><a   </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/research" >RESEARCH</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Religion and Society                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-61706" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><img height="246" width="645" alt="Image San Juan Pilgrimage" title="San Juan Pilgrimage" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-xlarge" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_xlarge/public/religion/files/san_juan_pilgrimage_copy_1.jpg?m=1376419285&amp;itok=O8tvLQJD" /></p><div><div><div><div class="row col-1"><div class="col"><div class="topicMargin type-textarea-multi"><div class="topic"><div class="topic-wrap"><div class="content"><div class="wrap"><div><p> </p><h2>Description</h2><br />The program in Religion and Society prepares students to study religion in its cultural, social, and political contexts. In addition to preparation in a religious tradition or geographical/historical complex students are expected to gain competence in at least one cognate field of study, e.g political theory, anthropology, critical race theory, sociology, literary theory.<br /> <h2>Requirements</h2><br />It is to be expected that doctoral work at Harvard will normally take at least four years, of which the first two will be devoted to preparation for the General Examinations.<br /><br />Two common doctoral seminars are required: Religion 2001, The History of the Study of Religion (offered in the first semester of study) and Religion 2002, Contemporary Conversations in the Study of Religion (offered in the fourth semester of study). In addition, a minimum of two other courses in the study of religion as such are required during the first two years of study.<br /><br />Preparation for the General Examinations includes participation in the Religion and Society Colloquium for all pre-generals students. The Colloquium is restricted to doctoral students, and Masters level students who are prepared to work at an advanced level (by approval of the faculty member directing the colloquium).<br /><br />Program Language Requirements are namely French and German and whatever languages are necessary for the study of the candidate's primary sources in original languages.<br /> <h2>General Examinations</h2><br />There are four General Examinations for the Ph.D. program and three for the Th.D. Program; General Examinations are given twice during the academic year, in April, and in October. Students must submit to the Standing Committee on the Study of Religion bibliographies for each of the examinations. Bibliographies will consist of primary works on which the student is prepared to be examined, and secondary works which have been useful for the student's preparation, though not of primary focus. Bibliographies must be approved by the student's faculty committee, chaired by the student's advisor, which superintends the student's doctoral program in the term before the student anticipates writing the General Examinations. The deadline for approval of bibliographies for exams to be taken is 6 months prior to the exam period. This means that first submissions of the bibliographies must occur well before the deadline in case revisions are necessary.<br /><br />There are three examinations for the Th.D.: political, social and cultural theory; a field of theological studies; and a special problem area or research focus in Religion and Society. For the Ph.D., there are four examinations: theories and methods in the study of religion; an examination in one religious tradition or geographical/historical complex or in the modern west; political, social and cultural theory; and a special problem area or research focus in Religion and Society.<br /><br /><em>Recent and current dissertation topics include:</em><p> </p><ul><li>After Peace: How Does the Israeli Peace Camp Think about Religion, Nationalism and Justice?</li><li>No Closure: Catholic Practice and Boston’s Parish Shutdowns</li><li>Between Barth and Wittgenstein: Pragmatist Themes in Hans Frei’s ‘Postliberal’ Theology</li><li>The Limits of Self-Sufficiency: Anthropology and Theology in Kant</li><li>Religion and Public Life: John Rawls, John Courtney Murray and Domination-Reduction in Liberal Democracy</li><li>The Haunting Quest for What is Lost: Aesthetics and Desire in Memoirs of Religious Disenchantment</li><li>Limitations on the Right to Manifestation of Religion Under the European Convention on Human Right The Boundaries of Pluralism</li><li>Beyond the Religious Pursuit of Race: A Genealogy of Secularization within Scientific Theories of Human Difference</li><li>“The Politics of Pilgrimage”: Religion, Nationalism, and Ethnic Identity in the Csíksomlyó Pilgrimage, Transylvania, Romania</li><li>‘Big Boston’: the impact of Community Organizing on Christian and Jewish Congregations in Boston</li><li>Limitations on the Right to Manifestation of Religion Under the European Convention on Human Rights: Constructions of the Public Sphere</li><li>“Recasting the Old Questions”: Theological Reliance and Renunciation in the Political Thought of Hannah Arendt</li></ul></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div> </div></div><div><p>Barker Center, Cambridge, MA 02138<br />Telephone: (617) 495-5781 | Fax: (617) 496-5798 | Email: <a href="mailto:csrel@fas.harvard">csrel@fas.harvard</a></p></div></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail menu-item-32351"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/religions-americas" >Religions of the Americas</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32361"><a   </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1374005394" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_sv_list_box"  module="boxes" delta="1374005394"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Affiliated Faculty</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374005394' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id='box-1374005394-page' data-page='0' data-delta='1374005394' class='os-sv-list os_sv_list_box sv-list-person sv-list-view-title sv-list-layout-list sv-grid-3'><div class="item-list"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/marla-frederick"  target="_top">Marla Frederick</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/michael-d-jackson"  target="_top">Michael D. 		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/research" >RESEARCH</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Religion, Gender and Culture                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-61711" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><img height="246" width="645" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-xlarge" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_xlarge/public/religion/files/hindudevoteenepal_copy.jpg?m=1374763941&amp;itok=g3Rx42V_" alt="" title="" /></p>
<p></p>
<h2>Description</h2>
<p><br />This field considers religion, gender and culture in their multiple senses, and in their relation to the study of the status and history of women, sexuality, and other markers of diversity. Courses and doctoral work on these topics, whether normative, descriptive, or practical, can be addressed from a wide variety of disciplinary perspectives. Faculty members in this field have particular strengths in feminist theory, queer theory, theology, history, literature, ethics, biblical studies, and post-colonial studies. These topics and approaches may be pursued in any religious tradition that has sufficient support on the faculty, and can also be studied in a comparative mode.<br /><br /><em>Recent and current dissertation topics include:</em></p>
<p></p>
<ul><li>“The Problem of the Land is the Problem of the Woman”: A Genealogy of Ecofeminism at Grailville</li>
<li>Abortion and the Politics of God: Patient Narratives and Public Rhetoric in the American Abortion Debate</li>
<li>Transfiguring Sexual Difference in Maximus Confessor</li>
<li>Divinity, Difference, and Democracy: A Critical Materialist Reading of Luce Irigaray’s Politics of Incarnation</li>
<li>Constructing “Asian Women”: A Critical Examination of Cultural-Theological Rhetoric</li>
<li>Neighbors and Other Strangers: A Critical Feminist Liberation Theology of the Neighbor and Welfare Reform</li>
<li>The Rhetoric of Sexual Purity in Contemporary Conservative U.S. Christianity</li>
<li>Theo-ethical Rhetoric of Home: Transforming Gendered Place and Practice</li>
</ul></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32351"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/religions-americas" >Religions of the Americas</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32361"><a   </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1374005446" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_sv_list_box"  module="boxes" delta="1374005446"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Affiliated Faculty</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374005446' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id='box-1374005446-page' data-page='0' data-delta='1374005446' class='os-sv-list os_sv_list_box sv-list-person sv-list-view-title sv-list-layout-list sv-grid-3'><div class="item-list"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/leila-ahmed"  target="_top">Leila Ahmed</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/aisha-m-beliso-de-jesus"  target="_top">Aisha M.   </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1377028275" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_sv_list_box"  module="boxes" delta="1377028275"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Doctoral Students in Religion, Gender and Culture</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1377028275' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id='box-1377028275-page' data-page='0' data-delta='1377028275' class='os-sv-list os_sv_list_box sv-list-person sv-list-view-title sv-list-layout-list sv-grid-3'><div class="item-list"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/chelsea-hall"  target="_top">Chelsea Hall</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/amy-rae-benjamin"  target="_top">Amy Rae Howe</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/siobhan-kelly"  target="_top">Siobhan Kelly</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/nicholas-j-mendoza"  target="_top">Nicholas J. 		<!--footer region beg-->
		<footer id="footer" class="clearfix" role="contentinfo">
		<!-- Three column 3x33 Gpanel -->
		
			<div class="at-panel gpanel panel-display footer clearfix">

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1371845153' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id="file-53886" class="file file-image file-image-png">

          <h2 class="element-invisible"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/religion-footer.png?m=1479879567">religion-footer.png</a></h2>
