		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/undergraduate" >UNDERGRADUATE</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/advising" >ADVISING</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Religion as a Secondary Field                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-64216" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><table><tr><td>
<h3>Religion as a Secondary Field (6 Half-Courses)</h3>
<ol><li>General: Comparative and Methodological Studies (2 half-courses)</li>
<ol><li>Either 1 half-course chosen from Religion 11-20 or Religion 97. Sophomore Tutorial</li>
<li>1 other half-course</li>
</ol><li>Major Tradition/Area of Inquiry (4 half-courses)</li>
<ol><li>4 half-courses focusing on a particular era or cultural/geographical area important to the tradition or an approved alternative area of focus</li>
</ol></ol></td>
</tr><tr><td></td>
</tr></table></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-first"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374178945" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374178945"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Plan of Study Forms for Undergraduates</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374178945' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_a_2014-15_writeable.doc">Option A: Two Major Traditions in Comparative Context</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_b_2014-15_writeable.doc">Option B: One Major Tradition in Comparative Context</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_c_2014-15_writeable.doc">*Option C: Joint Concentration with Religion as the Primary Field</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_d_2014-15_writeable.doc">*Option D: Joint Concentration with Religion as a Allied Field</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_secondary_field_2014-15_writeable.doc">Religion as a Secondary Field</a></li>
</ul><p>*Students pursuing a Joint Concentration must also complete the college form<a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/joint_conc_app_2_-_without_list_of_programs.pdf"> "Joint Concentration Application".</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374163646" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374163646"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Guides &amp; Handbooks</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374163646' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/religious_studies_guide_print_10-1-13.pdf">Guide to Writing in the Study of Religion</a></li>
<li><a href="http://writing.fas.harvard.edu/" target="_blank">Writing Resources at Harvard</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_handbook_2016-7_final_0.pdf">Undergraduate Handbook</a> (2016-17)</li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/senior_thesis_handbook_2015-16_student.pdf">Senior Thesis Handbook</a> (2015-16)</li>
</ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>																	</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-146421"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/undergraduate"  class="active-trail active">Undergraduate</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32966"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/faqs-undergraduate-program" >FAQ&#039;s: Undergraduate Program</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-35426"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/courses" >Courses</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32561"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/admission" >Concentrating</a></li><li class="expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-32581"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/advising"  class="active-trail active">Advising</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-32856"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/concentration-plans" >Concentration Options</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-32861"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/options-and-b" >Options A and B Requirements</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-32981"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/options-c-and-d-requirements" >Options C and D Requirements</a></li><li class="last leaf active-trail active-trail menu-depth-3 menu-item-32986"><a menu-item-32596"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/coursework" >Coursework</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-33086"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/links-undergraduates" >Resources for Undergraduates</a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-39351"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/beyond-harvard-0" >Beyond Harvard</a></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1373989095" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1373989095"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Concentration Questions?</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1373989095' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/courtney-bickel-lamberth">Director of Undergraduate Studies, Courtney Lamberth</a></p>
<p><a href="mailto:kstreet@fas.harvard.edu">Assistant Director of Undergraduate Studies, Kera Street</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1364321266" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1364321266"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Words from our Students</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1364321266' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><address>"The structure of the concentration gives students a lot of flexibility and freedom to explore the religions and themes they're interested in. In my experience, the professors are also very involved and want to get to know you on a personal level, which is something you don't get in the larger concentrations." – Hebert, '13</address></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>

					<!--header regions beg-->
			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-info" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_info no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_info"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_info' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h1><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >Committee on the Study of Religion</a></h1>
    
    <p>
    </p></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>					  					  <div class="region region-header-third"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-secondary-menu" class="block block-os no-title"  module="os" delta="secondary-menu"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-secondary-menu" id="nice-menu-secondary-menu"><li class="menu-22511 menu-path-faq  first   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq"  title="List of FAQs">FAQ</a></li><li class="menu-2605 menu-path-node-63151   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/apply-phd" >Apply PhD</a></li><li class="menu-6668 menu-path-studyofreligionfasharvardedu-pages-forms   odd  "><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/forms"  title="For Current Students &amp; Faculty">Forms</a></li><li class="menu-2603 menu-path-node-57086   even   last "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/contact" >Contact</a></li></ul>
</div>
  </div></div><div id="block-boxes-solr-search-box" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_search_solr_search_box no-title"  module="boxes" delta="solr_search_box"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

				  <!--main menu region beg-->
		  <div id="menu-bar" class="nav region-menu-bar clearfix"><nav id="block-os-primary-menu" class="block block-os no-title menu-wrapper menu-bar-wrapper clearfix"  module="os" delta="primary-menu">  
  
  <ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-primary-menu" id="nice-menu-primary-menu"><li class="menu-2336 menu-path-  first   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/research"  title="" class="active">Research</a><span class="open-submenu"></span><ul><li class="menu-3285 menu-path-node-57416  first   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/african-religions"  title="">African Religions</a></li><li class="menu-3295 menu-path-node-57436   even  "><a   </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/research" >RESEARCH</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Religions of the Americas                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-61716" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><img height="246" width="645" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-xlarge" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_xlarge/public/religion/files/corpus_christi_procession_copy.jpg?m=1374762959&amp;itok=r_tbQKSL" alt="" title="" /></p>
<p></p>
<h2>Description</h2>
<p><br />This subfield trains specialists in the history of religious thought, institutions, movements, cultures, and practices within the Americas. Students are expected to explore not only the role of particular traditions but also the development of a tradition in other contexts, such as Europe or Africa, and the process of its transmission to the Americas. Candidates are expected to master both the historical and social scientific literatures in their areas of specialized research and to develop methodological expertise relevant to their dissertation work. Ordinarily, students in this subfield will participate in the bimonthly North American Religions Colloquium.<br /><br /><em>Recent and current dissertation topics include:</em></p>
<p></p>
<ul><li>Parenting in Neverland: Childhood Religion and Family Values in Contemporary American Paganism</li>
<li>‘Big Boston’: the impact of Community Organizing on Christian and Jewish Congregations in Boston</li>
<li>Beyond the Religious Pursuit of Race: A Genealogy of Secularization within Scientific Theories of Human Difference</li>
<li>Post-WWII American Judaism: How Judaism Became an American Religion</li>
<li>Living Scriptures: Language, Authority, and Emotion in a Mormon Congregation</li>
<li>Cuba’s Rival Rituals: 20th C. Festivals for the Virgin of Charity and the Contested Streets of the “Nation”</li>
</ul></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail   </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1374005568" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_sv_list_box"  module="boxes" delta="1374005568"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/research" >RESEARCH</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Religions of Late Antiquity: Judaism and Christianity                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-61721" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><img height="246" width="645" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-xlarge" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_xlarge/public/religion/files/palmyra_copy_0.jpg?m=1374763211&amp;itok=pF7jOdbv" alt="" title="" /></p>
<p></p>
<h2>Description</h2>
<p><br />This Ph.D. program is devoted to the study of Judaism and Christianity, each in light of the other and in light of the religions, cultures, and societies of the Roman Empire and the Near East in late antiquity (1st -5th centuries C.E.). The program is predicated on the assumption that a knowledge of Judaism is essential for a full understanding of the history of Christianity, that a knowledge of Christianity is essential for a full understanding of the history of Judaism, and that a knowledge of the Greco-Roman world, its culture, society, and institutions, is essential for all students of either ancient Judaism or ancient Christianity. Students will typically choose to concentrate in either Jewish or Christian materials. <br /><br /></p>
<h2>Requirements and Exams</h2>
<p><br />In their coursework students will be expected to take at least two courses on the history of the religions, cultures and societies of the Mediterranean world of late antiquity, and at least two courses that explore the interaction of Judaism and Christianity during the same period. Advanced knowledge of Greek or Hebrew is required for admission. Before taking the general examinations, students must demonstrate knowledge of the other language (Greek or Hebrew) at the intermediate level or above; as well as reading knowledge of two modern research languages (typically German and French). A third ancient language where relevant to the student’s interests (e.g. Latin, Coptic, Syriac) is highly recommended. The comprehensive examination will be tailored for each student, but the basic format is the same for all:</p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<ul><li>First exam - theories and methods in the study of religion</li>
<li>Second exam - history of Jews and Judaism, Christians and Christianity in the Mediterranean world of late antiquity</li>
<li>Third exam - translation and interpretation of ancient literary texts and other materials</li>
<li>Fourth exam - area of specialization, usually related broadly to the subject matter of the proposed dissertation</li>
</ul><p></p>
<p><br /><em>Recent and current dissertation topics include:</em></p>
<p></p>
<ul><li>Ecclesia Laus Corinthiensis: Negotiating Ethnicity under Empire</li>
<li>Carnal Resurrection: Sexuality and Sexual Difference in Early Christianity</li>
<li>Economics and Gender: The Socioeconomic Religious Status of Women in Asia Minor in the First Two Centuries of the Common Era</li>
<li>Ekklesia: 1. Corinthians in the Context of Ancient Democratic Discourse</li>
<li>The Power of Silence: The Empty Temple Mount in Late Antique Jerusalem</li>
</ul></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail   </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1374005505" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_sv_list_box"  module="boxes" delta="1374005505"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Affiliated Faculty</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374005505' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id='box-1374005505-page' data-page='0' data-delta='1374005505' class='os-sv-list os_sv_list_box sv-list-person sv-list-view-title sv-list-layout-list sv-grid-3'><div class="item-list"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/giovanni-bazzana"  target="_top">Giovanni Bazzana</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/shaye-jd-cohen"  target="_top">Shaye J.D. 		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Research                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-57301" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><img height="250" width="655" alt="Research" title="Research" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-xlarge" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_xlarge/public/religion/files/research.jpg?m=1372183819&amp;itok=WkZECvAj" /></p>
<div>
<p>At Harvard, advanced programs of study involving religion may be arranged under many auspices. The Ph.D. under this Committee is in "The Study of Religion". Some candidates will find that they can best pursue their interests by becoming a candidate for the Ph.D. in such departments as Anthropology, Classics, History, East Asian or Near Eastern Languages and Civilizations, Philosophy, or Sanskrit and Indian Studies. Likewise, some candidates may find the program for the M.T.S., M.Div., or Th.M. degree in the Harvard Divinity School more suitable for focusing their interests and strengthening their preparation for doctoral studies. The Committee reserves the right to advise the applicant to seek training in one of these alternative programs if in its judgment such a course would be in the applicant's interest.</p>
<p>Fields of study, admissions, and requirements differ; applicants should indicate in their submission which field will be their primary specialization. If you indicate one of the fields marked below by an asterisk*, please specify the religious traditions(s) and/or approximate geographical range(s) or temporal period(s) from which the primary sources for your focus of inquiry will be drawn. You may also propose comparative work within any of these fields.<br /><br />For descriptions and related faculty, please refer to the corresponding field page under the Research section.</p>
<ul><li>African Religions</li>
<li>Buddhist Studies</li>
<li>Comparative Studies</li>
<li>East Asian Religions</li>
<li>Ethics*</li>
<li>Greco-Roman Religions</li>
<li>Hebrew Bible/Old Testament</li>
<li>History of Christianity</li>
<li>Islamic Studies</li>
<li>Jewish Studies</li>
<li>New Testament and Early Christianity</li>
<li>Philosophy of Religion*</li>
<li>Religion and Society*</li>
<li>Religion, Gender and Culture*</li>
<li>Religions of the Americas</li>
<li>Religions of Late Antiquity: Judaism and Christianity</li>
<li>South Asian Religions</li>
<li>Theology*</li>
</ul></div></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-31391"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/research"  class="active-trail active active">Research</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31396"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/african-religions" >African Religions</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31401"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/buddhist-studies" >Buddhist Studies</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31416"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/comparative-studies" >Comparative Studies</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31446"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/east-asian-religions" >East Asian Religions</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31451"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/ethics" >Ethics</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31456"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/greco-roman-religions" >Greco-Roman Religions</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31461"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/hebrew-bibleold-testament" >Hebrew Bible/Old Testament</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32316"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/history-christianity" >History of Christianity</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32321"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/islamic-studies" >Islamic Studies</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32326"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/jewish-studies" >Jewish Studies </a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32331"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/new-testament-and-early-christianity" >New Testament and Early Christianity</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32336"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/philosophy-religion" >Philosophy of Religion</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32341"><a menu-item-32351"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/religions-americas" >Religions of the Americas</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32361"><a   </div></div></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>
		<!--footer region beg-->
		<footer id="footer" class="clearfix" role="contentinfo">

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1371845153' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id="file-53886" class="file file-image file-image-png">

          <h2 class="element-invisible"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/religion-footer.png?m=1479879567">religion-footer.png</a></h2>

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_info' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h1><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >Committee on the Study of Religion</a></h1>

  </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Resources                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-57306" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><img height="250" width="655" alt="Resources" title="Resources" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-xlarge" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_xlarge/public/religion/files/resources.jpg?m=1372184668&amp;itok=qUpgLopn" /></p>
<p>In this section, we have listed a number of Frequently Asked Questions, included the Handbooks and various required forms for both the Undergraduate and Doctoral programs, and included a list of links to other schools, departments, and programs that may be pertinent to those interested in the study of religion.</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
				
			</div>
		</div>
		<!--footer region beg-->
		<footer id="footer" class="clearfix" role="contentinfo">
		<!-- Three column 3x33 Gpanel -->
		
			<div class="at-panel gpanel panel-display footer clearfix">
								<div class="region region-footer-first"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-1371845153" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_media no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1371845153"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1371845153' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id="file-53886" class="file file-image file-image-png">

          <h2 class="element-invisible"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/religion-footer.png?m=1479879567">religion-footer.png</a></h2>
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <img class="image-style-os-files-xxlarge" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_xxlarge/public/religion/files/religion-footer.png?m=1499733428&amp;itok=K-pEO8QM" width="300" height="63" alt="" title="" />  </div>

  
</div>
</div></div></div>
  </div></div><div id="block-boxes-1372101242" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html no-title"  module="boxes" delta="1372101242"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

Students who elect to write a thesis should regard it as the culmination of years of reading, analyzing, and making arguments about religion. As noted above, in order to be eligible to write a thesis, students must maintain a minimum average in the concentration of B+." />
<meta property="og:description" content="The senior honors thesis is an opportunity to explore an area of interest in detail. Students who elect to write a thesis should regard it as the culmination of years of reading, analyzing, and making arguments about religion. As noted above, in order to be eligible to write a thesis, students must maintain a minimum average in the concentration of B+." />

			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/undergraduate" >UNDERGRADUATE</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/coursework" >COURSEWORK</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Senior Honors Thesis                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-63496" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="content">
<div class="wrap">
<p><strong></strong>The senior honors thesis is an opportunity to explore an area of interest in detail. Students who elect to write a thesis should regard it as the culmination of years of reading, analyzing, and making arguments about religion. As noted above, in order to be eligible to write a thesis, students must maintain a minimum average in the concentration of B+.</p>
<p>Due to the nature of our field, the subject matter of religion theses varies widely. In all cases, individual theses should be specific enough to allow for depth of treatment, while not so narrowly construed that they lose sight of broader issues in the Study of Religion. This is particularly important because the readers of a given thesis are often drawn from a various fields within the Study of Religion. Depending on your concentration plan, your thesis may focus on a topic solely within one tradition; or it may involve two traditions, or one tradition and a theme, or (in the case of joint concentrations) one tradition and another academic field; or it may be focused on a single tradition but deal with an issue that involves the comparative study of religious phenomena from other religious traditions as well.</p>
<p>For more information on the thesis, please refer to the <strong>Senior Honors Thesis Handbook</strong> in the below list of<span> </span><span>guides</span><span> </span><span>and</span><span> handbooks.</span><strong> </strong><span> </span></p>
<p>All concentrators are expected to designate the general topic of the thesis by April of the junior year. A prospectus that has been approved and signed by the senior thesis Adviser is due in September of the senior year. The prospectus should include a tentative title, a two-page description of the specific subject matter, and a bibliography. One chapter of the thesis is due in November, another in December, and a third in February. The completed thesis, which should be 50-80 pages, is due in early March. For the complete schedule of dates for the current year, see the Senior Honors Thesis Handbook.</p>
<p>The Assistant Director of Undergraduate Studies oversees the thesis writing process and leads Rel 99, the senior tutorial on thesis-writing.</p>
</div>
</div></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-first"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374163646" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374163646"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Guides &amp; Handbooks</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374163646' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/religious_studies_guide_print_10-1-13.pdf">Guide to Writing in the Study of Religion</a></li>
<li><a href="http://writing.fas.harvard.edu/" target="_blank">Writing Resources at Harvard</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_handbook_2016-7_final_0.pdf">Undergraduate Handbook</a> (2016-17)</li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/senior_thesis_handbook_2015-16_student.pdf">Senior Thesis Handbook</a> (2015-16)</li>
</ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374515432" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374515432"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Undergraduate Resources</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374515432' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="http://osl.fas.harvard.edu/icb/icb.do?keyword=k65178&amp;pageid=icb.page305611">Office of Student Life – Student Organizations</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ocs.fas.harvard.edu/">Office of Career Services</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.funding.fas.harvard.edu/">Harvard College Funding Sources</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.college.harvard.edu/icb/icb.do?keyword=k61161&amp;pageid=icb.page257820">Harvard College</a></li>
<li><a href="http://oie.fas.harvard.edu/">Office of International Education</a></li>
<li><a href="http://cuhs.harvard.edu/">Harvard’s Committee on the Use of Human Subjects</a></li>
</ul><p>Register your travel abroad for emergency support:<br /><a href="https://www.globalsupport.harvard.edu/travel-tools">www.globalsupport.harvard.edu/travel-tools</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-bottom"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374001138" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374001138"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Past Senior Theses</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374001138' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div class="content"><div class="wrap"><p>The Assistant Director of Undergraduate Studies has hard copies of many past theses that are available for students to borrow. Looking through old theses may stimulate ideas for a topic or give you ideas about how to organize or write your own thesis.</p><ul><li><div align="left">"The 'Tug-of-War' over British Muslim Identity: A Comparative Analysis of British Muslim Engagement Programs today" (2016)</div></li><li><div align="left">"Making Boston Warm: A Case Study of the Intersection of Social Movements and the Social Gospel in the Modern City" (2016)</div></li><li><div align="left">"Militant Christianity and Universal Politics: Alain Badiou as Political Theologian" (2016)</div></li><li><div align="left">"How to Read Body Language: Constructions of Power, Women, and 'The Gaze' in Early Christianity" (2016)</div></li><li><div align="left">"A Time for Tulpas: Technology, Language, and the Study of Religion" (2016)</div></li><li><div align="left">"Tevye's Children: Jewish Continuity in Changing Times" (2016)</div></li><li><div align="left">"对耶稣丢面子 Losing Face for Jesus: An Ethnography of Young Adults in the Boston Chinese Evangelical Church" (2016)</div></li><li>“Living the Mission: The Catholic Church and Human Rights in Peru.”</li><li>“‘Maybe I Did Not Live As I Should”: An Analysis of Tolstoy’s Christian Ethic in His Post-Conversion Literature.”</li><li>“Constructing Conflict: Israeli and Palestinian Conceptions of the Role of Religion in the Disagreement over the Temple Mount/Haram al-Sharif.”</li><li>“Making Kafka Happy: An Experiment in Recapturing the Joy in God’s Death and Modernity.”</li><li>“Flexible Conservatism: Authority and Ambiguity in the Thought of Vivekananda and Schechter” (2012): Adviser: Parimal Patil</li><li>“Child Witches and Witch Hunts: New Images of the Occult in the Democratic Republic of Congo” (2011); Adviser: Timothy Nelson</li><li>“Advisers to the Almighty: The Modern Church Consulting Industry in the United States” (2010); Adviser: Marie Griffith</li><li>“The Ebb and Flow of Peace: Hindu-Muslim Relations in Hyderabad” (2009); Adviser: Diana Eck</li><li>“First Timothy and the Question of Women’s Leadership in the Church: An Analysis of Evangelical Biblical Hermeneutics” (2009); Adviser: Laura Nasrallah</li></ul></div></div></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>								</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1373989095" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1373989095"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Concentration Questions?</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1373989095' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/courtney-bickel-lamberth">Director of Undergraduate Studies, Courtney Lamberth</a></p>
<p><a href="mailto:kstreet@fas.harvard.edu">Assistant Director of Undergraduate Studies, Kera Street</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1364321266" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1364321266"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Words from our Students</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1364321266' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><address>"The structure of the concentration gives students a lot of flexibility and freedom to explore the religions and themes they're interested in. In my experience, the professors are also very involved and want to get to know you on a personal level, which is something you don't get in the larger concentrations." – Hebert, '13</address></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->

<meta name="description" content="The Senior Tutorial (or Senior Seminar) is year-long, graded SAT/UNS, and it culminates in the completion and submission of the senior honors thesis. By April of the junior year, students should discuss their intention to pursue a thesis with the Director of Undergraduate Studies, the Assistant Director of Undergraduate Studies, and relevant faculty members. If the student elects to write a thesis at this point, he or she should be able to articulate a general topic and have some idea who might serve as effective advisers for the project." />

By April of the junior year, students should discuss their intention to pursue a thesis with the Director of Undergraduate Studies, the Assistant Director of Undergraduate Studies, and relevant faculty members. If the student elects to write a thesis at this point, he or she should be able to articulate a general topic and have some idea who might serve as effective advisers for the project." />

				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/undergraduate" >UNDERGRADUATE</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/coursework" >COURSEWORK</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/tutorial-system" >TUTORIAL SYSTEM</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Senior                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-63456" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><strong>The Senior Tutorial (or Senior Seminar)</strong> is year-long, graded SAT/UNS, and it culminates in the completion and submission of the senior honors thesis. By April of the junior year, students should discuss their intention to pursue a thesis with the Director of Undergraduate Studies, the Assistant Director of Undergraduate Studies, and relevant faculty members. If the student elects to write a thesis at this point, he or she should be able to articulate a general topic and have some idea who might serve as effective advisers for the project. Students are expected to speak with possible thesis advisers near the end of their junior year and, if possible, line up thesis advisers for the senior year. Students need to have both a graduate student and a faculty adviser. The Director of Undergraduate Studies and the Assistant Director of Undergraduate Studies often help in this process.</p>
<p>During the senior year students are expected to meet with their graduate student advisers about once a week to discuss work in progress. They meet with faculty advisers less often, usually once a month. In order to receive SAT in Religion 99 for the fall term, students must submit two draft chapters of their senior thesis. Submission and acceptance of the senior thesis fulfills the SAT requirement for Religion 99 for the spring term.</p>
<p>In addition to meeting with thesis advisers, which is a required part of Religion 99, senior thesis writers meet bi-weekly as a group to discuss and develop research and writing skills. This seminar is organized and run by the <strong>Assistant Director of Undergraduate Studies</strong>.</p>
<p><strong>Concentrators are encouraged to use these writing resources:</strong></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1374163646" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374163646"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Guides &amp; Handbooks</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374163646' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/religious_studies_guide_print_10-1-13.pdf">Guide to Writing in the Study of Religion</a></li>
<li><a href="http://writing.fas.harvard.edu/" target="_blank">Writing Resources at Harvard</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_handbook_2016-7_final_0.pdf">Undergraduate Handbook</a> (2016-17)</li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/senior_thesis_handbook_2015-16_student.pdf">Senior Thesis Handbook</a> (2015-16)</li>
</ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1374001138" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374001138"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Past Senior Theses</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374001138' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div class="content"><div class="wrap"><p>The Assistant Director of Undergraduate Studies has hard copies of many past theses that are available for students to borrow. Looking through old theses may stimulate ideas for a topic or give you ideas about how to organize or write your own thesis.</p><ul><li><div align="left">"The 'Tug-of-War' over British Muslim Identity: A Comparative Analysis of British Muslim Engagement Programs today" (2016)</div></li><li><div align="left">"Making Boston Warm: A Case Study of the Intersection of Social Movements and the Social Gospel in the Modern City" (2016)</div></li><li><div align="left">"Militant Christianity and Universal Politics: Alain Badiou as Political Theologian" (2016)</div></li><li><div align="left">"How to Read Body Language: Constructions of Power, Women, and 'The Gaze' in Early Christianity" (2016)</div></li><li><div align="left">"A Time for Tulpas: Technology, Language, and the Study of Religion" (2016)</div></li><li><div align="left">"Tevye's Children: Jewish Continuity in Changing Times" (2016)</div></li><li><div align="left">"对耶稣丢面子 Losing Face for Jesus: An Ethnography of Young Adults in the Boston Chinese Evangelical Church" (2016)</div></li><li>“Living the Mission: The Catholic Church and Human Rights in Peru.”</li><li>“‘Maybe I Did Not Live As I Should”: An Analysis of Tolstoy’s Christian Ethic in His Post-Conversion Literature.”</li><li>“Constructing Conflict: Israeli and Palestinian Conceptions of the Role of Religion in the Disagreement over the Temple Mount/Haram al-Sharif.”</li><li>“Making Kafka Happy: An Experiment in Recapturing the Joy in God’s Death and Modernity.”</li><li>“Flexible Conservatism: Authority and Ambiguity in the Thought of Vivekananda and Schechter” (2012): Adviser: Parimal Patil</li><li>“Child Witches and Witch Hunts: New Images of the Occult in the Democratic Republic of Congo” (2011); Adviser: Timothy Nelson</li><li>“Advisers to the Almighty: The Modern Church Consulting Industry in the United States” (2010); Adviser: Marie Griffith</li><li>“The Ebb and Flow of Peace: Hindu-Muslim Relations in Hyderabad” (2009); Adviser: Diana Eck</li><li>“First Timothy and the Question of Women’s Leadership in the Church: An Analysis of Evangelical Biblical Hermeneutics” (2009); Adviser: Laura Nasrallah</li></ul></div></div></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/research" >RESEARCH</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      South Asian Religions                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-61726" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><img height="246" width="645" class="media-element file-default file-os-files-xlarge" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_xlarge/public/religion/files/1342-47_var_saddou_dorado_copy.jpg?m=1374764415&amp;itok=NJpTGJQP" alt="" title="" /></p>
<p></p>
<h2>Description</h2>
<p><br />Doctoral Studies in this area investigate the various South Asian religions, primarily Hinduism, Buddhism, Islam, and Christianity (while a successful program of study that attends also to Jain or Sikh traditions is possible). Study can proceed from a variety of methodological perspectives, including history, theology, philosophy, literature, arts, and anthropology. Examples of ways that students may structure their studies include concentrating on a particular religious community or tradition (such as Hinduism), engaging in thematic study that crosses religious, cultural, and linguistic borders, exploring the complex interactions among various religious movement and traditions within South Asia in a particular period or in a particular region, or tracing the religious contours of the South Asian global diaspora. Students in South Asian Religious Traditions are expected to study the classical and/or modern languages relevant to their tradition-specific and thematic areas of focus.<br /><br /><em>Recent and current dissertation topics include:</em></p>
<p></p>
<ul><li>Ethical Revaluation in the Thought of Santideva</li>
<li>Arumuka Navalar and the Formation of a Saiva Public Colonial Jaffna</li>
<li>Transforming the Seat of the Goddess into Visnu's Place: The Complex Layering of Theologies in the Karavira Mahatmaya</li>
<li>Reviving Religion: The Qadiri Sufi Order, Popular Devotion to Sufi Saint Muhyiuddin "Abdul Qadir al-Gilani and Processes of "Islamization" in Tamil Nadu and Sri Lanka</li>
<li>Nectar of Bhakti: Devotional Songs of Gujarati Saint-poet Narasinha Mehta</li>
<li>The Ocean of Inquiry: A Forgotten Classic of Late Vedānta</li>
<li>The Role of Religion in the Formation of Panjabi Literary Culture</li>
<li>Fragile Virtue: Interpreting Women’s Monastic Practice in Early Medieval India</li>
<li>Religious Identity and the Vernacularization of Literary Cultures of the Panjab, 1500-1700</li>
<li>Ethics and Religion in a Classic of Sanskrit Drama: Harsa's <em>Nagananda</em></li>
<li>Philosophy in Any Language: Interaction between Arabic, Sanskrit, and Persian Intellectual Cultures in Mughal South Asia</li>
</ul></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-31391"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/research"  class="active-trail active">Research</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31396"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/african-religions" >African Religions</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31401"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/buddhist-studies" >Buddhist Studies</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31416"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/comparative-studies" >Comparative Studies</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31446"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/east-asian-religions" >East Asian Religions</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31451"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/ethics" >Ethics</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31456"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/greco-roman-religions" >Greco-Roman Religions</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31461"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/hebrew-bibleold-testament" >Hebrew Bible/Old Testament</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32316"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/history-christianity" >History of Christianity</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32321"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/islamic-studies" >Islamic Studies</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32326"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/jewish-studies" >Jewish Studies </a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32331"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/new-testament-and-early-christianity" >New Testament and Early Christianity</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32336"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/philosophy-religion" >Philosophy of Religion</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32341"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/religion-and-society" >Religion and Society</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32346"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/religion-gender-and-culture" >Religion, Gender and Culture</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32356"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/religions-late-antiquity-judaism-and-christianity" >Religions of Late Antiquity: Judaism and Christianity</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32351"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/religions-americas" >Religions of the Americas</a></li><li class="leaf active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-32361"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/south-asian-religions"  class="active-trail active active">South Asian Religions</a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32366"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/theology" >Theology</a></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1374005616" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_sv_list_box"  module="boxes" delta="1374005616"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Affiliated Faculty</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374005616' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id='box-1374005616-page' data-page='0' data-delta='1374005616' class='os-sv-list os_sv_list_box sv-list-person sv-list-view-title sv-list-layout-list sv-grid-3'><div class="item-list"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/diana-eck"  target="_top">Diana Eck</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/francis-x-clooney"  target="_top">Francis X. Clooney</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/janet-gyatso"  target="_top">Janet Gyatso</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/charles-hallisey"  target="_top">Charles Hallisey</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/anne-e-monius"  target="_top">Anne E.  Monius</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/parimal-g-patil"  target="_top">Parimal G. Patil</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/leornard-w-j-van-der-kuijp"  target="_top">Leonard W. J.  van der Kuijp</a></li></ul></div></div></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1377028560" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_sv_list_box"  module="boxes" delta="1377028560"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Doctoral Students in South Asian Religions</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1377028560' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id='box-1377028560-page' data-page='0' data-delta='1377028560' class='os-sv-list os_sv_list_box sv-list-person sv-list-view-title sv-list-layout-list sv-grid-3'><div class="item-list"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/gregory-clines"  target="_top">Gregory Clines</a></li><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/seth-david-powell"  target="_top">Seth David Powell</a></li></ul></div></div><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people"  class="more-link">More</a></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_info' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h1><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >Committee on the Study of Religion</a></h1>
    
    <p>

  </div></div></div></div>					  					  <div class="region region-header-third"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-secondary-menu" class="block block-os no-title"  module="os" delta="secondary-menu"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/religions-late-antiquity-judaism-and-christianity"  title="">Religions of Late Antiquity: Judaism and Christianity</a></li><li class="menu-3292 menu-path-node-61716   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/religions-americas"  title="">Religions of the Americas</a></li><li class="menu-3293 menu-path-node-61726   odd   </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics" >ACADEMICS</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral" >DOCTORAL</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      ThD Program                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-57201" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Prospective students interested in doctoral work in religion may only apply for the Ph.D. program in the Study of Religion at Harvard University.</p><p>The Th.D. program of the Harvard Divinity School was inaugurated in 1914 and the final cohort was admitted in 2014. The Committee on the Study of Religion continues to administer those students enrolled in the Th.D. program. The Th.D. program emphasizes the study of the literatures, languages, practices, and institutions that shape religious and theological traditions and thought from a range of methodological and theoretical perspectives. Although the Western humanistic traditions in their histories and their encounters with other cultures and religions, past and present, form the historic basis for the Th.D. at Harvard Divinity School, the program also offers the opportunity for students to engage in the study of varieties of geographical/historical complexes and religious traditions.</p><h3>Th.D. Program Forms</h3><ul><li><a href="pages/overview-program-requirements">Overview of Program Requirements</a></li><li><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/thd_handbook_2016.pdf">ThD Handbook</a></li><li><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/thd_study_plan_0.doc">Plan of Study</a></li><li><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/guidelines-foreign-language-certification-course-div-4999" title="">Guidelines for the Foreign Language Certification Course</a></li><li><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/2nd_year_review_intent_thd.doc">Intent to take Second Year Review</a></li><li><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/general_intent_form.doc?m=1443548036">Intent to take General Exams</a></li><li><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/petitions-thd-program" target="_blank" title="">Petitions in the Th.D. Program</a></li></ul></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-31161"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics"  class="active-trail active">Academics</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31166"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/undergraduate" >Undergraduate</a></li><li class="last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-31171"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral"  class="active-trail active">Doctoral</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first collapsed menu-depth-3 menu-item-31306"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/phd-program" >PhD Program &amp; Timeline</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-33061"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/links-doctoral-students" >Links for Doctoral Students</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-32971"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/faqs-doctoral" >FAQ&#039;s: Doctoral</a></li><li class="last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-3 menu-item-31311"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/thd-program"  class="active-trail active active">ThD Program</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32706"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/thd-program-requirements" >Th.D. Program Requirements</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32691"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/timeline-0" >Th.D. Timeline</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32716"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/first-two-years-pre-generals-requirements" >The First Two Years: ThD Pre-Generals</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32756"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-three-thd-general-exams-0" >Year Three: Th.D. General Exams</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32781"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-three-thd-teaching-0" >Year Three: Th.D. Teaching</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32761"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-four-thd-dissertation-prospectus-0" >Year Four: Th.D. Dissertation Prospectus</a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32776"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-five-and-following-dissertation-and-graduationupon-formal-approval-prospectus" >Year Five and Following: The Dissertation and Graduation</a></li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1472248730" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_media"  module="boxes" delta="1472248730"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1472248730' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id="file-697671" class="file file-html file-html-embed">

Candidates for this degree must fulfill the following:ResidenceTwo years of doctoral study in residence are required. During those two years, students must register for and complete at least four credit courses per term. A student must have achieved the minimum grade point average of &quot;B&quot; in each academic year and meet all regulations governing enrollment of incompletes." />

During those two years, students must register for and complete at least four credit courses per term. A student must have achieved the minimum grade point average of &quot;B&quot; in each academic year and meet all regulations governing enrollment of incompletes." />

<!--FLEXIBLE ADMIN HEADER FOR USE BY SELECT GROUPS USING OS-->
	<div id="branding_header">
		<div  class="branding-container clearfix">
