					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics" >ACADEMICS</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral" >DOCTORAL</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/thd-program" >THD PROGRAM</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Year Three: Th.D. General Exams                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-63376" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p> </p><p>Th.D. students are required to take general examinations as follows:</p><ul><li>Two three hour written examinations in their field of concentration.</li><li>One three hour written examination in a special topic chosen and defined by the candidate in consultation with faculty members. This special topic may lie within the area of concentration or may engage other fields of disciplines of academic studies.</li><li>A two-hour oral examination before a committee consisting normally of at least three members of the faculty.</li></ul><p>Please note the following special cases:</p><ul><li>Comparative Religion Th.D. students are required to take, in addition, the Theory and Methods Exam. This exam is required for all Ph.D. students. Students in other fields have opted to take this extremely useful exam on a voluntary basis.</li><li>Hebrew Bible Th.D. students take their General Exams in the Near Eastern Languages and Civilization --NELC-- Department of Harvard Arts and Sciences. These students must fill out the same forms and keep the program administrators of both the Th.D. program and the NELC program advised of their intent to take Generals.</li></ul><p>Please consult <strong>“The Recommendations and Rules for the PhD and ThD General Examinations”</strong> for additional information.<br /><br />General exams are usually given in the middle two weeks of October and April. Students taking Spring Generals must file their "Notice of Intent to Take Generals" by an October deadline. Students taking the fall Generals must file their "Notice of intent to Take Generals" by a late March Deadline. The program office will send eligible students a reminder with the "Notice of Intent" form and a reminder of the exact deadline.<br /><br />Students planning on taking Generals should meet with their advisors to discuss the areas in which they will be examined and the corresponding bibliographies (it's a good idea to begin thinking about and discussing these bibliographies even earlier in your program). Students then return the <strong>"Notice of Intent"</strong> together with the bibliographies to the Study of Religion Office by the deadline specified. The "Intent" form must be signed by a student's advisor. Each of the bibliographies must be signed by the examiner(s) responsible for that exam. The Director of Th.D. Studies reviews each proposal before approving a student taking Generals.<br /><br />As you approach your exam, the program administrator will be happy to provide advice, support, and information as needed.<br /><br /><em>** The Th.D. program progress guidelines specify that all language requirements must be met and all incomplete coursework must be finished before a student is allowed to take general exams. </em></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-31161"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics"  class="active-trail active">Academics</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31166"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/undergraduate" >Undergraduate</a></li><li class="last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-31171"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral"  class="active-trail active">Doctoral</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first collapsed menu-depth-3 menu-item-31306"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/phd-program" >PhD Program &amp; Timeline</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-33061"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/links-doctoral-students" >Links for Doctoral Students</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-32971"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/faqs-doctoral" >FAQ&#039;s: Doctoral</a></li><li class="last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-3 menu-item-31311"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/thd-program"  class="active-trail active">ThD Program</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32706"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/thd-program-requirements" >Th.D. Program Requirements</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32691"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/timeline-0" >Th.D. Timeline</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32716"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/first-two-years-pre-generals-requirements" >The First Two Years: ThD Pre-Generals</a></li><li class="leaf active-trail active-trail menu-depth-4 menu-item-32756"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-three-thd-general-exams-0"  class="active-trail active active">Year Three: Th.D. General Exams</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32781"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-three-thd-teaching-0" >Year Three: Th.D. Teaching</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32761"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-four-thd-dissertation-prospectus-0" >Year Four: Th.D. Dissertation Prospectus</a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32776"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-five-and-following-dissertation-and-graduationupon-formal-approval-prospectus" >Year Five and Following: The Dissertation and Graduation</a></li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1472238788" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1472238788"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Doctoral Student Handbooks</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1472238788' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/139pqOBBoI0KkYhpsZAZiNDa0VU4E-uOZInpygx-Mco8/edit?usp=sharing" target="_blank" title="">Ph.D. Student Handbook</a><br /><a href="http://handbook.gsas.harvard.edu/gsas-handbook" title="">GSAS Student Handbook</a><br /><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/thd_handbook_2016.pdf">Th.D. Student Handbook</a><a href=""  class="os-embed-link" data-delta="1472238788">&lt;embed&gt;</a><div id="embed-popup-1472238788" class="embed-popup"><ul class="links num-links-2"><li class="link-count-iframe first"><a href="#1472238788-iframe" >Iframe</a></li><li class="link-count-oembed last"><a href="#1472238788-oembed" >URL</a></li></ul><div id="1472238788-iframe"><div class="form-item form-type-textarea form-item-web-widgets">

  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1476823074" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1476823074"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Forms for Current Students in Ph.D. Program</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1476823074' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>These forms are for students who are *enrolled* in the Ph.D. program. <strong>Do *not* request access</strong> if you are applying to the Ph.D. program.</p><ul><li><a href="https://docs.google.com/a/harvard.edu/document/d/16wlb4LD2NgMteJ7X0q_9d418vFBUBU1qjjcrFOXdP2I/edit?usp=sharing" title="">Plan of Study</a></li><li><a href="https://goo.gl/forms/w80b6mQGPVRBOIi33" title="">Intent to Take the Second Year Review</a></li><li><a href="https://goo.gl/forms/qrVDPsjLzTIIeWM32" title="">Intent to Take General Exams</a></li><li><a href="https://docs.google.com/a/harvard.edu/document/d/1uLO2yz184gawZctHd6uawOwB4auSDdueAnmytjk3TGY/edit?usp=sharing" title="">Dissertation Prospectus Checklist</a></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1476823712" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1476823712"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Forms for Th.D. Program</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1476823712' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><strong>For Th.D. Program Forms, <a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/thd-program" title="">click here</a>.</strong></p></div></div></div>

<meta name="description" content="Doctoral students are encouraged to take advantage of the many opportunities for teaching at Harvard. These opportunities include teaching in Religion courses, in Divinity School courses, in Core or Gen Ed courses, in courses in other FAS departments, and in junior and senior tutorials in the undergraduate concentration. Generally students who wish to teach are able to secure positions. In addition to its financial benefits, teaching is considered integral to the program of doctoral studies in religion at Harvard." />
<meta property="og:description" content="Doctoral students are encouraged to take advantage of the many opportunities for teaching at Harvard. These opportunities include teaching in Religion courses, in Divinity School courses, in Core or Gen Ed courses, in courses in other FAS departments, and in junior and senior tutorials in the undergraduate concentration. Generally students who wish to teach are able to secure positions. In addition to its financial benefits, teaching is considered integral to the program of doctoral studies in religion at Harvard." />

		  <div class="branding-left"><a href="http://www.harvard.edu" ><img src="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/profiles/openscholar/themes/hwpi_basetheme/images/harvard-logo.png" width="235" height="32" alt="Harvard Logo" /></a></div><div class="branding-right"><a href="http://www.harvard.edu" >HARVARD.EDU</a></div>		</div>

<div id="page" class="container page os_pages-section-56816 header-main header-right content-top footer-left">
	<div id="page-wrapper">

		
					<!--header regions beg-->
			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">
			 <div id="header-container">
				 <div id="header-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display three-col clearfix">
					  					  <div class="region region-header-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-site-info" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_site_info no-title"  module="boxes" delta="site_info"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_info' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h1><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >Committee on the Study of Religion</a></h1>
    
    <p>
    </p></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>					  					  <div class="region region-header-third"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-secondary-menu" class="block block-os no-title"  module="os" delta="secondary-menu"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><ul class="nice-menu nice-menu-down nice-menu-secondary-menu" id="nice-menu-secondary-menu"><li class="menu-22511 menu-path-faq  first   odd  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq"  title="List of FAQs">FAQ</a></li><li class="menu-2605 menu-path-node-63151   even  "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/apply-phd" >Apply PhD</a></li><li class="menu-6668 menu-path-studyofreligionfasharvardedu-pages-forms   odd  "><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/forms"  title="For Current Students &amp; Faculty">Forms</a></li><li class="menu-2603 menu-path-node-57086   even   last "><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/contact" >Contact</a></li></ul>
</div>
  </div></div><div id="block-boxes-solr-search-box" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_search_solr_search_box no-title"  module="boxes" delta="solr_search_box"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics" >ACADEMICS</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral" >DOCTORAL</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/thd-program" >THD PROGRAM</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Year Three: Th.D. Teaching                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-63401" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Doctoral students are encouraged to take advantage of the many opportunities for teaching at Harvard. These opportunities include teaching in Religion courses, in Divinity School courses, in Core or Gen Ed courses, in courses in other FAS departments, and in junior and senior tutorials in the undergraduate concentration. Generally students who wish to teach are able to secure positions. In addition to its financial benefits, teaching is considered integral to the program of doctoral studies in religion at Harvard.<br /><br />Students may begin teaching in the third year. Normally first-year and second-year students are not allowed to teach. Students should seek out teaching fellow positions by approaching faculty with whom they would like to work. It is helpful to give them a resume with a cover letter indicating experience and subject matter preferences. To serve as a tutor in the undergraduate program, contact the Director of Undergraduate Studies in the Study of Religion. In addition, you may apply for teaching fellow opportunities at the Divinity School through Kathryn Kunkel, ThD Administrator, Barker 413.<br /><br />Teaching fellow training and workshops are held throughout the year at the Bok Center for Teaching and Learning. First time teaching fellows are required to participate in the Bok Center orientation week training sessions. In addition, teaching fellow workshops focusing on the study of religion are held throughout the year. Among these, certain sessions will be required for first-time Teaching Fellows, including an HDS Workshop on their course websites and other IT issues. The Departmental Teaching Fellow coordinates these, with the ThD and PhD Program Administrators; any of them may be contacted about the schedule, which will be posted on the TF website.</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-31161"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics"  class="active-trail active">Academics</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31166"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/undergraduate" >Undergraduate</a></li><li class="last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-31171"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral"  class="active-trail active">Doctoral</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first collapsed menu-depth-3 menu-item-31306"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/phd-program" >PhD Program &amp; Timeline</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-33061"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/links-doctoral-students" >Links for Doctoral Students</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-32971"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/faqs-doctoral" >FAQ&#039;s: Doctoral</a></li><li class="last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-3 menu-item-31311"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/thd-program"  class="active-trail active">ThD Program</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32706"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/thd-program-requirements" >Th.D. Program Requirements</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32691"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/timeline-0" >Th.D. Timeline</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32716"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/first-two-years-pre-generals-requirements" >The First Two Years: ThD Pre-Generals</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32756"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-three-thd-general-exams-0" >Year Three: Th.D. General Exams</a></li><li class="leaf active-trail active-trail menu-depth-4 menu-item-32781"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-three-thd-teaching-0"  class="active-trail active active">Year Three: Th.D. Teaching</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32761"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-four-thd-dissertation-prospectus-0" >Year Four: Th.D. Dissertation Prospectus</a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-4 menu-item-32776"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/year-five-and-following-dissertation-and-graduationupon-formal-approval-prospectus" >Year Five and Following: The Dissertation and Graduation</a></li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1374077585" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374077585"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Courses</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374077585' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p></p>

</ul></div></div></div>

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics" >ACADEMICS</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral" >DOCTORAL</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/phd-program" >PHD PROGRAM &amp; TIMELINE</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Years 1 &amp; 2                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-63166" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><h2>Plan of Study, Coursework, Languages &amp; 2-Yr Review</h2><h3> </h3><h3>Plan of Study</h3><p>In order to gain Committee approval of work to be done outside the specialization, the student must, in consultation with the advisor, submit a Plan of Study during their first term by early November (see forms). The Director of Graduate Studies will review and act upon the proposals received. Any later alterations in plans should be duly reported with an updated Plan of Study.</p><h3>Coursework</h3><p>Full-time study during the first two years (4 half-courses per each term; a total of 16) with a minimum average grade of B, is required. Included in these course requirements are:</p><h4>Specialization Studies</h4><p>It is expected that students will complete satisfactorily all basic courses, including those classical languages within their area of specialization, needed to lay the foundation for advanced work. These will vary from person to person and field to field. Students are asked to participate in the activities of their fields, particularly the colloquia.</p><h4>Common Seminars</h4><ol><li>Religion 2001. The Cultural History of the Study of Religion (first year)</li><li>Religion 2002. Contemporary Conversations in the Study of Religion (second year)</li></ol><p>If, in the estimation of the faculty instructor of instructors of Religion 2001 or Religion 2002, academic problems arise in any enrolled student’s performance during the course of a semester, it is expected that instructors will follow the sequence below: </p><ol><li>Give the student both written and oral warning about unsatisfactory academic performance in a timely way, i.e., as soon as there are serious concerns;</li><li>Contact the student’s primary program advisor to discuss the concerns;</li><li>In consultation with the student and the advisor, and the program director if necessary, general concrete guidelines in writing to address the perceived issue and improve performance in the seminar. These written guidelines must be made available to all concerned.</li></ol><p>If, within a reasonable time frame agreed on by the discussants, the student fails to improve performance to the degree that the instructors view that the student should not continue as an enrolled member of the seminar, but should consider alternatives (such as taking the seminar a different year, or more drastically, reconsider continuation in the doctoral program), there must be an<u> independent review of this assessment by the Doctoral Sub-Committee before the student is compelled to withdraw from the seminar.</u></p><h4>Additional Coursework Outside Specialization</h4><p>Satisfactory completion of a minimum of two additional courses outside the specialization is required. These are normally in another tradition, geographical-historical complex, or methodology than the student’s primary focus. The two courses should be in the same area and completed before the general examinations are taken. </p><p>This expected "distribution" of courses in the student's first two years constitutes the minimum amount of course work required, and is designed to assure that a degree of balance between the specialized and general components of a student's program of study is maintained. At the same time it will serve to help the student prepare for the Theory and Methods General Examination that is required at a later stage.</p><h4>Guidelines on Religion 3000, and Religion 3001 and Units of “Time”</h4><p>When a student has already done<em> substantial advanced work</em>, he or she may include one half-course per semester of <strong>Religion 3001. Reading and Research</strong> with the approval of an appropriate faculty member.</p><p><em>Post-generals students (generally after year 4)</em> engaged in dissertation work will normally register for one, two, three or four half-courses of <strong>Religion 3000: Direction of Doctoral Dissertation</strong>, in addition to whatever other regular course-work they may take in a given semester. </p><p>While any number of Religion 3000 and Religion 3001 half-courses may serve to fulfill in part the degree course requirements, units of TIME (TIME-C, TIME-R, or TIME-T) will not.</p><p><strong>TIME-C</strong> (time for course-related reasons) is to be used only for preparation for general examinations, normally during the one or two terms leading up to the anticipated time of generals, <strong>but not before the fifth term</strong>. The only exception to this is in the case of a student who takes the generals in the fourth or fifth term, in which case, TIME-C may be appropriate in the fourth or even third term. Please refer to the GSAS Student Handbook or consult the Program Administrator if you have questions about TIME-C.</p><p>All <strong>Ph.D. Teaching Fellows</strong> will be expected to register for one half-course of <strong>TIME-T</strong> (time for Teaching) per 1/5 teaching time equivalent per semester, irrespective of their stage of progress or year of study in the program. Note that 1/5 is typically one section in a course.</p><p>Any Ph.D. student hired as a Research Assistant will be expected to register for one half-course of TIME-R (time for Research Assistant reasons) per 1/5 research time equivalent per semester, normally 7 to 10 hours a week. Note that the Time-R work is research for someone else (i.e. a faculty member), not for the student’s own research. </p><p> </p><h3>Languages</h3><h4>Language Requirement</h4><p>1. All doctoral students—in consultation with their advisors—achieve at least intermediate reading competence in two modern languages of secondary scholarship relevant to their course of study (such as French, German, Japanese), in addition to whatever primary source languages are required in their field. (Note that languages needed for ethnographic or other research, requiring verbal competence, are for primary scholarship and thus cannot be used as one of the modern languages of secondary scholarship.)</p><p>2. The requirement in modern languages of scholarship commonly taught and examined at Harvard University (French, German, Spanish, etc.) can be met either by achieving a grade of B+ or better in two semesters of a second-year language course (in either HDS or FAS); by receiving a grade of A- or better in the Harvard Divinity School one-semester advanced intermediate language courses in French and German; or by achieving a “high pass” on an HDS qualifying exam. (Note: receiving A- or better in the HDS Summer Language Program does not meet the requirement – the exam must still be taken.) Students whose first language is not English may meet the requirement with a “pass” on the language exam.</p><p>3. In the case of modern languages of scholarship for which there is not an intermediate two-semester course at Harvard or a qualifying exam at HDS, the number of years required to achieve “intermediate reading competence” and the equivalent of “high pass” on language examinations will be determined by faculty in the relevant field. This involves an exam comparable to the HDS qualifying exam: translating a text of moderate difficulty in a one-hour exam with one dictionary, using a text of religious or historical significance or a scriptural text. The student should consult the Ph.D. Administrator or Director of Graduate Studies to arrange the administration of the exam.</p><p>4. All language requirements must be met before General Exams are taken.</p><p>(Ph.D. and Th.D. Language Requirement, adopted Spring 2011)</p><h5>Additional information about languages</h5><p>Students having extraordinary difficulty in passing language requirements are encouraged to contact both the Program Administrator and the Faculty Director of Language Testing.</p><p>Language exams taken as a student in a Masters program at HDS may be used to fulfill the language requirement if the required grade of High Pass was achieved. However, final exam results for the language courses in the Summer Language Program or the full-year German tutorial are not acceptable; doctoral students must take the official language exam. </p><h5>Language Exams</h5><p>Language competency exams are given three times a year: early September, late January and late April. A “High Pass” on a language exam attests that a student has sufficient knowledge and skill to use the language in scholarship. Some mistakes in recognizing grammar or vocabulary are allowed if they do not seriously undermine the student's ability to understand and translate the text. During the one-hour exam, students are asked to translate a one to two page text of intermediate difficulty. Students may use a dictionary.</p><p>Language exams are normally given for Hebrew, Greek, Latin, German, French, Arabic and Spanish. Students who need to be tested in another language should consult the Faculty Director of Language Studies at HDS.</p><p>If you have any preparation in the required languages, you are strongly urged to sign up for and take one or more of the language qualifying exams given in early September of your first year. You may pass the exam, but even if you do not, you will be much better prepared to choose an appropriate course or study on your own before trying again. A failure is recorded on your internal record sheet, but is never released on a transcript.</p><p>Ph.D. students may qualify for a limited number of tuition waivers for summer language courses offered in FAS during the summers immediately preceding and following their first year. Students admitted after fall of 2015 qualify for tuition, program and application fee waivers for enrollment in the HDS Summer Language Program. It is advisable to do coursework prior to the HDS qualifying exam. Copies of prior exams are available from the HDS Registrar.</p><h5>Guidelines for Religion 3002. Foreign Language Certification Course</h5><p><strong>Eligibility:</strong> Students applying to take Religion 3002. Foreign Language Certification to fulfill the language requirement should first have: 1) attempted the Language Qualifying Exam (HDS) and been unsuccessful, and 2) prepared to re-take the language qualifying exam by completing course work at Harvard</p><p><strong>Applying: </strong>A student first must consult with and have permission of 1) the primary advisor, 2) the Faculty Director of Language Studies (HDS), and 3) the proposed instructor of the course.</p><p>After this initial approval, and before registering for the course, the student should submit a list of readings to the instructor of the course and to the Faculty Director of Language Studies for their approval. It is the student's responsibility to collect the readings, in consultation with the instructor and the Faculty Director of Language Studies if necessary, and to provide copies of the approved list to both these faculty members. </p><p><strong>Procedure for certification of coursework:</strong> After completion of the readings, the instructor administers an exam (preferably written; oral with permission) and evaluates the student’s ability to translate. The instructor submits the results to the Faculty Director of Language Studies for certification. The results may take one of two forms: corrected translations or a brief letter describing the translation and the testing method.</p><p>After receiving the evaluation material, the Faculty Director of Language Studies informs the Program Administrator of the evaluation. The instructor reports a grade of “SAT” to the Registrar for recording on the student’s transcript. </p><h3>Second Year Review</h3><p>The main purpose of the Second Year Review is to consider and clarify the overall design and progress of a student’s academic program. There are usually two faculty reviewers: one in the student’s field of specialization, normally the advisor, and one outside the student’s field. A second purpose is to assess the student’s academic progress in general and in regard to the particular program requirements for degree. A third purpose of the Second Year Review is to review the fields that the student is proposing to cover on the General Examinations. </p><p>The Second Year Review should, as needed, lead to any or some of the following recommendations: clarify a timetable for completing any remaining requirements, specify any further coursework, address any issues in advising, and clarify the fields and timetable for General Examinations. A written summary of all such recommendations should be sent to the student as soon as possible after the review and provided to the Program Administrator for the student record.</p><h4>Second Year Review Materials</h4><p>A student participating in the Second Year Review must submit two major course papers to their reviewers; one in the specialization, and one outside their field or discipline, as well a a 1 to 2-page statement of academic purpose. One paper may be from a course taken with one of the reviewers, but the second paper should be from a course taken with some other faculty member, not a reviewer.</p><h4>Procedures for Second Year Review</h4><p>When ready, the student submits to the Program Administrator an "Intent to Take Second Year Review" form. On this form, the review committee and papers are proposed by the student and the advisor, as well as semester to be taken. The review is to occur either in the third or the fourth semester of study.</p><p>The student should schedule a time for the review with the two faculty reviewers and notify the Program Administrator of the meeting date and time. The review normally is 1 to 1 ½ hours. The two papers, a copy of the statement of purpose and an updated review form must be submitted to both reviewers, and the Program Administrator, at least two weeks prior to the meeting.</p><h4>The A.M. Degree</h4><p>In the Study of Religion students are only admitted for the Ph.D. program; no one is admitted as a candidate for the A.M. Nevertheless, the requirements for the master’s degree must be satisfied by all students as they move toward the doctorate, and are expected to be completed by the end of the fourth term.</p><p>The requirements for the A.M. degree are:</p><ul><li>a minimum of two full years of coursework (16 half-courses with a minimum average grade of B) completed;</li><li>the modern language of secondary scholarship requirements met;</li><li>the course requirements outside the specialization fulfilled;</li><li>a satisfactory second year review completed.</li></ul><p><span>For students who take a terminal A.M., a second year review is not required. The A.M. degree may be granted when these requirements are fulfilled. In order to receive the degree, Ph.D. students may log in to my.harvard, request a Master’s in Passing, and apply as soon as their requirements are complete and recorded.</span></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

      <h2 class="block-title">Forms for Current Students in Ph.D. Program</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1476823074' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>These forms are for students who are *enrolled* in the Ph.D. program. <strong>Do *not* request access</strong> if you are applying to the Ph.D. program.</p><ul><li><a href="https://docs.google.com/a/harvard.edu/document/d/16wlb4LD2NgMteJ7X0q_9d418vFBUBU1qjjcrFOXdP2I/edit?usp=sharing" title="">Plan of Study</a></li><li><a href="https://goo.gl/forms/w80b6mQGPVRBOIi33" title="">Intent to Take the Second Year Review</a></li><li><a href="https://goo.gl/forms/qrVDPsjLzTIIeWM32" title="">Intent to Take General Exams</a></li><li><a href="https://docs.google.com/a/harvard.edu/document/d/1uLO2yz184gawZctHd6uawOwB4auSDdueAnmytjk3TGY/edit?usp=sharing" title="">Dissertation Prospectus Checklist</a></li></ul></div></div></div>

<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>

  </article>
</div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1374503596" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374503596"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Teaching Fellows</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374503596' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><em> <a href="http://projects.iq.harvard.edu/teachingfellows_studyofreligion">Teaching Fellows in the Study of Religion Site</a></em><br /> 2016-17 <em>Departmental Teaching Fellow (FAS) is Tyler Schwaller<br /> Departmental Teaching Fellow (HDS) is Eleanor Craig </em></li>
<li><a href="http://bokcenter.harvard.edu/" target="_blank">The Derek Bok Center for Teaching and Learning</a> <br /><em>Contains many resources for teaching and professional development</em></li>
<li><a href="http://icg.harvard.edu/" target="_blank">FAS IT - Academic Technology Group</a> <br /><em>For information about course iSites, the PITF program, and teaching with technology</em></li>
</ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1374086901" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374086901"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Related Organizations at Harvard</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374086901' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><em>Many of these organizations have their own events calendars and mailing lists. We do not usually repeat events from the mailing lists of other organizations in our own newsletter, so if you are interested in staying up to date, you are encouraged to subscribe to the appropriate mailing list.</em></p><table border="0" style="width:642px; height:284px"><tr><td><ul><li><p><a href="http://hds.harvard.edu/">Harvard Divinity School</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://cswr.hds.harvard.edu/home">Center for the Study of World Religions at the Harvard Divinity School</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://wsrp.hds.harvard.edu/home">Women's Studies in Religion Program at the Harvard Divinity School</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://rpp.hds.harvard.edu/">Religions and the Practice of Peace Initiative</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://mahindrahumanities.fas.harvard.edu/">Mahindra Humanities Center</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://pluralism.org/">The Pluralism Project</a> </p></li><li><p><a href="http://wcfia.harvard.edu/">Weatherhead Center for International Affairs</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://www.islamicstudies.harvard.edu/">The Prince Alwaleed Bin Talal Islamic Studies Program</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://www.doaks.org/" title="">Dumbarton Oaks Research Library and Collection</a></p></li></ul></td><td><ul><li><p><a href="http://cmes.fas.harvard.edu">Harvard University Center For Middle Eastern Studies</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://southasiainstitute.harvard.edu/">Harvard University South Asia Institute</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://asiacenter.harvard.edu/">Harvard University Asia Center</a> </p></li><li><p><a href="http://rijs.fas.harvard.edu/">Reischauer Institute of Japanese Studies</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://fairbank.fas.harvard.edu/">Fairbank Center for Chinese Studies</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://hutchinscenter.fas.harvard.edu/">Hutchins Center for African and African American Research</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://iaas.fas.harvard.edu/">Committee on Inner Asia and Altaic Studies</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://isites.harvard.edu/icb/icb.do?keyword=k21071" target="_blank">Harvard Buddhist Studies Forum</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://chaplains.harvard.edu/">Harvard Chaplains</a></p></li></ul></td></tr></table></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-first"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374504020" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374504020"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">General Resources for Students</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374504020' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="http://registrar.fas.harvard.edu/five-year-calendar" target="_blank">FAS 5-Year Academic Calendar</a></li><li><a href="http://my.harvard.edu/" target="_blank">My.Harvard</a></li><li><a href="http://www.huhousing.harvard.edu/HarvardUniversityHousing/index.aspx" target="_blank">Harvard Real Estate Services</a><br /><em>Area apartments and on-campus housing</em></li></ul><div> </div><h4>PhD Students</h4><ul><li><a href="https://gsas.harvard.edu/audiences/students">GSAS Student Resources</a></li><li><a href="https://gsas.harvard.edu/financial-support/fellowships" target="_blank">GSAS Fellowships Office</a></li><li><a href="http://www.gsas.harvard.edu/current_students/financial_aid.php" target="_blank">GSAS Office of Financial Aid</a></li></ul><div> </div><h4>ThD Students</h4><ul><li><a href="http://www.hds.harvard.edu/academics/registrar" target="_blank">HDS Registrar</a></li><li><a href="http://www.hds.harvard.edu/academics/registrar/academic-calendar" target="_blank">HDS Academic Calendar</a></li><li><a href="http://www.hds.harvard.edu/life-at-hds" target="_blank">HDS Community Life Resources</a></li></ul><p> </p></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374504428" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374504428"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Teaching Beyond Harvard</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374504428' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><em></em><a href="http://chronicle.com/jobs/100/500" target="_blank"><em>Chronicle of Higher Education</em> - Job Listings</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.aarweb.org/employment-services/employment-listings">American Academy of Religion - Job Listings</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.excollege.tufts.edu" target="_blank">Tufts Experimental College</a> - <em>Regularly seeks submissions for this course program</em></li>
</ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>																	</div>

								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-31161"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/academics"  class="active-trail active">Academics</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-31166"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/undergraduate" >Undergraduate</a></li><li class="last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-31171"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/doctoral"  class="active-trail active">Doctoral</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first collapsed menu-depth-3 menu-item-31306"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/phd-program" >PhD Program &amp; Timeline</a></li><li class="leaf active-trail active-trail menu-depth-3 menu-item-33061"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/links-doctoral-students"  class="active-trail active active">Links for Doctoral Students</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-3 menu-item-32971"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/faqs-doctoral" >FAQ&#039;s: Doctoral</a></li><li class="last collapsed menu-depth-3 menu-item-31311"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/thd-program" >ThD Program</a></li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1377194947" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1377194947"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Financial Forms</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1377194947' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><em>You may submit forms by email, mail or fax. If you are a visitor, the Student &amp; Visitor Reimbursement Form and a W-9 are required.</em></p><ul><li><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/hcominequalityfellows_0.pdf">Student &amp; Visitor Reimbursement Form</a> <em>*Be sure to include your current address to avoid errors in mailed payments. </em></li><li><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/w9_form.pdf">W-9</a> <em>*A new W-9 is required if you have not been <strong>REIMBURSED (this is different from being paid)</strong> <span style="text-decoration:underline">in the last 6 months</span>.</em></li><li><a href="https://www.uscis.gov/i-9-central">I-9</a> <em>The link takes you to the most current I-9 info; downloadable from their homepage. In order to TF, you must have an I-9 on file.</em></li><li><a href="https://www.irs.gov/Forms-&amp;-Pubs">W-4 Employee Withholding Form</a></li><li><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/fn_oracle_vendor_request_form.pdf?m=1460150181">Foreign Individual Vendor Request Form</a><br />Foreign individuals should submit this form instead of a W-9. After submitting this form, individuals will also need to complete the GLACIER program (an online Self-Service tool to determine U.S. residency status) and submit required documents to the NRA Tax Group office. The individual will receive an email from <a href="mailto:support@online-tax.net">support@online-tax.net</a> providing information on how to log into the GLACIER program.  A hold will be automatically placed until the individual submits the GLACIER documents to the NRA Tax Group.</li><li><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/huuef4-writable.pdf">Faculty Universal Expense Form</a></li></ul><p><em>*Paper clips please - thank you!</em></p><p> </p></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1374503911" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374503911"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Room Reservations</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374503911' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="http://registrar.fas.harvard.edu/faculty-staff/classrooms">FAS Classrooms</a><br /><em>Schedules classroom and event spaces outside of departmental rooms. Rooms can be requested and viewed via <a href="http://roombook.fas.harvard.edu/">RoomBook</a>. Questions: <a href="mailto:classrms@fas.harvard.edu">classrms@fas.harvard.edu</a> <br /></em></p>
<p><a href="http://fas.harvard.edu/%7Ecsrel/" target="_blank">The Study of Religion </a> <br /><em>Barker Center CSR Seminar Room (403), small meeting room (303), or teaching fellow office (408). Priority is given to CSR courses and faculty, then section meetings, followed by one-time events (both internal and external) Contact Staff Assistant: <a href="http://fas.harvard.edu/%7Ecsrel/" target="_blank">csrel@fas.harvard.edu</a><br /></em></p>
<p><a href="http://fas.harvard.edu/%7Ecsrel/" target="_blank">Barker Center Special Events<br /></a><em>The Thompson Room (Barker 110) is the large gathering space on the 1st floor. It is scheduled via <a href="http://roombook.fas.harvard.edu/">RoomBook</a>. <br /></em></p>
<p><a href="http://imsroombook.fas.harvard.edu/">View the Inventory of Classroom Spaces</a><br /><em>Select "<a href="http://ims.fas.harvard.edu/classrooms/browse.php">Browse by Buildings</a>" for the quickest views.<br /></em></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1472248730" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_media"  module="boxes" delta="1472248730"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Doctoral Program Calendar</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1472248730' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id="file-697671" class="file file-html file-html-embed">

					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/undergraduate" >UNDERGRADUATE</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Resources for Undergraduates                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374086901" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374086901"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Related Organizations at Harvard</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374086901' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><em>Many of these organizations have their own events calendars and mailing lists. We do not usually repeat events from the mailing lists of other organizations in our own newsletter, so if you are interested in staying up to date, you are encouraged to subscribe to the appropriate mailing list.</em></p><table border="0" style="width:642px; height:284px"><tr><td><ul><li><p><a href="http://hds.harvard.edu/">Harvard Divinity School</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://cswr.hds.harvard.edu/home">Center for the Study of World Religions at the Harvard Divinity School</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://wsrp.hds.harvard.edu/home">Women's Studies in Religion Program at the Harvard Divinity School</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://rpp.hds.harvard.edu/">Religions and the Practice of Peace Initiative</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://mahindrahumanities.fas.harvard.edu/">Mahindra Humanities Center</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://pluralism.org/">The Pluralism Project</a> </p></li><li><p><a href="http://wcfia.harvard.edu/">Weatherhead Center for International Affairs</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://www.islamicstudies.harvard.edu/">The Prince Alwaleed Bin Talal Islamic Studies Program</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://www.doaks.org/" title="">Dumbarton Oaks Research Library and Collection</a></p></li></ul></td><td><ul><li><p><a href="http://cmes.fas.harvard.edu">Harvard University Center For Middle Eastern Studies</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://southasiainstitute.harvard.edu/">Harvard University South Asia Institute</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://asiacenter.harvard.edu/">Harvard University Asia Center</a> </p></li><li><p><a href="http://rijs.fas.harvard.edu/">Reischauer Institute of Japanese Studies</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://fairbank.fas.harvard.edu/">Fairbank Center for Chinese Studies</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://hutchinscenter.fas.harvard.edu/">Hutchins Center for African and African American Research</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://iaas.fas.harvard.edu/">Committee on Inner Asia and Altaic Studies</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://isites.harvard.edu/icb/icb.do?keyword=k21071" target="_blank">Harvard Buddhist Studies Forum</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://chaplains.harvard.edu/">Harvard Chaplains</a></p></li></ul></td></tr></table></div></div></div>
  </div></section><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-64781" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
      </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-first"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374178945" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374178945"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Plan of Study Forms for Undergraduates</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374178945' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_a_2014-15_writeable.doc">Option A: Two Major Traditions in Comparative Context</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_b_2014-15_writeable.doc">Option B: One Major Tradition in Comparative Context</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_c_2014-15_writeable.doc">*Option C: Joint Concentration with Religion as the Primary Field</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_option_d_2014-15_writeable.doc">*Option D: Joint Concentration with Religion as a Allied Field</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_secondary_field_2014-15_writeable.doc">Religion as a Secondary Field</a></li>
</ul><p>*Students pursuing a Joint Concentration must also complete the college form<a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/joint_conc_app_2_-_without_list_of_programs.pdf"> "Joint Concentration Application".</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>									<div class="region region-content-second"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1374515432" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374515432"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Undergraduate Resources</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374515432' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="http://osl.fas.harvard.edu/icb/icb.do?keyword=k65178&amp;pageid=icb.page305611">Office of Student Life – Student Organizations</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ocs.fas.harvard.edu/">Office of Career Services</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.funding.fas.harvard.edu/">Harvard College Funding Sources</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.college.harvard.edu/icb/icb.do?keyword=k61161&amp;pageid=icb.page257820">Harvard College</a></li>
<li><a href="http://oie.fas.harvard.edu/">Office of International Education</a></li>
<li><a href="http://cuhs.harvard.edu/">Harvard’s Committee on the Use of Human Subjects</a></li>
</ul><p>Register your travel abroad for emergency support:<br /><a href="https://www.globalsupport.harvard.edu/travel-tools">www.globalsupport.harvard.edu/travel-tools</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1374163646" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374163646"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Guides &amp; Handbooks</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374163646' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul><li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/religious_studies_guide_print_10-1-13.pdf">Guide to Writing in the Study of Religion</a></li>
<li><a href="http://writing.fas.harvard.edu/" target="_blank">Writing Resources at Harvard</a></li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/ab_handbook_2016-7_final_0.pdf">Undergraduate Handbook</a> (2016-17)</li>
<li><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/senior_thesis_handbook_2015-16_student.pdf">Senior Thesis Handbook</a> (2015-16)</li>
</ul></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>																	</div>

				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-146421"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/undergraduate"  class="active-trail active">Undergraduate</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32966"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/faqs-undergraduate-program" >FAQ&#039;s: Undergraduate Program</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-35426"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/courses" >Courses</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32561"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/admission" >Concentrating</a></li><li class="collapsed menu-depth-2 menu-item-32581"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/advising" >Advising</a></li><li class="collapsed menu-depth-2 menu-item-32596"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/coursework" >Coursework</a></li><li class="leaf active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-33086"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/links-undergraduates"  class="active-trail active active">Resources for Undergraduates</a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-39351"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/beyond-harvard-0" >Beyond Harvard</a></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1373989095" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1373989095"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Concentration Questions?</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1373989095' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/courtney-bickel-lamberth">Director of Undergraduate Studies, Courtney Lamberth</a></p>
<p><a href="mailto:kstreet@fas.harvard.edu">Assistant Director of Undergraduate Studies, Kera Street</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1364321266" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1364321266"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Words from our Students</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1364321266' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><address>"The structure of the concentration gives students a lot of flexibility and freedom to explore the religions and themes they're interested in. In my experience, the professors are also very involved and want to get to know you on a personal level, which is something you don't get in the larger concentrations." – Hebert, '13</address></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>
		<!--footer region beg-->
		<footer id="footer" class="clearfix" role="contentinfo">
		<!-- Three column 3x33 Gpanel -->
		
			<div class="at-panel gpanel panel-display footer clearfix">

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1371845153' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id="file-53886" class="file file-image file-image-png">

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-site_info' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h1><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >Committee on the Study of Religion</a></h1>
    
    <p>
    </p></div></div></div>
  </div></div></div></div>					  					  <div class="region region-header-third"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-secondary-menu" class="block block-os no-title"  module="os" delta="secondary-menu"><div class="block-inner clearfix">

			<div class="hg-container">

class="count">(7)</span></a></li><li class="term-religion-and-society"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/research-areas-duplicated-doctoral-students/religion-and-society" href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/research-areas-duplicated-doctoral-students/religion-gender-and-culture"  class="" title="">Religion, Gender and Culture <span class="count">(8)</span></a></li><li class="term-religions-of-the-americas"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/research-areas-duplicated-doctoral-students/religions-americas"  class="" title="">Religions of the Americas <span class="count">(7)</span></a></li><li class="term-south-asian-religions"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/research-areas-duplicated-doctoral-students/south-asian-religions"  class="" title="">South Asian Religions <span class="count">(2)</span></a></li><li class="term-theology"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/research-areas-duplicated-doctoral-students/theology"  class="" title="">Theology <span class="count">(9)</span></a></li></ul></div></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>
		<!--footer region beg-->
		<footer id="footer" class="clearfix" role="contentinfo">

          <h2 class="element-invisible"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/religion-footer.png?m=1479879567">religion-footer.png</a></h2>

			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												Buddhist Studies											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<div  class="os-taxonomy-term depth-0"><div class="term-listing-heading"></div><article id="node-75866" class="node node-person node-teaser article with-person-photo modified-in-os_profiles_process_node clearfix" role="article">

      
    
    <div class="field field-name-field-person-photo field-type-imagefield-crop field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser">
    <div class="field-items">
            <div class="field-item even">
      <figure>

class="count">(7)</span></a></li><li class="term-history-of-christianity"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/research-areas-duplicated-doctoral-students/history-christianity" href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/research-areas-duplicated-doctoral-students/islamic-studies"  class="" title="">Islamic Studies <span class="count">(12)</span></a></li><li class="term-new-testament-and-early-christianity"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/research-areas-duplicated-doctoral-students/new-testament-and-early-christianity"  class="" title="">New Testament and Early Christianity <span class="count">(15)</span></a></li><li class="term-philosophy-of-religion"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/research-areas-duplicated-doctoral-students/philosophy-religion"  class="" title="">Philosophy of Religion <span class="count">(7)</span></a></li><li class="term-religion-and-society"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/research-areas-duplicated-doctoral-students/religion-and-society"  class="" title="">Religion and Society <span class="count">(10)</span></a></li><li class="term-religion-gender-and-culture"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/research-areas-duplicated-doctoral-students/religion-gender-and-culture"  class="" title="">Religion, Gender and Culture <span class="count">(8)</span></a></li><li class="term-religions-of-the-americas"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/research-areas-duplicated-doctoral-students/religions-americas"  class="" title="">Religions of the Americas <span class="count">(7)</span></a></li><li class="term-south-asian-religions"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/research-areas-duplicated-doctoral-students/south-asian-religions"  class="" title="">South Asian Religions <span class="count">(2)</span></a></li><li class="term-theology"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/research-areas-duplicated-doctoral-students/theology"  class="" title="">Theology <span class="count">(9)</span></a></li></ul></div></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>
		<!--footer region beg-->
		<footer id="footer" class="clearfix" role="contentinfo">

          <h2 class="element-invisible"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/files/religion/files/religion-footer.png?m=1479879567">religion-footer.png</a></h2>

			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>

								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1372191016" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_taxonomy_fbt"  module="boxes" delta="1372191016"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Filter by Role</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1372191016' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div class="item-list"><ul><li class="term-administrative-staff"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/profile-type/staff"  class="" title="Chair, DUS, ADUS, Program Director/s, Staff Assistant, etc.">Administrative Staff <span class="count">(7)</span></a></li><li class="term-undergraduate-advisors"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/profile-type/undergraduate-advisors"  class="" title="">Undergraduate Advisors <span class="count">(16)</span></a></li><li class="term-committee-members"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/profile-type/committee-members"  class="" title="">Committee Members <span class="count">(31)</span></a></li><li class="term-faculty"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/profile-type/faculty"  class="" title="">Faculty <span class="count">(65)</span></a></li><li class="term-faculty-emeriti"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/profile-type/faculty-emeriti"  class="" title="Faculty who hold a research appointment or may only be teaching one course per year. These faculty members are not taking on doctoral students.">Faculty Emeriti <span class="count">(6)</span></a></li><li class="term-doctoral-students-phd"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/profile-type/doctoral-students"  class="" title="">Doctoral Students (PhD) <span class="count">(84)</span></a></li><li class="term-doctoral-students-thd"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/profile-type/doctoral-students-thd"  class="" title="">Doctoral Students (ThD) <span class="count">(24)</span></a></li><li class="term-alumni"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/profile-type/alumni"  class="" title="">Alumni <span class="count">(16)</span></a></li></ul></div></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1374158242" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374158242"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Harvard University Directory</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374158242' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>
	<a href="https://www.directory.harvard.edu/" title="">Harvard Public Directory</a>
</p>

<p>
	<span style="color:#000000">Please refer to the public directory for the most up-to-date contact information.</span>
</p>
</div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1374003877" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_taxonomy_fbt"  module="boxes" delta="1374003877"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Faculty by Research Area</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374003877' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div class="item-list"><ul><li class="term-african-religions"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/research-area/african-religions"  class="" title="">African Religions <span class="count">(5)</span></a></li><li class="term-buddhist-studies"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/research-area/buddhist-studies"  class="" title="">Buddhist Studies <span class="count">(6)</span></a></li><li class="term-comparative-studies"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/research-area/comparative-studies"  class="" title="">Comparative Studies <span class="count">(9)</span></a></li><li class="term-east-asian-religions"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/research-area/east-asian-religions"  class="" title="">East Asian Religions <span class="count">(4)</span></a></li><li class="term-ethics"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/research-area/ethics"  class="" title="">Ethics <span class="count">(5)</span></a></li><li class="term-greco-roman-religions"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/research-area/greco-roman-religions"  class="" title="">Greco-Roman Religions <span class="count">(2)</span></a></li><li class="term-hebrew-bible-old-testament"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/research-area/hebrew-bibleold-testament"  class="" title="">Hebrew Bible/Old Testament <span class="count">(4)</span></a></li><li class="term-history-of-christianity"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/research-area/history-christianity"  class="" title="">History of Christianity <span class="count">(18)</span></a></li><li class="term-islamic-studies"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/research-area/islamic-studies"  class="" title="">Islamic Studies <span class="count">(8)</span></a></li><li class="term-jewish-studies"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/research-area/jewish-studies"  class="" title="">Jewish Studies <span class="count">(5)</span></a></li><li class="term-new-testament-and-early-christianity"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/research-area/new-testament-and-early-christianity"  class="" title="">New Testament and Early Christianity <span class="count">(5)</span></a></li><li class="term-philosophy-of-religion"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/research-area/philosophy-religion"  class="" title="">Philosophy of Religion <span class="count">(5)</span></a></li><li class="term-religion-and-society"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/research-area/religion-and-society"  class="" title="">Religion and Society <span class="count">(9)</span></a></li><li class="term-religion-gender-and-culture"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/research-area/religion-gender-and-culture"  class="" title="">Religion, Gender and Culture <span class="count">(10)</span></a></li><li class="term-religions-of-late-antiquity-judaism-and-christianity"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/research-area/religions-late-antiquity-judaism-and-christianity"  class="" title="">Religions of Late Antiquity: Judaism and Christianity <span class="count">(6)</span></a></li><li class="term-religions-of-the-americas"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/research-area/religions-americas"  class="" title="">Religions of the Americas <span class="count">(14)</span></a></li><li class="term-south-asian-religions"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/research-area/south-asian-religions"  class="" title="">South Asian Religions <span class="count">(7)</span></a></li><li class="term-theology"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/research-area/theology"  class="active" title="">Theology <span class="count">(10)</span></a></li></ul></div></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1377706640" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_taxonomy_fbt"  module="boxes" delta="1377706640"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Doctoral Students by Research Area</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1377706640' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div class="item-list"><ul><li class="term-african-religions"><a 	<div id="page-wrapper">

		
					<!--header regions beg-->
			<header id="header" class="clearfix" role="banner">

				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-1372191016" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_taxonomy_fbt"  module="boxes" delta="1372191016"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Filter by Role</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1372191016' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div class="item-list"><ul><li class="term-administrative-staff"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/profile-type/staff"  class="" title="Chair, DUS, ADUS, Program Director/s, Staff Assistant, etc.">Administrative Staff <span class="count">(7)</span></a></li><li class="term-undergraduate-advisors"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/profile-type/undergraduate-advisors"  class="" title="">Undergraduate Advisors <span class="count">(16)</span></a></li><li class="term-committee-members"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/profile-type/committee-members"  class="" title="">Committee Members <span class="count">(31)</span></a></li><li class="term-faculty"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/profile-type/faculty"  class="" title="">Faculty <span class="count">(65)</span></a></li><li class="term-faculty-emeriti"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/profile-type/faculty-emeriti"  class="" title="Faculty who hold a research appointment or may only be teaching one course per year. These faculty members are not taking on doctoral students.">Faculty Emeriti <span class="count">(6)</span></a></li><li class="term-doctoral-students-phd"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/profile-type/doctoral-students"  class="" title="">Doctoral Students (PhD) <span class="count">(84)</span></a></li><li class="term-doctoral-students-thd"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/profile-type/doctoral-students-thd"  class="" title="">Doctoral Students (ThD) <span class="count">(24)</span></a></li><li class="term-alumni"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/profile-type/alumni"  class="" title="">Alumni <span class="count">(16)</span></a></li></ul></div></div></div></div>
