				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-boxes-os-pages-section-nav" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_sectionnav section-nav no-title"  module="boxes" delta="os_pages_section_nav"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-146421"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/undergraduate"  class="active-trail active active">Undergraduate</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32966"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/faqs-undergraduate-program" >FAQ&#039;s: Undergraduate Program</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-35426"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/courses" >Courses</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-32561"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/admission" >Concentrating</a></li><li class="collapsed menu-depth-2 menu-item-32581"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/advising" >Advising</a></li><li class="collapsed menu-depth-2 menu-item-32596"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/coursework" >Coursework</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-33086"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/links-undergraduates" >Resources for Undergraduates</a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-39351"><a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/pages/beyond-harvard-0" >Beyond Harvard</a></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>
  </div></div><section id="block-boxes-1373989095" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1373989095"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Concentration Questions?</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1373989095' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p><a href="http://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/people/courtney-bickel-lamberth">Director of Undergraduate Studies, Courtney Lamberth</a></p>
<p><a href="mailto:kstreet@fas.harvard.edu">Assistant Director of Undergraduate Studies, Kera Street</a></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1364321266" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1364321266"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Words from our Students</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1364321266' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><address>"The structure of the concentration gives students a lot of flexibility and freedom to explore the religions and themes they're interested in. In my experience, the professors are also very involved and want to get to know you on a personal level, which is something you don't get in the larger concentrations." – Hebert, '13</address></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1374086388" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_boxes_html"  module="boxes" delta="1374086388"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Approved Traditions and Themes</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374086388' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><h3>Approved Traditions</h3>
<ul><li>Ancient Near Eastern / Israelite</li>
<li>Buddhist</li>
<li>Christian</li>
<li>East Asian</li>
<li>Greek-Hellenistic-Roman</li>
<li>Hindu</li>
<li>Islamic</li>
<li>Judaic</li>
<li>Modern Western / Religions of the Americas</li>
<li>South Asian</li>
<li>African and Afro-Atlantic Religions</li>
</ul><h3>Approved Themes</h3>
<ul><li>Religion and Gender</li>
<li>Religion and Society</li>
<li>Religion and the Arts</li>
<li>Philosophy of Religion</li>
</ul><p><em>It may be possible to substitute other traditions or themes depending on faculty and course offerings.</em></p></div></div></div>
  </div></section><section id="block-boxes-1374164267" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_sv_list_box"  module="boxes" delta="1374164267"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">FAQs for Undergraduates</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1374164267' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id='box-1374164267-page' data-page='0' data-delta='1374164267' class='os-sv-list os_sv_list_box sv-list-faq sv-list-view-full sv-list-layout-list sv-grid-3'><article id="node-57536" class="node node-faq article clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  
      <header class="toggle node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/do-people-who-concentrate-religion-also-practice-certain-religion-do-you-have-believe" rel="bookmark" target="_top">Do people who concentrate in religion also practice a religion?</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="os-slider node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Some of our students are religious and some are not. Those who are religious practice different faiths—Judaism, Islam, Christianity, Buddhism, Hinduism and others. There is no presumption that students in religion will believe in God or practice a certain faith.</p></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-og-vocabulary field-type-entityreference field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">See also: <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq-taxonomy/undergraduate"  target="_top">Undergraduate</a></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-63851" class="node node-faq article clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  
      <header class="toggle node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/why-should-i-concentrate-religion-0" rel="bookmark" target="_top">Why should I concentrate in Religion?</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="os-slider node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">In the religion program students study a range of human experiences that have produced much of the greatest literature of the world, inspired its art and philosophy and shaped its moral consciousness. As a small concentration at Harvard, the Study of Religion is an intimate community within the larger university. Religion students regularly interact with faculty members and graduate students who share their interests. Tutorials are small (frequently one-on-one) and tailored to student interests. Student satisfaction with our program is consistently very high.</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-og-vocabulary field-type-entityreference field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">See also: <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq-taxonomy/undergraduate"  target="_top">Undergraduate</a></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-63891" class="node node-faq article clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  
      <header class="toggle node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/can-i-concentrate-religion-and-still-go-law-or-medical-school" rel="bookmark" target="_top">Can I concentrate in religion and still go to law or medical school?</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="os-slider node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">Yes! Many of our concentrators do. Prepare to take the classes necessary for graduate school in your chosen field in addition to fulfilling our concentration requirements.</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-og-vocabulary field-type-entityreference field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">See also: <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq-taxonomy/undergraduate"  target="_top">Undergraduate</a></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-63896" class="node node-faq article clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  
      <header class="toggle node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/can-courses-%E2%80%9Cdouble-count%E2%80%9D-meet-both-gen-ed-and-concentration-requirements" rel="bookmark" target="_top">Can courses “double-count” for both Gen Ed and Religion requirements?</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="os-slider node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Yes!</p></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-og-vocabulary field-type-entityreference field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">See also: <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq-taxonomy/undergraduate"  target="_top">Undergraduate</a></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-63921" class="node node-faq article clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  
      <header class="toggle node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/if-i-transfer-religion-another-concentration-sophomore-or-junior-can-i-get-credit" rel="bookmark" target="_top">Can I transfer from another concentration as a sophomore or junior and get credit for tutorials taken in other departments?</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="os-slider node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Yes, this is possible. Make an appointment to see the Director of Undergraduate Studies, and be sure to bring with you syllabi from your other tutorials and a completed <a href="pages/concentration-plans" target="_top">Plan of Study from the Study of Religion</a>.</p></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-og-vocabulary field-type-entityreference field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">See also: <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq-taxonomy/undergraduate"  target="_top">Undergraduate</a></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-63991" class="node node-faq article clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  
      <header class="toggle node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq/what-happens-if-i%E2%80%99ve-been-away-harvard-and-requirements-my-field-changed-while-i-was" rel="bookmark" target="_top">What happens if I’ve been away from Harvard and the requirements for my field changed while I was gone?</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="os-slider node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Normally you will be allowed to complete your work in the Study of Religion under the guidelines that existed when you entered the program. See the <a href="pages/coursework" target="_top">Coursework section for historical handbooks</a>.</p></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-og-vocabulary field-type-entityreference field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">See also: <a href="https://studyofreligion.fas.harvard.edu/faq-taxonomy/undergraduate"  target="_top">Undergraduate</a></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>
